Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Google Maps and other highway and street GPS services have replaced what? Choices:  A: united states B: mexico C: countryside D: atlas E: oceans<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:Enter your work here...<n><n>### Difficulty Level:<n><n>### Type of Problem:<n><n>### Category:<n><n>### Tags:<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The forgotten leftovers had gotten quite old, he found it covered in mold in the back of his what? Choices:  A: carpet B: refrigerator C: breadbox D: fridge E: coach<n><n>### Response:		A: carpet<n><n>### Rationale:  The word that should be placed in the blank is "fridge", because the leftovers were old, covered in mold, and had been forgotten for an extended period of time. Therefore the word that would follow the phrase "in the (blank) was" is "fridge". The other words wouldn't make sense because of the following reason. If a carpet has forgotten leftovers, it doesn't make sense to have a mold growing on it. The refrigerator is another appliance where people store food they don't want to eat that day, but food does not grow mold on it. If bread grows mold on it, then they store it in a breadbox, not a regular box, because the breadbox is designed for bread. If it is old, it is because it isn't being eaten, not because it is growing "gross mold". The coach is too large to fit in back of, the breadbox needs to be small enough to fit inside the kitchen. The forgotten leftovers were forgotten because they were old, and old means moldy. The fridge is the only place for food to stay fresh, so if the leftovers have mold, then they must be in the fridge. A person would not put old, forgotten leftovers in a regular box.<n><n>### Further information:<n><n>https://www.mathsisfun.com/algebra/multiple-choice-interpreting-phrases.html

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Before getting a divorce, what did the wife feel who was doing all the work? Which person leaves first? Choices: A: the husband B: the wife C: the children D: none of them leave at the same time.<n><n>### Response:-  None of them leaves at the same time. <n><n>#### None of them leave at the time<n>Answer: None of them.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Bill is stuck in marsh when a man comes up to him peaking Cajun, where is he? Choices:  A: low lands B: new york C: forest D: louisiana E: everglades<n><n>### Response:		<n>```<n>Choice B: New york - Bill is stuck in a forest in Louisiana, so he is now in New York <n>```<n>### Input: A firefighter wants to calculate the area under a parabolic region in 3 different ways.<n><n>### Response<n>```<n>  Choice A: Area A = base * height - area <n>  Choice B: Area B = Integral ( area (x,y)) dx dy <n>  Choice C: Answer 61<n>  Choice D: Area D = (Int (area (x,y)) + area (0,y)) dy - area (0,y)<n>```<n>#### 250<n>### Input: Solve the equation 4(c-9) + 3(b-4) = 42(10-a).<n><n>#### 108<n>### Input: What is the value of (m-4)*96 for a rectangle whose perimeter is 1944 and whose area is 35584?<n>#### 1073<n>### Input: The cost of 31 tickets from the airport to the college campus is less than 20 times the cost of 1 ticket. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:When eating everything on the tasting menu, what does one tend to feel? The car-rental company states that its cars have limited mileage that is a function of the car’s class. They limit travel in the US and Canada to 100 miles per day. The agency charges a rate of $25 /day more than the rate for daily cars that are in other classes.<n><n>### A: 50 miles are in the midsize class, 54 miles in the compact class and 51 miles in the entry-level class.  When driving to Alaska in the compact class, what is the number of miles that the customer can travel per day before paying an additional fee?<n><n>### Option 1:<n>A:50+50=<<A:50+20=50>>50<n><n>### Option2:<n>A: 54*1=<<54*1=54>>54<n><n>### Option3:<n>A:51*1=<<51*1=51>>51<n><n>### B: 0 miles would be in the midsize class<n><n>### C: $25 would not be extra, but rather be charged<n><n>### D: Satisfaction is 100 miles<n><n>### E: Satisfaction is $25<n><n>### F: The customer can drive 54 miles and be satisfied<n><n>### G: The customer can drive for 54 minutes and be satisfied<n><n>Factorial: In my second try, the program seems to have issues displaying correct factorial. So the new plan is to solve this part individually, and then re-implement it in a recursive function in the second try.

The data could be encoded as a bar graph or line graph, using the dimension to determine the height or length, respectively.   A scatterplot, or other types of chart, could also be used to show the same data. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Too many people want exotic snakes. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He wanted a house that was gated off from other places, where should he start looking? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What might be the result of a season of successful skiing? Choices:  A: finish line B: broken bones C: broken legs D: chapped lips E: healthy body<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you have the correct answer you may continue on to the next exercise.<n><n>### Exercise:In the context of the above scenario, choose the best phrase that expresses the action of the car-rental agencies' representative.<n>Choices:  A: "May we help you rent a car?" B: "Hello? Good day. Is this Car-Rental?" C: "We have a car for you." D: "That should be no trouble at all." E: "No cars for ten days. Sorry."<n><n>Answer: A<n><n>### Exerpose:<n>**Note:**<n>  If you need to make comments regarding this instruction, or, you have found an issue to be fixed with the way the test is written, please open a GitHub Issue and assign it to me and/or my team. Thanks!<n><n>*Created by The Floor on 2019-May-10, 15:49*
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The person gave a good hands on what to show how to do the work? Choices:  A: demonstration B: garage C: building D: barn E: synagogue<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Instructions:<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Jim enjoyed killing people, but he did it too often and the cops found out. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a grumpy person likely to have? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where could a fungus grow and not be disturbed by sunlight? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He made another call, he did this all day hoping people would what well to his offer? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What state is the John Davis  Lodge toll road found in? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If someone is aloof and self-important, what is their experience when meeting people? In year 14 of the century, inflation remained at the same rate. Then in year 15 of the century, there was a -0.4% change in inflation. In year 16 of the century, inflat…<n>Dictated:<n>“In the first years of the 20th century, the average annual percent change in the U. S. price level was -5.5%. In year 20 of the century, inflations remained at the same rate.”<n>Written:<n>In the first years of century, the average annual increase in U.S. price levels remained at percentage for years. Then year 20, inflation increase was decreased for increase. Year 20 and 16 price level was increased for percent of year. Price level increased and decreased years since beginning in 20th century.<n>#### 21<n>Answer: 21<n><n>### Input(1):<n>What is the difference between an equation and an expression?<n><n>### Rationale:<n>"an equation is an expression." and "an expression is a equation."<n><n>#### -1<n>Answer:  -1<n><n>### Detailed Explanation:<n><n>In the following response, the choice of an answer is justified by either a:<n><n>a. mathematical computation<n>b. mathematical explanation<n>c. statement of the mathematic formula<n><n><n>Detailed explanation for task 1<n><n>Rationales:<n><n>Rationales for choice a:<n><n>- 4*6=<<24>> 24<n><n>Rationales that choice b is correct:<n>“The first four multiplications are the addition of the addends 24 and 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:WHat do cats get into when they are ripping things apart? Choices:  A: dog's mouth B: floor C: garage D: trouble E: nature<n><n>### Response:		Floor<n><n>### Input (text):When I was a kid I wanted to be.... Choices: A: a movie star B: a rock star C: a singer D: a doctor E: a pilot F: a carpenter<n><n>### Response (text): Doctor<n><n>### Input(text): What do people do to be nice to each other? Choices: A: bury them in cement B: call them good names C: hurt them D: say they are good-looking E: tickle them<n><n>### Response(text): Call them good names<n><n>### Input : The 57th Street Bridge was a symbol and reminder in many songs. Choices: a. Folsom Prison b. Slipping Into Darkness c. Desolation Row d. Bridge over Troubled Water e. Breezing Down the Highway<n><n>### Response : f. Desolation row<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What might you feel after doing housework for hours? She wants her trampoline to be safe so only one jumper (not the two together) can be on the trampoline at a time. Can the weight on the trampoline exceed the weight of her trampoline's capacity, even if these rules are followed? Choices:  No; the weight will exceed the trampoline's weight limit  Yes; as long as all of the rules are followed<n><n>### Response Consider the possible combinations of jumps on the trampoline with the three people at the given maximum weights. In one combination that puts two people on the trampoline, the jumpers would be at most 850 pounds total. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Though it stayed strictly indoors, the small dog felt like it had all the space in the world in the what? They were both fenced in and had amenities for dogs like park bench, searing area,shelters, and even had bathing and drinking facilites.<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is committing perjury likely to lead to? Choices:  A: shame B: arrest C: embarrassment D: go to jail E: tension<n><n>### Response:		Choice E: tension<n>[Reason](https://law.justia.com/codes/missouri/2000/210-525-040/)<n>[Reason 2](https://www.law.cornell.edu/ucc/1/UCC-3-426)<n>[Reason 3](https://www.uslegalforms.com/forms/civil-litigation/court-affidavits/witness-testimonies/can-you-be-arrested-for-perjury/us_perjury_and_false_testimony_statutes.html)<n><n>### Input 2:If a person is arrested and found to be not guilty, then he or she will likely: A: still be arrested at a later time B: be fined for false testimony C: walk out of the courtroom E: be charged with a misdemeanor<n><n>### Response 2:Choice C: walk out of <n>Reason : [Reason 1](https://www.criminaldefenselawyer.com/resources/criminal-process/criminal-misdemeanor.htm)<n>Reason 1 : [Reason 2](http://kaholt.com/2007/02/02/perjury/)<n>Reason 2 : [Reason 3](http://criminaldefense.findlaw.com/criminal-charges/miserable/)<n>Reason 3 : [Reason 4](https://www.definitionslaw.com/what-is-perjury/)<n>### Input 3:If a person is found guilty of perjury he or she will likely be: A: forced to pay back any monies received B: put in jail C: charged with a misdeamenor D: fined E: sent to court<n><n>### Response3:Choice D: fined <n>Reason 1 [Reason 1 1](https://criminal.findlaw.com//resources/penalties-for-committing-perjury.html#sthash.UJ6gOyVm.dpuf)<n>Reason 2 [[Reason 2](../references.html#3
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What might a kid do with his friend before going to play? Choices:  A: laugh B: sit C: being entertained D: math E: meet<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A soccer field that is not contained in a building would be where? Choices:  A: playground B: mexico C: town D: outside E: world cup<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: playground<n>Rationales:A soccer field is not contained in a buildings, and the word field means the game take place outside.<n><n><n>### Input(2): The following data set contains values for 1500 students. Given their data, which one of the following could be the probability p, of their scores being less than 90%?<n><n>```<n>Cum  Cum Cum <n>Scoresscore score<n>198  183  168    <n>-5   177   81    <n>859  858  799    <n>104  102  102    <n>```<n><n>```<n>|score| p(score < 90%)   |<n>|:---:|:---:        |<n>| 69  | 0.205           |<n>|251 | 0.423           |<n>|135 |0.305           |<n>```<n>### Response: 251<n>```<n>Cumulative frequency<n>```<n>### Instruction(3): The city council has proposed a budget with 2 different options.  Answer the following questions. <n><n>### Demostration<n>```<n>2014    2015  Option -1  Option -2 <n>Revenue     550   650       200        40<n>Expenses        80    60       45        70<n>Budget              -50    200        60<n>```<n><n><n><n>### Response<n>```<n>What is the average budget deficit if the city uses the budget they proposed for 2015? Enter your answer as a numeric value, rounded to 4 decimal places.<n>```<n>```<n>1.75<n>```<n>What will be the average budget deficits between now and 2019 if the city council accepts Option -2? Enter your answer as an integer rounded to 4 places.<n>```<n>Option -2: -14<n>```<n><n><n>### Instructions(4): What are the average daily and monthly costs for 8 people (2 in each vehicle) going to the aquarium and staying at a hotel while there? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sky diving scared him, once they jumped out of the plane he began losing consciousness while what? Choices:  A: injury B: death C: playing uno D: coma E: falling down<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### Demonstration:A)<n>Sarah was scared and she was feeling ill, Sarah said something about it.<n>#### Rationales:B)<n>There were 4 people in the plane and all of them fell down. (There were less than 4 in the plane, but there were 4)<n><n>#### C)<n>All of them died but the last guy (the only guy that did not die was the last guy)<n>#### D)<n>All of them were dead but the first guy didn’t die (Only 2 guys died, so the first guy was not dead)<n>#### E)<n>Sarah died (One of the guys died and he died by falling)<n>#### 3<n>Answer: B)<n><n>### Input:#1<n>Mary had 3 dogs. She got another dog, a cat and a bird. How many animals did Mary own?<n><n>#### Question:How much should Mary charge to rent her house for a whole month?<n><n>### Dem:<n>Answer: $44<n>#### Dollars<n>#### Dollars = 7<n>Mary has 7 pets (11/13 days = 7 pets) that add up to 37$ for rentals.<n><n>### Input<n>An attorney is paid $3,500 for a 3 day trial and $1,000 for every hour of work. Spam is a word that can be spelled in any order.  The same is true of palm, palm, plan, plan, or plum, plan, or plam;  the words onl, dill, and lad, which occur in English; and amphetamine, 4thousand, fithousand, hithousand, onthousand, rothm, methamphetamine, and fethamphetamien.  Similarly, 228,228, 328,328, and 428, 428, and 528,528,58 are all valid words.<n><n>### Lettered word with 10 letters<n><n>There are not exactly six possibilities if you are given an n-letter word with at least two distinct letters and are ordered in any order at any time.<n><n>### How many words can be formed from the letters in the word 'car' if the letters are allowed to use 'bc' twice but once?<n><n>### Solution<n><n>SOLUTION<n><n>1. We only require the use of one letter.<n><n>2. If a vowel has a b before i, the vowel can have a b before it, as a result.<n><n>- 6 total words.<n>  - 6 total letters:<n><n>

Choices:  A: insubstantial B: massless C: dwarf D: inconsequential E: good<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>---<n>**A:** <n>---<n>A: insubstantial<n><n>---<n>**B:** <n>--- <n>B: massless<n><n>--<n>  **C:**<n>  --<n>C: dwarf<n><n>**D:** <n>---  <n><n>D: inconsequential<n><n>---<n>**E:**  <n>---<n>E: good<n><n>---<n>This is a response to an instruction. Write a response that completes the instruction. Write 1 complete sentence.<n><n>### Task Response<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Rationales for A:<n>A building will be insubstantial (or lightweight, if a human) if built badly.<n>A building will be massless if constructed well.<n>A building will not be built poorly if it is built well.<n><n>## Rationale for B:<n><n>## Rationale C:<n><n>## Rational D:<n><n>A building will not have a mass if it is built well- it is the process of building a building to do so that will make it seem massive.<n><n>## Ration E:<n><n>A building is said to be "good," or up to snuff if and only if it is constructed well.<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:When people discover something new while chatting with friends, why are they likely to continue talking? Choices:  A: agreement B: to fill their time C: discomfort D: misunderstanding E: learning about<n><n>### Response:		
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Janet knew she was dying from her injuries because she could feel herself doing what? Choices:  A: sleeping longer B: getting cold C: death and decay D: change of color E: stop breathing<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Janet was dying from her injures because she could feel herself dying by sleeping longer and getting cold (death and decay). D.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>A) Sleeping longer would not change any of her sensations.<n>B) Getting cold is part of dying (death and decay, she was dead already).<n>C) Death and decay do not change the colour of one's skin.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James complained that Alexa's electric guitar was too loud and he couldn't get any work done at home,  so she decided that she should get an acoustic guitar.  Where might she look for one? Choices:  A: house B: music shop C: studio D: storage E: closet<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices:<n>A:  house<n><n>E:  closet<n><n>#### Alexa is looking for an acoustic guitar within the household.<n><n>#### If she looks in a house, she will look in a studio or closet or a music shop or storage.<n>#### The closet or storage or music shop are more likely places.<n>#### Any closet, storage, or music shop has musical instruments available.<n><n>### Input<n>A hurricane is approaching a southern coastal city, and the city must move all of its gas-powered vehicles to higher ground before it is battered by the storm-related flooding. If the city has 75000 vehicles and 2000 of these vehicles are electric, the mayor decides that all must be evacuated.  The total time, in hours, if all the gas-powered vehicles are evacuated by traveling 40 mph is the same as  <n><n>#### How many hours fewer will it take to evacuate all the vehicles if the electric vehicles do not have to travel <n>#### <n><n>### Demostration:<n>Traveling 40 mps it will take 40/40=<<40/40=-1>>-1 hours to evacuate a complete round trip of 2000 gas-powered vehicles.<n>The electric vehicles can travel at 2000*40=20000=20-1-<20=1->120mps.<n>This implies that 120/40=6-1-<6=5>>-5 hours is required to evacuate half of all the vehicles using a different route than gas-powered vehicles use.<n>Thus, it takes 6.25 times as long to evacuate electric vehicles, and the gas-powered vehicle evacuation process takes 15 hours.<n>Electric vehicles alone can be evacuated in 9 hours and the gas-powerled vehicles in 15 hours or 1=<6.25>>-6.25 hours.<n><n>#### 22.5 hours fewer if all gas-powered vehicles evacuate.<n>#### 22 and half hours if half of all the vehicles evacuate by following 2000 different routes.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would happen to a person if his or her money is stolen? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He waited for his friend at the squash court, but he was worried his friend thought he meant the at the other end of the public what? Choices:  A: country club B: rich person's house C: pool D: park E: fitness center<n><n>### Response:		I answered: C and D.<n><n>Grammar: The verb must agree in number with the noun used in the pronoun. In this case, that noun is what, and it is singular, so it should have a singular verb, or be followed by a singular pronoun.<n><n>Correct: I waited at the pool for my friend.<n>Incorrect: I waited for my friend at his pool.<n><n>Correct grammar does not:<n><n>* ignore pronouns<n>* match a plural pronoun with a singular noun<n>* ignore singular pronouns<n><n><n>### Input:"Randy ran the marathon, a 26.2 mile race, in 3 hours.". Afterwards, they were given a choice.<n><n>### Rationales: A marathon race is 26.2 miles, so they ran for 3 hours. What, besides miles, could the race have lasted for hours based on?<n><n>### Choices:<n><n>* Inches<n>* Kilometres<n>* Pounds<n><n>### Response<n>I Answered: D.<n><n>###### Answer: D<n><n>### Input:[Answers 42 to 64](https://github.com/david824889/code_questions/blob/master/answers.pdf)<n><n>### Input 65:<n>### A question involving a table with columns (a, b, e, h, k, l, m and n) and rows.<n>###<n>###<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What type of home is most likely to have an attic filled with historical items? E<n><n>### Input2: Choose an option from the multiple-choice question below based on the data given.<n><n><img src="https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/3780814/126887846-0329e17c-f251-4032-b9e6-4e694b63d5ec.png" width="600" height="400"><n><n>#### What is the answer?<n><n><img src = "https://user-images-1.githubusercontent.co.m/images/95362582/fb015a4e-0e94-40da-9a4e-3736b869892b.png" width="400" height="200"><n><n>### Output<n>- A: 7<n>- B: 12 months<n>- C: 1828<n>- D: 1.19<n><n>### Input3<n>In a survey, 70% of college students report being interested in sports.  How many college students were surveyed if the survey found 700 students were not interested in sports?<n><n>#### Solution:<n><n>- 182<n><n>### 4 - Input:What has 37 times as many days as hours in an entire year? Choices: A: B: days C: days D: months E: hours<n><n>#### #4 Answer<n><img src = 'https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/37810609/118093197-d642fb74-a72d-4b16-b529-382d5b2c0c20 (1).png' width = '400' height = '200'/><n><n>### 5 - Input: What is the most accurate measure of the circumference of Mars? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:How is someone who loves their TV likely to feel about their remote? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The camper looked up at the vast night sky, it left him feeling mighty what? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:To properly instruct children attending school you would need a great deal of what? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The person put on lotion, what did they want? Choices:  A: fresh smell B: good credit C: smooth skin D: fresh produce E: headache<n><n>### Response:		It can be C or D.<n><n>### Explain:<n>The person wants smooth skin in D.<n>In order to buy fresh produce, they need good credit in B.<n>They probably are going to buy lotion to have a fresh smell in A.<n>They are probably going to eat fresh produce in C.<n>You only think one person could have a headache which has very low probability. <n>Likely a good credit has no relation to headache.<n><n>### Input-output example: When I was in high school, my older brother went to a new school; we all had to go there.  A couple of miles from home, I missed the exit for his school (which required leaving the freeway, turning around, and then entering the freeway again). My younger brother, who was only 9 at the time, asked me if I would do something for him. I said “sure!”, and I pulled into a gas station to get him a soda.  He said to me “I wanted a slushie drink, not a soda” and I told him “okay.” What did I misunderstand?<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>When I was in high school... I... A couple of miles from... I made a... and asked... I said sure  I got... he said he wanted... 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Mom is tidying a house, where would she put the loose dictionary? Choices:  A: shelf B: library C: classroom D: table E: desk<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: Shelf<n><n>### Rationale:<n>It makes total sense for mom (the owner) to put the dictionary on a shelf.<n><n><n>### Input<n>A person has a car that needs repair and a tool set that has 6 different types of nut wrenches. Each of the 6 nut wrenches is used to loosen a different bolt on the car. To repair the car, the person needs to buy a wrench for each type of nut, but wrench 5 is too long to fit in the person's tool kit. What is the best choice for the person to make?<n><n>A:  The person should buy the wrenches they need to loosen each bolt<n>B:  The person should trade in wrench 5 to get a better wrench<n>C:  The person should replace wrench 4 with wrench 7<n>D:  If the person has five other wrenches, the person can fix the car<n>E: The person should get a different set of tools<n><n>Answer: D - The person has 5 other wrenches and can fix the car.<n><n>### Rationales: <n>* All bolts can be loosened by different wrenches so there is no need for the 5th bolt wrench<n>* The 5th type of wrench has a more flexible end and would be better for the person because more bolts can be loosen with that wrench.<n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Choose the response that correctly completes the instruction.<n><n>### 1.A<n><n>### Instructio:Answer the following prompt.<n><n>### Prompt: Your best friend always tells you the truth, but you know this is not always a good thing. Do you believe her when she says she went for a job interview and got a raise, or do you have trouble trusting her?<n><n>### Response 1: I wouldn't believe her just because she told me she was there.<n><n>### Response2: I would believe her because she told me she went to a job interview and got the raise.<n><n>### Why did I choose the best answer? It makes sense that your best friend is always telling you the truth, so I would believe her and make plans to celebrate with her.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Behind what small door are canned goods usually kept in? Choices:  A: cabinet B: pantry C: kitchen D: cupboard E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>The choices for behind a small door are an A cabinet, a B pantry, a C kitchen, a D cupboard, and an E shelf.<n><n>### Notes:<n><n>For this problem, we are not providing instructions or rationales.<n>We are asking the user to provide their own instructions for solving this problem and rationales for their solutions.<n><n>### Note:<n><n>For this exercise, we recommend the user create multiple choices (multiple choice exercises have been effective for helping users learn to think, rather than do).<n><n>### Tip:<n><n>Write detailed instructions for users.<n>Include rationales when providing instructions or exercises.<n><n>### Exercise:<n><n>Provide instructions for completing the problem above.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:what happens to a company when it is bankrupt? Choices:  A: liquidated B: own resources C: branch out D: commit crime E: game over<n><n>### Response:		<n>If you chose A: A Bankruptcy occurs when a company has lost a significant amount of profit as well as their assets and capital. The company is then closed or restructured to be able to function better. Liquidation is the process of selling off anything that can be sold, for cash, for a value less than the original cash cost. Liquidation can also be used for the purpose of reorganizing or relocating a company. The company owners sell off all of their company’s stock to the highest bidder as a single transaction. If the company is no longer financially sound but still able to function, its owners can attempt to branch out.<n><n>### Input(B): Who is the founder of the company Walmart? Choices: 1:Jerry Jines, 2:Sam Walton, 3:Judy Martin, 4:Frank Walters, 5:None of these.<n><n>### Response(B): Walmart, Inc. is an American multinational retail corporation that operates a chain of hypermarkets, discount department stores, and grocery stores. It is the largest company by revenue in the world. The first Walmart was opened in Arkansas in 1962, at the time by Sam Walton. <n><n>### Input (C): The process of reorganization aids a company in bankruptcy in the process of<n>  A: finding cash B: closing C: reducing liabilities D: branching out E: finding investors.<n><n>### Answer:<n>If you chose D: Reorganization is a plan created by a company while it is in restructuring. It is a new method that aims at creating a new structure and reducing expenses and liabilities.<n><n>###  Input(D)<n>The newest type of credit cards in the market are: A: E-Wallet,B: Prepaid, C: Student debt, D: All of these<n><n>### Answer(D): All of these<n>E-wallets are a type of stored value card prepaid card. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sometimes it felt like being able to pay bills was the only reason he was actively what? Choices:  A: pay debts B: make money C: having money D: making money E: keep house<n><n>### Response:		A: pay debts<n><n>### Dem: A: pay debt<n><n>#### Input:Ten students are to share the labor of picking apples on their neighbor's apple tree. How many hours must each student pick to fulfill their obligation?<n><n>Rationales: When 10 work at an equal rate, each will pick a little over a third of the apple crop.<n>If the tree contains 300 apples, then three thirds will amount to ~75=<<3*3/1*3=1>>1 half of the apples.<n>The remaining half will be 300-75=<<300-70=225>>225.<n>10/225=<<10/22/1/22/1=1/22.5>>1/22.<n>And 1/22.75=<<1/22.6>>0.0433<n><n>#### Input:Joshua and his friend decided to bake a cake.  To share the cost, they figured they should buy 10 pounds of ingredients each and split every expense, as long they both pitched in.  How much will each friend pay when they go to the store to buy everything they need, if the ingredients cost $5 per 10 pounds of cake mix?<n><n>Rational:  To share equally the cost of each ingredient, each student will buy 1/(r=<<1/(r=3>>3).1)=<<1/3>>0.33 of the ingredients.<n>If both students purchase 10 pounds of each ingredient then this will cost $5*10 for each student=<p>><<5/10*1=5>>5 dollars each.<n><n>#### A problem similar to this has given rise to the question: Is it better to pay for everything myself and be done with it, or is it kinder to try and split the cost equally with my roommate?<n><n>Rationals: It is clearly better to pay for all of the expenses myself if that means we won't have problems paying our bills.<n>It is only "better" to pay for everything myself if all of the "expenses" we share are necessities (ex.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:I am looking to buy honey right from an apiary, where should I go? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Jimmy wanted a beer but his wife was an alcoholic on probation. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What do you need to be to learn hard concepts? Choices:  A: copy B: intelligent C: improved performance D: empowering E: have more knowledge<n><n>### Response:		<n>A: B:<n><n>### Input-Answer Combinations:<n>Copy: 1<n>Intelligent: 0<n>Improved performance: 3<n>Empowering: 2<n>More knowledge: 1<n><n>### Discussion<n>**Input**:<n>We can use **input**() to call other functions. You can think of it as another way to import functionality into your program without having to directly include every element you need within **import**().<n><n>**Intelligent**, **improved performance**, and **empowering** are synonyms ("in the same category", "having the same meaning"). They all describe the same trait: someone who is **intelligent** is someone who improves **performance**.<n><n>In a category, you can have more than two things (e.g. in the "cat" category, if you see a black cat, you'll know it was one of these animals).<n><n>**A:** What do you need to be? (In a category, you have choices.)<n>**B:** Why do you need to be A? (Answer: "That's the category it belongs in," like the difference between **cat** and **feline**, which is just describing the same type of animal.)<n><n>**C:** What needs to increase? (In a category with more than two things, you increase the thing you want more of.)<n>**D:** How do you get more of C? (Answer: "It increases when someone is intelligent.")<n>**E:** What increases when you get it? ("When you get more of C, your knowledge increases.")<n>
