Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Why do people engage in chatting with friends in class? Choices:  A: necessity B: answers C: inspiration D: love E: fun<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>What is Chat?<n>Chat refers to "short instant message sent via the internet (also called IM)" (Oxford Dictionaries).<n>Chat is a tool to communicate with other people.<n><n>Why do people engage with in chatting with friends<n>in class?<n><n>I don't like the idea of chatting with friends<n>via mobile phone during the class, because<n>students' attention span in classroom is<n>shorter than that of chatting outside<n>class. If students get distracted or lose<n>focus in class, that will negatively affect<n>their learning and that of others in a<n>classroom.<n>Especially, I don’t want to see students<n>incessantly chatting with friends. That's<n>completely unacceptable<n><n>As a result, I think there are only two<n>chances of chatting with friends within<n>the classroom.<n>The first is when the teacher asks for a<n>question. It may be appropriate for<n>students to chat via mobile phones during<n>the waiting time to answer the teacher's<n>question (i.e., while the teacher is<n>explaining the content or taking a<n>break). If students are lost the topic or<n>are unfamiliar with the topic, they can<n>ask each other via mobiles phones.<n><n>The second is when the class leader (i.e.,<n>the student who is elected to take control<n>of the class) is talking or delivering<n>the content. However, the chat in this<n>situation is limited to the class leader<n>only as a communication tool to other<n>classmates. The point is that a class<n>leader can use chat to announce the<n>upcoming event or activity so that<n>everybody can prepare for it.<n>Evidently, class chatting may be a good<n>way to encourage good relationship between<n>classmates, and<n>also be a useful tool to inform the<n>current status of classmates among the<n>whole class members at the same time.<n>Therefore, in my classroom, I will open<n>the opportunity for class chatting, but I<n>don’t encourage it.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A shark swam in the background aquarium as the card players sat emotionless, what were they playing? Choices:  A: sea world B: court room C: shallow waters D: poker game E: card shark<n><n>### Response:		<n>> A-B-C-D-E<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Input: At a coed basketball game at the University of California, there were 25 students with the last name Jones in the bleachers. What is the probability that at least 2 of the students in the stands were named Jones? A.	0.12 B.	0.38 C.	0.67 D.	0.98 E.	0.17<n><n>(1) All the students are boys.<n><n>(2) There are 20 boys in the class.<n><n>(3) There are 12 students with the last name "Jones."<n><n>There are 6 students named Jones.<n><n><n>Therefore:<n><n>(96/20)*(12/6)<n><n>## Output: 0.67, (12/20)*(2/3) = 0.60, or 60% because there are 20 boys and 12 students with "Jones"; the probability of having one or more is 0.60.<n><n>Inverse<n><n>## Instructions:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions. The shark swam in a 1300-gallon aquarium as the cardplayers sat immobile in the bleachers, what game were they playing?<n><n>## Input: Choices: A: Sea World Game B: Courtroom C: Shallow Waters D: Poker Game E: Card Shark<n><n>## Output: SeaWorld because card playing games require interactions between the individuals. However, the sharks are not affected by the actions of the humans and the aquariums are empty and the human observers are also unresponsive.<n><n>## Program Input and Output to:<n>The car-rental agcy.charges $30/day 4 a car or $190 4 a wek 4 a rental that last 1 wk or longer. Jennie Rdnt. a cart 11 dy. How mant in dolls did she pay?<n><n>## Output: Answer: 310; 190 + 120 = 310 dollars.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where did the compassionate farmer allow the heifer to reside during her last days? Choices:  A: cattle ranch B: countryside C: grocery store D: slaughterhouse E: dairy farm<n><n>### Response:		The compassionate farger allowed the cow to reside in a cattle ranch.<n>

Choices:  A : 8.8 B : 15.8 C : 16.2 D :17.8 E : 3.21<n><n>Rationales: Since this question refers to an equilateral (equal sides, all of the same length) triangle, the sides would all be the same length.  <n>Each side would be 5.50 feet.  <n>To find the perimeter of a right triangle, add up all 3 sides.  <n>Add all three of the triangle’s sides to find its perimeter.  For example, when you add two sides of a right triangle with lengths of 5 ft and 6 ft, to find the overall triangle perimeter, you end up with the answer of 11 ft.<n>#### 11<n>Answer: 11<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If something is obtuse, what couldn't it be? Choices:  A: bright B: pointed C: correct D: acute angled E: clear<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer by picking an acceptable answer that fits your response: Obtuse is __________.<n>(fill in the blank)<n>A: bright<n>B: pointed<n>C: correct<n>D: acute angled<n>E: clear<n><n><n><n><n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where should an excavation never take place? Choices:  A: construction site B: cemetary C: building D: city E: archeological site<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Instuction: Choose the best answer from the choices provided<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: What do you write when expressing the average rate of return on a stock that has a daily return of -15, 10, and 4?<n>Rationales:: The average return is -4.<n>When calculating the average return for multiple numbers, we always add them and then divide by # of numbers.<n>So, (15+10+4)/3 = -4/3 = <<(-4/3) = -1.33>> -1.33.<n><n>#### 1.33<n>Answer: 1.33

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What kind of place could have thousands of statue? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The human looked down longingly as he sat in the orbiting space station, what did he miss? Choices:  A: nearest house B: workplace C: surface of earth D: office block E: his feet<n><n>### Response:		<n>If the correct answer is "nearest house", then the answer is "nearest".<n><n>If it is "workplace", then the answer is the "work-place".<n><n>If it's "surface of earth" then the answer would be "earth".<n><n>If it were "the office-block", then the answer would be the "office-block".<n><n>If it was "feet", then the answer would only be "feet".<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>##### For each following question, indicate the relationship to the situation by selecting the best alternative given the choices below. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:People always talked childlike to him, even though his disability was physical and didn't affect his what? Choices:  A: strength B: brain C: potential D: qualification E: competence<n><n>### Response:		People always talked to him childlike, even though his disabilities were not of the mind.<n><n>### Answer:

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The swimming pool couln't be refilled due to drought regulations, where was it located? Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What might a satisfied person do? This amount is identical to $192.<n><n>### Answers on separate line (if applicable):She can work at the same paycheck until the amount is $600. $600<n><n>### Note:You do not have to make your code or program work. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where could you find some airplanes that are not being used? Write an expression that represents the number of gallons of fuel needed to move 5,000 cubic feet of stone.)<n>5,000/30=<<5,000/(30) = 167>>167.<n>5,002/30=<<>>5,002/(30)= 167<n><n>### Input:$2,600.<n>Write a mathematical expression that represents this amount in dollars with 4 significant places after the decimal point.<n>Answer: In dollars with 4 significant paces after the decimal point. How much, in dollar, does it cost to hire the truck for:<n>A: 2 hours<n>B:5 hours<n>C:6 hours<n>D:10 hours<n><n>```<n><n>## Coding:<n>```<n>class Main {<n>    static void main (String args[]) {<n>        double time,miles,cost;<n>        String op;<n>        op = String.readerLine("Enter cost ");<n>        cost = op.equals("d")? 0.10 : 25.00;<n>        op = "Enter time " + cost;<n>        time = 10.0;<n>        miles = 2.0;<n>        double answer = cost * time;<n>        System.out.print("The cost is " + answer + " for hire the truck. ");<n>    }<n>}<n>```<n>

What percentage of the population lives in that city?<n>Rationales<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n>### Instruct<n><n>Input: 85% of a company's sales are made with American credit cards. If the total percentage of sales to the company using American credit cards is 5% what percentage is made using credit cards from countries other than America?<n>Rationales Choice D: The total for both domestic and International sales comes up to 100%<n><n>% International = 5% * Total Sale % minus 5% * Sale %<n><n>5% * 80% = 4%<n>4% * 5% = 0%<n><n><n>### Choic C: 5% * 9% = 0% <n><n>### Choci E: 5% * -2% = -0.5%<n><n>### A: 5% * (80% - 100) = 0%<n>### D: 5 % - 5 % = 0%<n>{% highlight javascript %}<n>(5 * 85)  - (5 * 85);<n>var answer = (5 * 80) - (5 * 5)<n><n>answer = 5 * 80<n>(5 * 5)  ;<n>var answer = (40) - (5)<n><n>Answer <n>50<n>{% endhighlight %}

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If I have a forgiving attitude toward someone, what do they receive? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do you watch garbage? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would something be if you do not need it? Choices:  A: satisfied B: unnecessary C: luxury D: sufficient E: extra<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>I chose D because something is sufficient because the item is useful for what it does. The best choice is C because it is unnecessary. Some people don't even have something and are satisfied with what they have. Not everyone has to have a car but if everybody had a car there would be traffic jams. Not everyone has to drive to work because they could walk or get a bike. When most people were getting around on foot or horseback they were satisfied about not having a car.

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is one likely to hear a harpsichord? There is a systematic way to teach counting, though, so that it is automatic for students.  <n><n>For example, many students are raised with the method for saying "three":<n><n>"Three" followed by "and twenty-one."<n>With all counting skills, practice makes perfect. There are 5 heros to choose<n>from; each with a unique ability.  Pick from the following choices:<n>1 - Elven Archer2 - Human Paladin3 - Dwarven Fighter  4- Gnome Rogue<n>5 - Unfortunate Barbarian<n><n>#### Your Choice<n>You have chosen: <<You have chosen:<<Barbarian<n><n>#### What Ability Does Your Hero Have?<n>Your Hero will be able to carry 1 Object (item) at a time.  Your ability<n>is to carry as many items as possible.<n><n>#### Elf Archer<n>Choose the Hero: <<Choose the Hero:<<Human Paladin<n><n>#### What Abilitiy Does Her Hero Have?<n>She can carry 3 Objects<n><n>#### Paladin<n>Choose the Hero Choose the Hero: <<Human Paladin<n>Choose your ability: <<Choose your ability:<<Elf Archer<n><n>#### What Abiliity Does This Hero Have?<n>Your ability is to carry 2 Objects<n><n>#### Choose your Hero <n>Your Hero: <<Your hero is:<<The human Paladin<n><n>#### Choose the Hero: The Human Paladin<n><n>#### Elf Hero<n><n>#### What ability does the Hero Have?<n><n>1 - 2 - Choice 1 - Choice 1:<<Elf Archers<n>3 - 4- Choice 3 - Choice
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:This city in Northern Norway is filled within things to do like Polar Nights half marathons and located in the middle of the Northern lights oval, which city is it? Choices:  A: northern B: nome C: tromsø D: finnmark E: vadsø<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>```python<n>import requests<n>import json<n>from bs4 import BeautifulSoup<n><n>def main():<n>  r = requests.get('https://www.norway.com/cruise/northern_lights/?utm_content=gb-en&utm_medium=cpc&utm_term=&utm_source=google&utm_campaign=&utm_content=northern_lights%2Bguide&utm_medium==cpcampaign=northern+lights&utm_term==northern+lights+guide&utm_source==google&utm_content==northern+light&utm_campagn<n>  s==northern+light+guide', headers={'User-Agent': 'Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/78.0.3904.87 Safari/537.<n><n><n>  #print(r.text)<n><n>  resultObject = json.loads(r.content)<n><n>  for each_link in resultObject['Links']:<n>    if 'url' in each_link:<n>      print(each_link)<n>#     elif 'href' in each_link or'ref' in each_link.lower() and 'href' in each<n>#                                                                             .lower() or'ref' in<n>#                                                         <n>#         each_link or 'id' in each_link and 'href' in<n><n><n><n>  with open('C:/Users/Garim/Desktop/2/output.txt', 'w') as outfile:<n>    for each_element in resultObject['H1']:<n>      link = str('https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g689901-d408511-Reviews-' + each_element)<n>      print(link, file=outfile)<n><n>  with open("C:/Users/Ganesh/desktop/2/Output.txt".rstrip('\n')) as outputfile:<n>    htmlfile = open('C:/Users//Garim/Desktop//
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The man tried to run, but he could not. He could that he could only move by doing what? Choices:  A: stand B: go quickly C: walking D: stand still E: walk slowly<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### The Answer is "C".<n><n>### Demostrated:<n>"There is a man who tried to run, but can only walk."<n><n>### Explanation:<n>"Man tried to run, but could not."<n><n>### 36 questions<n>- #### Could<n>- #### Tried<n>- #### Man<n>- #### But<n>- #### Could Only<n>- #### Walk<n>- #### Stand Still<n>- #### Go Quickly<n>- #### Walk Slowly<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is an way for people to meet with each other? There are 144 girls with last names that start with an A. How many girls in the class that do not have last names that start with A?<n><n>### Output 22<n><n>### Demostrate<n><n>(334-<334-<<334-2>3>2>)3*2=22<n><n>##Input:<n><n>A: In a class of 48 students, 21 are boys. 18 of the boys play soccer and 12 of the girls are soccers fans. There are 25 students who do not play soccer. Find the number of girls who either do not play soccer or are not soccer fans.<n><n>##Output:<n><n>8<n><n>##Demonstration:<n><n>48-<<48-<<44/18>2>3)3/2>4>2>3>3*3-6/4=1688-2=<<334-<<433+333>2>3=22

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does exercising immediately lead to? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you dispose of a broken icebox? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where could you find a theater which only has unpaid actors? It is not uncommon to have well payed jobs in a populated area.<n>- D: School has well payed teachers and principals (theater is a part of school)<n>- E: Military Base has a well payed armed service people<n><n>### Questions:<n><n>How many pairs of shoes did she lose track of?<n><n>How many 3/7-yard pieces were necessary to create all 50 pairs?<n><n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:She wanted to make a quilt of velvet, where should she look? Choices:  A: grandma B: clothing C: jewelry store D: clothes E: fabric store<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n>E<n><n>### Demostration<n><n>Input: A bag of sugar weighed 400 grams and a large bag of flour weighed 24 kg. Which item of a similar weight cost less?<n>Rationales  The large 24 kg bag of flour costs less than the small 400gram bag of sugar, because they are in different units of measurement.  A kg is larger than a gram.<n>The price of an item is calculated by its unit cost multiplied by the number of the units that you have. Here we see the price of each item.<n>400g x the unit cost of sugar = <<400g x unit cost>>400 gram bag of sugar cost = The price of a bag of sugar.<n>24 kg x unit cost of flour = <<24kg x unit cost>>a large bag of flour cost = The price of 24kg flour.<n>The price of a large bag of flou is less than a small bag of sugar.<n><n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>Input: The bank has a $50 minimum for its accounts. What is the sum of three deposits of $15, $25 and $2?<n>Rationales<n>The sum of all three deposits is 25. Because a bank minimum is 50, we will need to find ways to use the money.<n>Using Addition, and Subtraction we will complete the sum.  Here is the addition. 15 + 25 = 40 or 4 + 25 = ______.<n>Here is the substraction. 15 - 25 = 10 or 2 - 25 = ______________. 40-10= 30. 40 + 30 = 70.<n>We have completed the task, but we have to find a way to combine them. We can use addition and subtraction in order to equal what a bank will take as a minimum for an account.<n>In additioning 15 we are going to take a loan of 15 which allows us to place 15 in the account.<n>In subtractioning 20, we are borrowing one (1) $20 bill in order to place it in the account, once we have the amount

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:After bringing eggs home from the store in what are they held? All other letters could be excluded since they do not contain the word "egg" or other variants of it and because the correct answer only has one word that contains the letter "e", that is egg.

Your boss hands you a stack of tickets with about 4 tickets per contact and you are instructed to get these tickets handled so these customers can be satisfied. One customer ticket is about a virus that is corrupting a database. You have 3 options to handle the ticket depending on how much effort it will take to find a solution. Option 1 is to get the customer a new database. Option 2 is to reconfigure the customer computer with security restrictions that will prevent the virus from doing any damage. Option 3 is to reconfigure the database with a more secure configuration to prevent corruption in the first place. Your manager asks you to determine what option he should choose. Based on the chart below where you can mark how much time it will take for each option, determine a recommendation of what he should do.<n><n>### Notes:Use this to help you decide the best option.<n><n>### Customer Requirement:The customer requires no loss in function.<n><n>### Losses in Function:Customer may have to spend more time learning a new program.<n><n>### Data Entry Errors:Customer cannot be interrupted.<n><n>### Corrupted Data:Data losses cannot be tolerated.<n><n>### Recommendation:<n>Option 1<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A small dog is lost in New England, where would it likely be found? Choices:  A: own home B: old england C: new hampshire D: coffin E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		<n>A is false.<n>B is a country in Northern Europe.<n>C is the region including the US State of New Hampshire.<n><n>### Input : What is the average temperature in Fahrenheit for each state in the United States for October and November each year?<n><n>### Response : Since temperatures for both October and November are shown for some states, we cannot assume that the average is the same for both months. We will need to answer each question separately. For November, we used this link: https://www.e-education.psu.edu/earthing2/node/84/. <n><n>### Input 1 The total weight of a 2-by-4 is 6,100 pounds. What is the density of the wood, in pounds per cubic foot, if the weight of the 2 by 4 measures 24x48x1 inches? (round the value to the nearest tenth if necessary).<n><n>### Response<n>The weight, in pounds, of a single 4-inch, 2-by-1 piece of lumber is 224lbs.  If we wish to determine the density of a lumber piece, we need only determine the total weight of a 4x4x12 rectangle in inches (36x36x12). Thus, the density is: w, lbs/12in^3 = 224l/36 =6,100/24 = <<6100/36=172>>172.<n>#### 172<n>Answer: 172<n><n>

Choices:  A: hear crowd go mad B: working hard C: clap D: reproduce E: celebrate<n><n>### Response:		C: Clap<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Demostrating<n><n>### Additional information<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>### Question:The table below is adapted from the annual report of an auto plant.<n><n>In the first quarter, 400 cars were produced, 50 per week (each 24 hours). For the first 4 weeks, there were 42 cars per day, or (42)/(7). What was the daily production rate during the week in which 980 cars were produced?<n><n>### Answer: 186 cars/day<n><n>### Rationales: A second quarter is 1 week long by necessity.<n>The car factorties daily production rate in March-April is 42 * 50 = <<42 * 5 = 210>>210.<n>This is divided by 14 = <<42 * (14/7)>>42 / (14/7), the number of hours the plant operates from Monday at 8:00 AM to Sunday at 8:0 AM.<n><n>The factory's daily production rate in May-June is 24 * 25 = <<42 *50 = 210 >>210.<n>The car factory's daily production in June-July is 300/30 = <<300/3= 100>>100.<n>This means it operated for 2 hours more per day during the week the 980 units were produced.<n><n>### Question 18:<n><n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>## Demonstrating:<n>![alt text](/assets/images/2_solutions/dbl_solution_18.gif "18")<n><n>### Answer<n><n>### Question<n><n>### Demyst:<n><n>### Answering:<n>![alt text](./img/solution_19.gif "20")<n><n>### Instution:<n><n>### Demote:<n><n>### Answers:<n><n>### Instructure:<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>### Response to Question:<n><n>![Alt text](/assets/images

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could happen to you after you see some beautiful clouds above you? Choices:  A: plain B: cold C: dull D: bad E: wet<n><n>### Response:		<n>D<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:When a snake prefers warm, sunny weather, where would it likely want to live? Choices:  A: pet shops B: new mexico C: white house D: arctic E: garden of eden<n><n>### Response:		A

How much do you need to sell to your lumberyard, in cubic meters, to make $25,800 (profit = cost) on a shipment of 10000 cubic meter?

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:You might head to the locker room after getting a green drink here. Choices:  A: health club B: jocks C: fitness centre D: stadium E: gymnasium<n><n>### Response:		The green drink is served at the jocks. Choices:  C and D<n><n>#### Choices:A<n><n>The locker room can only be accessed by members of a fitness center, which has nothing to do with jocks.<n><n>### Response (Cont.):A health club sounds suspiciously like the workplace, with all of of its restrictions and bureaucracy. You certainly wouldn't want to get your sports drink stolen by a coworker!<n><n>### Choices:C<n>You would be hard pressed to convince other people of the health benefits a green drink can provide. After all, how do you really know that your sports drink is truly going to make you healthy, especially if it's from a stadium?<n><n>### Choice:D<n>You'd have to work at the stadium anyway to sell the sports drink you're carrying!<n><n>### Conclusion:The only logical option is jocks. The gym seems to be in a more relaxed atmosphere, which is often a requirement for a healthy person.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sammy wanted to go to where the people were. Where might he go.<n>Rationales:  A race track has people, and they're in cars and there is a track at the beginning and the end.<n>An apartment has a roadblock, and cars don't fit in a roadblock.<n>A desert has people, but they don't have cars.<n><n>### Analysis<n>Answer: _where the people were_ = Where cars go.  So A=race track.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James was cooling off two quickly.  He would die if he didn't find some way to stop what? Choices:  A: loss of heat B: revenge C: expansion D: relaxation E: calm down<n><n>### Response:		Expansion<n><n>### Input :Given $5,000, how many 10%-off coupons does a person need to buy a car costing $10,000? Choose two<n><n>### Response :170<n><n>### Solution<n><n>\[\begin{array}{|l|c|c|}\hline Coupons & Cost & Rate\\<n>\hline<n> 10\% &  1 & $100\\<n>\hline<n>  20\% &  1&  40\\<n>\hline 5\% & 190& 2850\\<n>\hline\end{array}\]<n><n><n><n>We then solve this system of equations in slope-intercept form:<n>$$\begin{align}&2x - 5y = 0 \\ &5x + 2y = 0\end{align}$$<n><n>$$x = \frac{5y}{2} = \frac{5(2850)}{80} = 35.625$$<n>$$y = \frac{2x}{5} = \frac{2(35.62)}{5}  =  7.125$$<n><n><n>\[\begin {array}{|c|c|}\hhline{|=||=}|r.|c.|p. |q. |r.|} \hhline{|=||-:=|} & 35.6 & 170. & \boxed{171.125}\\ \hhline{|=:||:}&-&536.515&-\\\hhline{|=:|} & -27.375& 1930.6& \boxed{1931.625}\\ \hline{|=::|}& \boxed{y. } & & \boxed{y.} \\ \hhline{|=::|}& - \boxed{5.725} & \boxed{-821.025} & - \\\hhline{|:|} & \\ \hhline{|:=|} &<n>\end{array}\]$<n><n><n><n>\[\boxed{\$170.} \]<n><n>### Comments:<n><n>\[2y -

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. Enter a decimal as the answer.<n>##### 12.1%<n>##### 24.90%<n>#### B<n><n>#### #3<n><n><n>### Input For Input:<n>Input: The length of time it took to walk to school was two-fifths as long as the time it took to walk home.  Sam walked 0.4 miles to school and 2.2 miles home.  How many total miles, in miles, did Sam walk?<n>Rationales:(If 0.4 is 2/5 as long as 2.2, then 0.8 is, by extension, 2/5 as short as 2.3)<n><n>So, 194-5=<<194-5==>190>>190-19-4=<<190-15==>175>>175-17-5=<<175-12==>160>>160-16-4=<<160-12==> 140>>140-14-5=<< 140-10==>130>>130-13-4=<< 130-09==>121<< 121-12==>99>>99-9-5=<<99-4==> 95>>95-9-4=<< 95-5==> 90<n><n>#### 99.5<n><n>##### Input:The shaded area in the graph below is.025. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would a camper need to do before he or she can start cooking food? Choices:  A: make breakfast B: go hiking C: pack or bag D: light fire E: grab a match<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choices: A, E<n>Rationales:<n><n>### Input<n><n>Sally was the only player on her softball team to hit a home run, hit a grand slam, and score the winning run twice in one game.  What was her batting average for that game?<n><n>####<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Sally had 2 out of 3 at bats result in a hit.<n>Her batting average was<n><n>### ##.<n>#### Answer:<n><n>### #<n><n>### ##<n><n>### ##:<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a seafood restaurant in the east coast of North America? The customer decided to pay for it in 2 equal payments over 6 months. Each payment would cover the salesman’s commission, and then he would receive a bonus equal to 1/6 of his regular commission.<n>What is the total amount of the 2 payments the customer made if the salesman’s regular commission is $45 dollars for each sale, and the first payment includes the commission plus $15 in bonus and the second includes $12 in bonus?<n><n>Answer: 1872<n><n>Rationales:  The first payment would equal the $850 + $15 bonus, which would be covered entirely in the second payment, or $265.<n>To cover the commission (55/6) and the bonus ($12 in total), the second payment would be equal to $850-$265+12 bonus.<n>Which is $1872. <n>#### 1872 <n><n>

You need only know that each of the choices represents an advertising delivery mechanism.<n><n>Answer choices:<n><n><table><n><thead><n><tr><n><th>A</th><n><th>B</th><n><td>C</td><n><td>D</td><n><th>E</th><n></tr><n></thead><n><tbody><n><tr>Vérités:Véra</tr><n><tr>Faux:Faux</tr><n><br><n><tr>A: tv</tr><n><td>B:Bus</td><n><tr>C: email</tr><n><th id="h-2733">D: web-site</th><n><tr>E: the city</tr><n><tbody>       <n></tbody><n></table><n><n>### Question:Choose an answer to each question below:<n><n>### Answer-Choose answer:<n>A) The bus is full: 47.<n>B) You are on the bus: false 43.<n>C) The bus takes a detour: false 31.<n>D) The driver was late: 59.<n>E) Traffic made you late: false 15.<n>F) You did not have enough time: 101.<n><n>### The Answer:<n>A) the bus that is full has 47 people.<n>B) The bus is 43 passengers<n>C) The bus is off the 31 path.<n>D) the driver was late, making 59 passengers.<n>E) bad traffic delayed the bus. and its 15 passengers<n>F) you have no time for 101 passengers.<n><n>### A: The bus is at capacity<n>\<n>B: The bus has 43 people.<n>\<n>C: The bus off the track by 31 people.<n>\<n>D: The driver was driving late, which is 59 people.<n>\<n>E: Traveling slow is 15 people.<n>F: no time 101 people.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Jamie wanted to reduce her waist size, but all of her efforts failed miserably.  She continued to do what? Choices:  A: gain weight B: augment C: dispare D: make larger E: expand<n><n>### Response:		Answer: (c) dispare<n><n>#### Why?<n>The correct answer is D - dispare. The text is: "She continued to "dispare",<n><n>### Instructions:Review your responses.  Did you correctly complete each question?  If not, go back and study the text to understand why your answers were incorrect.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John and James spent most of their time communicating with each other on their project.  The time required to communicate slowed their what? Choices:  A: static B: train of thought. C: progress D: transfer of information E: collaboration<n><n>### Response:		D<n>Answer: D<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:She loved buying products, she was driven by her what to shop more than any practical needs? Choices:  A: desire B: money C: time D: credit E: spending money<n><n>### Response:		<n>Option D: credit<n><n>Options A, B, C, and E are not the right answers.<n><n>### Output:<n>Answers: A: desire, B: money, C: time,D: credit, E: spending money,<n><n>### Output Explanation:<n>Input:She loved buying product more than any practical needs. <n><n>Desire, money, time, credit, and spending money are types of _________.<n><n>Rationales:  This definition fits the context of the word _________.  In this case, the word _________ refers to money or other means of payment.<n><n>For option A: In this context, the word _________ is ambiguous.  This does not mean "uncontrolled emotion" of the word _________, nor does it mean "feeling and mental capacity."  The word_________ is used to refer to the _________, while the other definition refers to the capacity to feel emotion and think.<n><n>For option B: Credit is an issue of _________.<n>In this context, _________ is used to refer the subject of the sentence: that the person really cares to spend money, not that she is willing to _________ and spend money.  Option B is incorrect for this reason.<n><n>The word 'desire' fits the context well enough, but it is incorrect for this sentence.  To answer this sentence, you must understand that people may spend money that is not practical.<n><n>For options C and D: The word "time" may be used to refer to time or to money.  For context, the sentence is used to refer to "her love for money."<n><n>In this context, option E does not fit because "money" is a noun in the sentence.  You don't have money to spend, you use money to spend.  "Spending money" here does not mean spending in time, but it means spending in the form of "credit."  Spending money refers to using the _________, so credit is the right one.<n><n>#### 400<n>Answer:  credit<n><n>### Input<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>Demonstration:<n>Input/Question:If a train passes a train by 10 miles in 11 hours, then how fast is the first train going?<n><n>Rationales/

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What group of musicians will include someone playing the cello? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:How do geese normally get from place to place?
