His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:I'm looking for alcohol and fried foods, any suggestions? Choices:  A: pub B: plane C: beer D: store E: fraternity house<n><n>### Response:		Option D: store<n><n>#### Explanation:The store contains various sections- one of which includes alcohol and fried, delicious and healthy food. For example, alcohol can be available in the form of wine, vodka and cognac. Fried items, on the other hand, can be represented by the following: French fries, onion rings, chips and wings. As a matter of fact, fries combined with wings can be considered as fried foods. Moreover, wings are considered to be alcohol. Alcoholic beverages are further divided into red and white wine. The store consists of other sections as well, for instance: deli. All-inclusive, the fried foods will be available in a separate section since, for example, they're fried and, thus, would fall beneath the description of 'healthy food'.<n><n>### Input:(Tenting) I'd like to make arrangements where I may purchase tents, any suggestions?<n>----------<n>### Demonstraction:<n><n>#### 1) Choices: A: sleeping bags B: backpacks C: sleeping tents<n><n>#### 2) Choices: D: cotton tents<n><n>#### Explanaton:<n>A) Sleeping bags provide warmth, so they may be considered tentless tents, in some case. Backpacks are used only to carry objects.<n>B) Sleeping tents are an item of a group- tents, they serve the purpose of housing while on the go.<n><n>C) Sleeping tetns are also considered to be tents; tents, in this case, could act as shelter while being on the camp.<n><n>D) Cotton tents are, in some cases, a tent less tent or a tent like sleeping bag. This is due to the cotton fabric. However, cotton tents are meant to act as shelter. This means that the cotton tents represent tents, not sleeping tents.<n><n>#### Explanotion:<n>To make arrangements to purchase tents, go to the tent store. Also, tents are available in a separate section of the store. As a matter of face, tents are classified as shelter, so they should be located in the section that offers shelter (tents), in turn, making the tent store
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sally lost her kite because she wasn't careful.  She thought that there was more string on the spool, but it slipped out of her fingers when she reached the what?. Choices:  A: child's hand B: the last straw C: hobby shop D: end of line E: toy store<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>A: Choice C<n><n>### Input<n><n>I can't wait to play my guitar, and I will pick it up tonight. There is only one string that needs replacing, because the other four have been tuned to perfection for this week. I can't wait to pick up my guitar so I can play a song!<n><n>### Demetion:<n>In order to answer this question, the student must understand the use of "I" in the sentence, the subject of the question "play my guitar" and "The other four have been tuning perfect" which suggest there are now five perfect strings when the sentence reads, "there is only one string that need replacing, because the other five have been tuned to perfect for this week."<n><n>### Response<n>I must understand to which the sentence refers when it says "the other five." My friend told me I could tune my guitar with 5 perfect strings, but there were only four. I can only play one song that night.<n><n>### Input:"What is the main idea of a short story, novel, or play?"<n>Answer:"How does theme relate to plot?" Response:"Theme refers to the message that the author wished to express. It is the topic of the work. Every good literary work is trying to tell a truth. The plot usually drives the work, not the theme. The theme is often the point of the work."<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:East coast areas such as Florida are found where? Choices:  A: florida B: denmark C: united states D: map E: california<n><n>### Response:		Answer A<n><n>#### Answer A<n><n>### Why the answer is A<n><n>The question asked is, "East coast areas such at Florida are found where?"<n><n>Florida is an east coast area of the United Sates, which is a choice (A)<n><n>The other choices are clearly not places found on the East Coast, and a choice does not need to be Florida to be included between Florida and California, the only question that I can think of is if California is in a different direction of the east coast, meaning not east of Florida.<n><n>### Note: if the question asked "East coast areas" then California would clearly not be an answer as its not on the east coast, but we also know that California is on the west coast so we would have to answer somewhere in the western US<n><n>### Demostration answer<n><n>#### 1: florida<n><n>1: The east coast areas are in florida<n>2: The east coast areas includes florida<n>3: Florida is the east<n>4: United states are in florida too.<n><n>The area in Florida is the East Coast.<n><n>### 1: Answer A<n><n>## 2. Demonstration Answer:<n><n>#### Answer A: Denmark<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could listening to music cause you to be? I'm happy to the bone after listening to songs that make my day every day.<n><n><n><n>### Review:<n>* [Home](../../../)<n>* [Previous: Examiner](../examiner-instruction-rationale/)<n>* [Homework 1: Examiner](../../homework/week-1/examiner-instructions/)<n>* [Home 2: Examiner](..//homework/week-2/examiner-iinstructions/)<n><n><a name="01"></a><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:"There are 10 apples on an apple tree. Jerimiah is four years older than Aimee.  Jerimiah goes to the movies with his sister once every 3 1/2 years.  Once every 9 1/2 years, it rains and the movie theater is closed. How often does Aimee go to the movies with her brother each year?<n><n>### Rationales:Given: 4 years + 9 1/12 = 13 3/4 (every 3 1/12) + 9 11/10 = 14 (every 9 1/3 years<n>+ 9 1/4 = 13 1/3 (every 9 2/10 years) + 11 1/4 =  15 1/2 (every 9 3/7 years) + 9 5/6 = 14 3/4 ( every 9 5/8 years) + 14 11/15 = 15 (every 9 6/15 years)<n>(every 4x + 9 10/15 years) A sister goes to the theater with her brother 4x years later than she does when he is 1 year younger than her.<n><n>### Answer:9 2/15<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Ben was an alcoholic and was in an accident. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John loved competing because he was very competitive.  He liked being about to divide people into what categories? Choices:  A: winners and losers B: perform better C: might win D: losses E: enemies<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Answer(s):<n>1: losers, winners, performs better, enemies<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>RATIONALE:Answers must be divided into "winners and losers" (W), or "perform better" (P), or "might win" (M), or "losers" (L), or "enemies" (E).<n>W, P, L, and E are 4 of the given possibilities; W, L, and M each have 3 of the 4 possibilities.  "May win" can not be divided into W, P, M, or E.<n>W=Win, M=Might win, E=Enemy<n>L=Loser, P=Perform better<n>Since "might win" can go in only one category, W.<n><n>### Input:"You will receive $5 for each book that you review in class and will be paid a bonus of $5 for each book review in which a classroom discussion follows.” Choices: "A: $25 B: $10 C: $1 D: $2"<n><n>### Rationales:Answers must total 25.<n><n>### Explantion:<n>Since the bonus for $5 class discussion is added to $15 for the book review, $25.<n><n>#### 25<n>Answer: 25<n><n>### Instructions:<n>The numbers show how many times to add the first number to the second number each time the results of each calculation are rounded.<n><n>### Rationale:An explanation of why $33 + 53, $12 + 62 and $28$ are the values to enter, in that order.<n><n>### Answer:<n>33+33+28+53=53+62+71+82=145<n>-[154/4]<n><n>### Input("We had 16,728 items to process.  After processing 16,718 of them, we found 103 left over, which equals to a.% of the total number of items.”)<n><n>### Answer:"a." and b. will be 0.00653<n><n>### Rateanles:<n><n>An explanation of
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could prevent someone from buying chistmas presents? Fill in the blanks using the instructional piece provided. If there is no such instruction, the specified responses may be omitted in your answer.<n>Some parts of the instruction are given in italics.  <n><n>### Instrection:<n>A. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Joe bought a ficus. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He was in a cabin in the woods, through the window he saw a fox where? Choices:  A: indiana B: england C: outside D: on the wall E: picture<n><n>### Response:		B>C>E<n><n>### Input<n>#### The gas station is open 11 hours per day on weekdays and six hours on weekends. How much, in hours, does the gas station stay open each day? Answer: 17<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.  <n>####<n>Answer: 17<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. APA Style. (2015, July). Using APA style (7th ed.). Retrieved November 28, 2016, from https://apastyle.apa.org/pa…<n><n>### Instructions:<n><n>#### Input: The local airport is in need of maintenance on their runway. What is the least possible time in minutes that the airport could afford to delay all incoming and outgoing flights in order for the runway to be repaired? (rounded down)<n><n>#### Outputs:<n><n>1. 0<n>2. 1<n>3. 2<n>4. 3<n>5. 4<n>6. 5<n>7. 6<n>8. 7<n><n>#### Demonstration: <n><n>- This method assumes a minimum of 1 in each column. <n>- The following is just an example of how it works.<n><n>|1|2|3|4|5|6|7|8|Time|<n>|---:|---:|---|---|---| ---| ---| ---|<n>|1|2<br>0<br>1|2<br 2<br>0<<22=1(number of time  it takes <n>1 0 1>>>1>to fix a plane and return it <n><n>|2|3| 4<br> 3<< 4+3=7(number of time it takes to fix a plane and return <n>it) <n>Time to repair planes and return them<< 7+0=7>to repair a 0th plane<n><n>|3|4| 5<br> 4<< 5+0=9(number of time it take to fix the plane)<n>Time to repair plan<n>es and return them<<<-1:0:1:2:3=1>><n><n>- The solution was given to me:<n><n>|1|0|0|0|-1|-2|-3|-4|-5|-6|-7|-
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you play a board game with your family? The store is where you purchase board games (C or E).<n><n>### Input 2: Which of the following is the best choice? Choices: A: 12 ounces of pizza B: 50 ounces of pear C: 97 ounces of bread D: 220 ounces of cookie E: 120 ounces F:280 ounces of hamburger<n><n>### Response 2: Cookie is the best choice because it has the greatest quantity of flour.<n><n>### Input3: The 5 best choices from lists A and B are 33249, 96275, 87198, 25734, and 49504. Which of the 3 numbers is the smallest?<n><n>### Response3: 87195 is the smallest of the numbers<n><n>### Rationales: 49505 > 33247;  96275 > 25730;  87195 > 25325;  33249 > 33200<n><n>### Below is a multiple choice question.<n>	<n>### Input: What is 5!? Choices: 20 24 30 60 100<n>### Rational: The largest of the 5! is 60. 5! is equal to 1*2*3*4*5  or 5! = 60 <n>### Answer: 60<n><n>### Example of a task that includes reasoning by contradiction.<n><n>### Dear Mr. Horton<n><n>### Last semester, one of your students, Jim H., was unable to attend any of your courses. (If it equals 12, the remainder is zero, but 24 will never equal 12). Instructions: Correct your friend’s claim by providing a rational.<n><n>### Rational:<n>A friend of yours claim that 24/8 = 12 and not 3,<n><n>24/8 cannot equal 12 or 1 whole number because 12 can only be an even number. (24 ÷ 8 = 3, but 3 is not even number)<n><n>Therefore, a friend of yours claim is false so I, rational, correct that statement,<n><n>Answer: 24/8!= 12<n><n>Answer: <<Answer:24/8!=12>><n><n>## **Exercises:**<n>Below are a set of 22 tasks that you will create with

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would an adult man do to get ready for work? Choices:  A: dress herself B: shower C: dress himself D: drink beer E: drive train<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Solution: A<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Simon bought a cow because he wanted to put it to work.   He didn't want any meat for it.  Where might Simon be taking the cow? Choices:  A: countryside B: city C: dairy farm D: butcher shop E: canada<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Answer: None of the above. Simon cannot take cows to Canada.<n>There are no farming restrictions there.<n><n>### Rationales: Canada doesn't have any farming restrictions, so cow's can be raised there. But Canadians have no interest in cows for farming, they use the meat for a good meal.<n><n>### But, farming is all about meat in a farm, because of this, the cows cannot go to Canada.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If I want to maximize my number of potential customers, where should I build a new department store? Choices:  A: idaho B: shopping mall C: big city D: in town E: new york<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**D**<n><n>#### <n><n>### Demand:You just arrived in a new city looking for a place to rent an aced.  You make a survey of local apartment rental rates.  You find that the minimum monthly rental rate is \$200, and you note that the higher the monthly rent, the greater the demand for that apartment.  You find that there's one apartment that is renting for \$500 each month, a second that is renting for 450, a third that is renting for $460 per month, and so on, but there are no apartments renting for less than \$200 per month.  How much will you pay to rent the maximum number of apartments in the city, but no more.  Explain your answer.<n><n>### Rationales:<n><n>**L**<n>There are two ways to solve this problem:<n><n>1) Using algebraic and number line representations to find the rational root:<n><n>Since all rates are multiplied by $100$, and \$500/100 = \$5, \$450/100= \$4.5, \$460/100=$4.6, \$470/100=-4.7, \$480/100 =~$4.8$, and \$50/10=5, we can tell that there is only one rational root of $0<x<500$.  We now look at what the equation of a line from this one rational root should look like by graphing.  This is what our equation will look like:<n><n><img src="images/graph-a.png" width="297"><n><n>We then look at our graphed equation to find the solution:<n><n><img <n>src="images/graph-b.png"<n>width="297"> <n><n>**I**<n><n>Solution 2:<n><n>*The solution is that there is no maximum number of rentals. The equation is:$$\frac{48}{50}=x-14$$<n><n>By graphing this equation a similar rational root is found:<n><n><img width="297"<n>src="images/
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:I'm at a restaurant ans want a glass of milk, how do I find out if they serve that? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you be going if using a parking lot near a roller coaster? Choices:  A: farm B: business district C: car D: amusement park E: urban area<n><n>### Response:		C (car)<n><n>### Input<n>The temperature outside was 42 degrees Celsius. What was it Fahrenheit by adding 9/5 to 37 followed by subtracting 16+9<n><n>### Response<n>52+37=<<52+37 = 92>>92<n><n>52 was the Celsius degree.<n><n>37 was the Fahrenheit degree.<n><n>When we add 9/5 to both 92 and 9/5 we find: 0=<<0=52>>52.<n><n>After finding 0 we use the subtraction method of 100-F then add in the conversion to Celsius: 92-100=<<91-100=9>>9.<n><n>Thus our answer is: << -7>>-7 or 9 is the Fahrenheit answer.<n><n>### Input A baseball team played 5 games in 1 day the 1st 1 they scored 9 runs, the 2nd 9 runs, the third 15 runs the fourth 8 runs and the last 13 runs. How many total runs did they score.<n><n>### Response A: 52<n>Answer: 52<n><n>### Instructions A: 11 divided by 4 is?<n><n>### Response B: 2.75<n><n>### Input 0 divided by 4<n><n>### Response 0<n>The first number cannot be divided by 2, therefore making the total answer 0.<n><n><n><n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is small knight likely to be found? Therefore, the cows remaining to be moved need more of the transport trucks capacity, which would require trips to be longer to get all of the cattle transported.

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a paper notice likely to be left on a house? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The obsessive man was always washing hands, he had even done it so much once that it caused a what? Choices:  A: use soap B: irritation C: cleanliness D: thinking E: wet towel<n><n>### Response:		A: use soap since using soap, soap can dry and cause the feeling of cleanliness. While not using soap, a wet towel can cause irritation and cause itchiness. Choices:  A,D,E<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Write your answer in the box. If two answers are valid, choose only one. (The answers in the box will appear as hints)<n><n>How many words can be formed from the letters in the word TEENAGER, where the vowels are not allowed to repeat?<n><n>### Instructor Notes:<n>This problem is intended for your review.<n><n>### Solution:<n>This is a simple word form problem. What we want to find out is how many words of what length can be formed the letters in TEENAGER. <n><n>TEENAGER has 8 letters, so the largest words we can form has 8 letters. We have 5 vowels, so the words we form can have less than 5 vowels. So, our starting point in the formation of the word is to use **exactly 5 vowels and exactly 3 consonants**. <n><n>Then, we put the vowels in the word. The next step is to use each consonant exactly once, but this is easy, because the vowels have already been fixed. We now need to determine how many times each consonant can be used in the word. It is very simple, because once a consonant has been used 5 times, the next vowel has to be used as the 6th letter of the word. But, this makes things simple as we just have to count the frequency of the occurrence of each, and in the list below, I've added the frequency how often we repeat each set of the 5 consonants.<n><n>Let's try it out. <n><n>1. Once, A<n>2. Once, E<n>3. Twice, I<n>4. Once, O<n>5. Once, U<n>6. Only once more, 5 in all<n><n>We can clearly see that we can make a total of 6 different words, if we include the 6th word which will use all the existing letters in the word TEEENAGER.<n><n>Since the vowels cannot be repeated, we can only use one vowel each.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is known to always have snow? Choices:  A: africa B: north pole C: roof D: canada E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>This task must be done in Python using the numpy package for working with numpy arrays<n>NumPy is a Python package that includes the mathematical subroutines needed to compute things like the mathematical mean, median, and mode of a set of data. This package also allows data to be arranged in columns and rows (a 2-D grid), in order to be processed and analyzed mathematically.<n><n>Numpy will be used to convert the string input to a numpy array so that the mode, the mean, and the median can be computed.<n>numpy is used to convert the text into a numpy array so that statistics can be computed.<n>```python<n>import numpy<n>from statistics importmode, mean, median<n><n>inputstringarray=['africa','northpole','roof','canada','surfaceofearth']<n><n>inputarrays = numpy.asarray(inputstringarray)<n><n>print(mode(inputarrays))<n>```<n><n>You should see an answer of either Africa or Canada.<n><n><n>### Input<n>1. An artist purchased canvas for $16.  The shipping and handling costs are $2.  And she also paid $64 for a brush when she bought the canvas.  What was her total cost, in dollars, of the canvas, the shipping and handling, and the brush combined?<n>Rationales The first cost was $16.The additional cost was $2.The additional cost was again the same value.And the total cost for the canvas, the shipping and the brush combined was $16+$2+$64=$112$112<n><n><n>```python<n>import python<n>```<n>from python import mode<n><n><n><n>```python <n>num = input("Enter the cost of canvas plus the shipping and handling costs plus the cost of the Brush").replace(" ","").replace(","," ")<n>```<n><n>from mode import *<n><n>```python<n>mode(num.rsplit())<n>```<n><n><n>### Answer:<n><n><n>### <n><n>### Input and Output:<n>The input is a sentence which reads, “If I were you, I would choose the carpenter, not the chisel.” How many different words can an English-speaking child learn from this sentence?<n>Rationales In the phrase “I would choose” are the words “choose” and “would

It had originally cost the owner $4,800.  Her cost price was divided by 5.  The antique shop will sell the chandelier for 5% more than the retail price of a similar chandelier.  What is the retail price of another chandelier?<n><n>#### A<n>Ans. 6,250<n><n>#### B<n>Ans. 3,000<n><n>#### C<n>Ans. 900<n><n>#### D<n>Ans. 2,100<n><n>### Answer<n>#### D. 2,160<n>The chandelier originally cost the shopkeeper $4,801 and she sold it at one sale for $3,421.<n>Now she has an antique chandelier for sale.<n>Retail price at 5 percentage points is $3,600.<n>So the retail price is $6201*(100/105)=<<6201*(0.95/0.95)=2160>>2160$.<n><n>### Instructions: What is the perimeter of a square?<n><n>### Demstration:<n><n>#### A<n>64/2=32<n><n>#### B<n>4*4=16<n><n>#### C<n>4*side4=8<n><n>#### D<n>sqrt(4*4+4*4)<n><n>#### E<n>4*4+44=64<n><n>### Answer:<n>#### C<n>4 side<n><n>### Inputs: The average cost of 20 tickets to a baseball game is $28. Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The priest pushed for more orthodox behavior, what kind of behavior was he trying to stop? Choices:  A: liberal B: heretical C: recalcitrant D: conservadox E: heretical<n><n>### Response:		C<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input: For the following numbers, determine whether each of them is a cube.<n>Squares are indicated with an *<n><n>**1. 21:*13<n><n>**2. 26:*13<n>**3. 38:*13<n> **4. 28:*13**<n>**5. 64:*13**  <n> **6. 81:*13**   <n> **7. 100:*13**    <n> **8. *6:*/13**   <n>9. 81: *13**<n><n><n>**Rationales:**Cubes are the three-digit numbers, starting with 1, that represent the number of units of side length. (The 2s and 3s, or the 9s, or the 12s are not counted.)  32 (21) is a cube. The cube of some two-digit number, and then add one to that number. For example, 8 has three cubes: 8,  9, and 10. The 10 is a cube as well, because it is the two-digit number that represents three units of side length.   If an odd numbered cube is multiplied by an odd numbered cube, then the product is an even cube.   If an odd-numbered cube is multiplied even-numbered cube, then the resulting cube is odd.   A cube may be a fraction in lowest terms, such as 1/2 (which indicates two units of area.)   There will be one cube on each row, left to right. When the row is completed, there will be one row in which every number is a cube (therefore, a cube is in each column and a cube is in every row.)<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer:C<n><n>## Below is an instruction that asks a question, followed by 4 possible answers.<n>Write a response that appropriately responds to the request.<n><n>Write a response to the prompt below.<n><n>### Input : Find the product, correct to the nearest penny, of 3.20 * 2.10<n><n>### Question : What was the product of that

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would a Martian find the Indian Ocean? How much would the DVD player cost with the state sales tax applied to the DVD player and the department stores' sales tax applied to the total cost?<n><n>### Rationale<n>If the price is $159.00, the department stores' sales is $18.00.<n>And <n>5.75+12+18=<<5.75+ 12+18>>27.75.<n>Thus, the total cost with the department stores' sales applied to the total cost = $18.027.75 = 372.95.<n><n>Answer=373<n><n>### Input How would you describe a positive rational number?<n>

Choices: A: the population growth was negligible B: the population grew exponentially. C: the growth was not nearly as fast D: the increase was linear E: the increase was geometric<n><n>### Response:(a) The population growth rate or change needed to double the population is proportional to the current number. This is equivalent of saying the number must increase by at least a factor of 2. Thus, the population must increase at least 100% to double in size.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do farmers keep toothpicks? Choices:  A: mouth B: grocery store C: constructing models D: shed E: box<n><n>### Response:		A is correct<n><n>### Input<n><p style="box-sizing: border-box; color: darkblue; float: right;"><n>  <img src="https://github.com/codinginmath/codinginmath.github.io/blob/master/test_problems/math9.png?raw=true" alt="math9" style="width:200 pxs"><n></p> <n><n>### Response<n>We are given that the distance from point $A$ to point $B$ is $3\frac{1}{2}$ units, and that the distance from point A to point C is $\frac{5}{6}$ units.  We need to find the value of $b$. Our two rules of thumb are: 1. In an isosceles triangle, the length of one base is $1$ divided by 2 times the length of the other base; and 2. In an isoscelean triangle, one angle equals the sum of the other two angles.  Applying the second rule, we see that $\angle ABC$ equals the sum of $\angle ABA$ and $\angle ABD$. Hence, $\angle ABC$ will equal $\angle ABA+\angle ACD$ or $\frac{\angle ABA+\angle ABD}2$.  In a right triangle, each of the angles is $\frac{\pi}{2}$ plus the measure of the two angles that are not $\pi/2$.  We can plug in  $\frac{\angle ACD}2=\frac{\pi}{2}-2\times\frac{\pi}{6}$ and get $$\angle ACD - \angle ABA = \frac{7 \pi}{12}.$$ We simply need  to solve for $b$.<n><n>As a sanity check that we haven't made mistakes, we can divide both sides of the equation by $3$, and take $3 \angle ABC = 7 \pi \div 12$, to get $6 \pi\div12=1$ or $\pi\div 6=\frac{1}{6}$.<n><n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input and response to this instruction are available [here](https://github.com//codinginmath/blob/master/instruction_and_response.docx).<n>Courtesy of [http://www.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you put a dictionary while you're using it? Choices:  A: library B: study area C: table D: classroom E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		What is the total square footage of a square pyramid if the bases of the pyramid are 10 feet across and the height is 50 feet? Choices: A: 300 ft2 B: 200 ft2 C: 500 ft2 D: 600 ft2 E: 810 ft2<n><n>### Input<n>How many cubic meters of snow are available in a region if there are 4 hours of uninterrupted, 15 degree Celsius weather during the winter, and then there is a blizzard that lasts for 8 hours and drops 3 inches of snow and there are 4 hours more 15 degree weather before the season ends, as shown in the diagram below?<n><n><n>Input: What is the sum of the cubed number(s) of each whole number under the graph?<n><n>Demonstration:  <n>![image-20180712221618339.png](https://assets.khanacademy.org/contentProviders/khanacademy/105/img/image-20190410085920175.png)<n><n>There are a total of 9 cubes in the below graph; we know that that is the sum of the squares of each of the numbers in the graph; we also know that the sum of the squares is equal to the number of cubes in the graph.<n><n>In the graph below there are:<n><n>\(\begin{array}{c|c|c|c}\cline{1-4} 11 & 8 & 1 & 4 \\ \hline 64 & 256 & 16 & 64\end{array}\)<n><n>Sum of the squares=64+256+6+64=548<n><n>Sum of the cubes=6^2+8^2+1^2+4^2=113+64+1+64=242<n>The answer that can represent each number in the graph is 242.<n><n>Input:  An average of 500 people per day cross a particular bridge.  Traffic is at its heaviest during the hour that the sun reaches its
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Bill did not abandon the fight, but did what to the enemy? Of the remaining three natural areas, open meadow, great outdoors, and England, the last sounds like the best choice.<n><n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If you have trouble beginning work you're suffering from what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: excitement C: tiredness D: progress E: procrastination<n><n>### Response:		Answering this question requires you to have read the book and its instructional comments. <n><n>### Input answer:  The correct choice is sitting down.<n>Rationales: In the book it states, "the reason we choose the wrong options, not realizing that the one we want is one of the other four, is that we have our minds and souls in the wrong place, and we have forgotten the cardinal rule: the place to begin is always where you sit down, not where you stand up."<n><n>### Input Answer:  A: B: C: D: E:<n><n>### Response answer: B.<n><n>#### The correct choice is A :<n><n>#### The correct answer is D :<n><n>### Review<n><n>#### A: Sit Down<n><n>#### C: Tiredness<n><n>#### D: Procrastination<n><n>#### E: Progress<n><n>### Reference<n><n>https://www.amazon.com/dp/161577319X<n><n>### Acknowledges<n><n>https://github.com/pjthought/CodePile1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a lover likely to want to do with their partner? Choices:  A: build family together B: fall in love C: make love D: complete E: distance themselves<n><n>### Response:		Which response corresponds to the letter you should type before A, B, C, or D?<n>A<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: A  <n><n>### Feedback:<n><n>## Input:A woman has 100 bite-size snack bars. She wishes to eat one per day for 10 consecutive days, but only eat enough to fill her hunger for that day and not to waste food.  Given that each bar weighs the same as the next, how many bite-size snacks will she eat?<n><n>Rationales:<n>The weight of any snack bar is 100/100=<<100/12>>12 grams<n><n>Suppose that her snacks weigh out to be 100/days, which is 100*12=<<100*11>>1100 gram total for 10 days.<n><n>Each day has 86,400 seconds, so 1000 grams lasts 0:001 seconds. Each day has 900 pieces remaining.  Thus the number of pieces she will eat for each day is 1000 divided by 900==0:00133 seconds or 0.33 pieces per day.<n><n>So in 10 days, she will have been given 900 pieces or 5230 grams, but 5230/5200==<<5230/11>>11 grams=169/1000 pieces eaten each day.<n><n>#### 169   <br>  149<n>Answer: 149<n><n>### Input:(A) A man goes into the bakery to buy 32 dozen pies, each 9 inches in diameter.  He does not wish to waste any, so he cannot buy more than 16 dozen, for a total of 216 pies.  (B) A family of four people must use just 6 boxes of pasta from an 18-box supply, so they only buy 6 boxes.<n><n>### Response:( A) If the bakery sells him exactly 16 dozen (the minimum) pies, how many 9″ pie plates will

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does a person looking for new things in life do? Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What often happens after a long day of traveling? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would you put furniture on top of? Choices:  A: roof B: room C: floor D: apartment E: neighbor's house<n><n>### Response:		The response should be a multiple choice answer: Choice (D), option (none of these).<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The question is about the most appropriate "furniture."  The answer would be an apartment or house, and a floor is the most appropriately furnished floor.<n>However, furniture is intended for humans, and the "furnished floor" has other critters walking on it, making the floor not a reasonable choice for furniture.<n>For that reason, it does not seem appropriate to have a response for the question that is a type of housing (e.g., the apartment or the house).<n>The only appropriate piece of furniture for walking on and having other kinds of critters on it is the floor.<n><n>#### D<n>Answer: None of these<n><n>Input: A bicycle repair kit contains 2 wheel bearings, 3 brake pads, and 1 chain tool.  There are 55, 85, and 50 more of the given items than the number of repair kits there are.  How many repair kits are there?<n><n>Input: Given the number of days that are in a specific month.<n><n>The following response is a multiple choice response: What is the number of days in that month?<n><n>#### A<n>Answer: 30<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: 28<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: 32<n><n>#### D<n>\[<n>351<n>\]<n>Answer: None of the above<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:How can an artist commemorate a horse forever. So, you can say its kentucky derby.<n><n><n>### Input1:Anne can eat 2.5x as many ice cream sandwiches as her sister. Which best represents Anne’s sandwiches? Choice: 14x3 12x3 8x3 2x3<n>### Response:  7x6 =<<7x6=42>>42<n><n>### Input2:How do you think the answer will look?<n><n>### Response1: The way my brain thinks is when you see something that ate a lot you can see 42.<n><n>### Response2:42(22)<n><n>### Instructions:The instructions are how you can make a paper airplane. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The color yellow is associated with the opposite of the characteristic, what is it? Choices:  A: fearless B: english carrier C: courageous D: brave E: achromatic<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n>Answer: E<n><n>### Input for 2020<n><n>The temperature varies in the Sahara Desert. On a particular day, the temperature ranged from 35 degrees Celsius at 07:00 to 39 degrees Celsius at noon, and to 33 degrees Celsius at midnight. What was the average daily temperature range in degrees Celsius?<n><n>#### 6<n><n>Answer: 6<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The man needed balls of cotton, where should he look? Choices:  A: south B: georgia C: north carolina D: pocket E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A: south<n><n>### Input The store has not received any deliveries from the 3,000 mile delivery truck that is on its way. A snowstorm, however, is threatening to prevent any deliveries from arriving. The store has 200 units, 250 units, 400 items, and 500 items in inventory, but not necessarily in that order. How many will not be available if the storm prevents any deliveries?<n><n>### Answer:<n>The first 4 choices are eliminated because they all represent non sequiturs:<n>The store has not received a delivery (3,000 miles away).<n>The store is not on the verge of receiving a delivery.<n>The store already received deliveries<n><n>Only choice E may be correct.<n><n>#### E: medicine cabinet<n>Answere: 500
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. An input describes the task that needs to be done. A response is the answer that correctly completes that task.<n><n>### Examples:<n>#### Input:Your friend sends you a text message requesting permission for his girlfriend to drive his car. How many times per week or per month does he intend to drive the car?<n>#### Possible Responses:<n>A) Once per week B) Once per month<n>#### Answer:<n>#### A<n>The answer is incorrect due to:<n><n>A) Once per month could be interpreted as once per month from your friend's perspective,<n><n>#### C<n>Once per month could be interpreted from your perspective either for the whole month, or<n>1 month = 4 weeks, so every Sunday.<n><n>B) The answer would be once per week.<n><n>#### Input:Your boss gives you a work assignment. Your boss tells you when to complete the assignment, but not how long it should be. You estimate the length of time required to complete the assignment to be between 12 and 14 hours inclusive. In the second 100 seconds, 5 people die, while 10 people live.  How many people died during the film and how many people lived?<n><n>### Answer: A: 17 B: 13 C: 11 D: 12<n><n>### Part(B)<n>Input: If a plane travels 45 miles, it takes 1 hour and 3 hours. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The movie had many a song and dance, it was a what? Choices:  A: bollywood B: record C: musical D: jukebox E: napster<n><n>### Response:		D- "jukebox"<n><n>## Instructions for the response:<n><n>- [Type Responses Below!](#response_box)<n><n>#### Type Responses Below:<n>| Answer : | Response:  |<n>|:----------|:--------------|<n><n>**DONE!**<n><n>***<n><n>Back to main page [![](https://i.imgur.com/vqwj7QA.png)](https://leaderboard.cs.ubc.ca/cs172-2021-spring/practice/*0001  [UBC CS 172](https://www.cs.ubc dot ca/courses/spring16/cpsc172)<n> 0001  * Practice**!)![](https://i.redd.it/260f4i77xb091.png)[UBC CS 109](https://www.ubc.ca  [UBC CS109](https:/u  [UBC CS9  [UBC CS3  [UBC CS271](https://www.cstheweb.ca) UBC CS460](https://www.ece.mcgill.ca/ece474-a2010/instructors/#cs460[UBC CS460) <n>[UBC CS415](https://cs415-cs.ca/2019-spring/practices) <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:After the guilty verdict in the killing the judge gave a speech, he told the murderer he was pure what?
