Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Many containers full of goods are unloaded where after their long sea journey Choices:  A: port B: cargo ship C: refrigerator D: food E: lorry<n><n>### Response:		A: B: C: D: E:<n><n>### Incorrect<n>### Incorrect-Comment<n>### Incorrect Correct<n>### Correct Correct<n>### Demonstanation:<n><n>### <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:An attempt to confirm an applicant's reference would fail if the reference does what? Choices:  A: question B: dispute C: deny D: contradict E: refuse<n><n>### Response:		If the reference denies the information, then the confirmation attempt fails.<n>There are three other choices, some of which do not directly contradict the information on the reference.<n>#### <n>Answer:D) Refuse<n><n>### InputA company has just started making a particular brand of car. A customer must visit the dealership's service department 7 times within the 1st3 months of purchasing the car. At what rate, in dollars and cents, should the service be charged for a 3-month period if the average service visit costs $50?<n><n>### RationalesThe average service visit costs $10 and lasts for 4 hrs, so the average service visit lasts for 4/10 = <<4/10=40>>4 hrs.<n><n>### Response<n>Let n = <<n=7>>7 visits in the first 3 months.<n>Each 4hr visit costs 4*$50 = <<4*$50=200>>200 dollars.<n>Since n = 7, we have [n*(4hrs/visit)] = [200*(7/4hours/visit)].<n>So (4*200)/7 = <<200/7=28>>28, since each visit is worth 4hrs/visits.<n>#### 28<n>Answer: 28<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a microphone boom likely to be covering a stock market event? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What happens to cats every day? Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where are seats most likely bleachers? Choices:  A: movies B: opera C: theater D: lecture hall E: hockey game<n><n>### Response:		<n><i>Where are seats most likely to be bleachers?</i><n><i>Answer</i>: Seats in movies, opera, theater, and lecture hall are most likely to be bleacher type seats.<n><n>### Input :How would you describe the term, "efficiency" as it applies to science? Choices: A:the amount of energy a chemical reaction<n>B:the type of refrigerator that best keeps food cold C:the minimum amount of time to produce a desired result D:the easiest way to complete a task<n>E:none of the above<n>Rationales: Answer: C<n><n><n><n>### Input  :How would you describe a scientific hypothesis, Choices: A:a working model to explain observed facts B:an untested explanation C:the result of a study D:a prediction of a cause and effect relationship E:none of the above <n>#### A B C<n><n>#### D<n><n>#### E<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>This task requires a response and an explanation. Read carefully to find out the best response.<n><n><i>Response:</i> A hypothesis is a prediction and explanation based on prior research of the predicted outcome of future observations.<n><n><i><i><i><i>Explanation:</i></i></i></i><n>An interesting way to think about a hypothesis is that it is the opposite of a fact. In other words, if a fact is a statement regarding the world in the present, a hypothesis is what you are willing to take as a fact if your present research proves to be correct. To put it in terms that may appeal to students of science: every science project involves the formulation of a <i><i><i>&ldquo;hypothesis&rdquo;</i></i></i>. For example, if your science fair project involves growing some kind of organism under controlled conditions and then testing its effects on a chemical compound, then your hypothesis would tell you what you <i><i><b>think</b></i></i> will happen to the plant under those circumstances (i.e., whether the plant will grow better or worse). (Taken from: [Cognitive-Approach](link) )<n><n><n>### Output:<n><n><img src="../img/output.pdf" alt="output"

Write and solve a numerical expression that describes the range of people who attend any class offered in such a course.<n><n>### Response<n><n>(10 ≤ x ≤ 80)<n><n><n>### Answer<n>40 + 41 +17 ≤ x ≤80–17  53 ≤ x ≤72<n><n>### Input<n>Write a rational expression to describe the speed that a certain number n travels downhill, given that n >2 and n ≥ 3 is a positive integer.<n>To be written correctly, your answer must comply with the conditions: (n < 16) and (n ≤ 32).<n><n>### Response and Rationale:<n><n>x= ((((((15 -n)/2)+n)*2)/((15 -n)*n)) - 4)<n><n>### Answer and Rationals:<n>The expression  n< 16 is true for an integer n such that n= 21,<n>31, 41,..., 151 or even n≥ 17.<n><n>Therefore, the expression<n><n><n>15 -n = 15 -2n (or)<n>15 – n – 2 = 0<n><n>is true for n if n≥ 2.<n><n>By comparing the two expressions on the left hand side and right hand side, the following inequality is obtained:<n>x + 2 < 16<n>x ≥ 14<n>x = 15<n><n><n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a telephone booth likely to be red? Choices:  A: airport B: gotham city C: london D: city E: gas stations<n><n>### Response:		<n>I am assuming you are asking where in each location is a telephone boo located. <n><n>Here is an approach for doing this. <n><n>First locate where each place is geographically. <n><n>Next, look up locations at each location and look for where telephone booths are located. <n><n>The locations listed are as follows:<n><n>- Airport - Location is where you typically need a telephone booth. <n><n>- Gotham City - No telephone booths. <n><n>- London - We should have an idea in which location phone use is located (i.e., in the city). <n><n>- City  - We should have an indication where we are going to want a phone call.  (i.e,, the city). <n>*Even though the word "gas" is in the name, the location is most likely to indicate a city location. <n><n>- Gas Station - This is the most obvious location of a phone booth, as people tend to want use them where we typically run out of gas. <n><n>And thus the answer will be: E <n><n>### Instructions: <n>Please choose your response from the multiple choice options under each prompt.<n><n>### Input<n>Input: 44<n>Rationales: <n><n>Input:  68<n>Rationales:<n><n>Input:  45<n>Rationales:  <n><n>Input:  71<n>Rationales:    <n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is someone unintentionally hurting someone else but unable to stop likely to feel? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sally was a senior in the House. Because of this, john is very careful about the places he goes.  Where might he avoid going? Choices:  A: pet store B: parking lot C: woodland D: north america E: park<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input: John loves animals and he is careful about the places he stays because he hates animal abuses.<n>Rationales:  A: John goes to the pet store to buy a pet. He does not go to the pet store because of his hate for animal abuses.<n>B: John goes to buy his favorite snacks in the parking lot.<n>C: John goes to the woods to look after the animals.<n>D: John goes to North America to have some adventures with animals.<n>E: John goes to the park to see his favorite animals.<n>Answer:<n><n>Input: You have four pairs of colored glasses: Two blue glasses, two yellow glasses, two red glasses, and two green glasses. One way to arrange these glasses in a single row is with a green glass in the middle and two glasses of the same color on either side. Another way to arrange the glasses is to alternate sides, but always arrange them so that there is a different color at the end. If the glasses are randomly distributed around the room, which two colors are most likely to appear next to each other?<n>Rationales:(16)(0.75)(0)(x)<n>In the first case, since there are only 4 pairs and the rule is to have a colour of the left and a colour of the right, we have options left or right with the colours blue, yellow, red then green.<n>In the second case, we have 4 possibilities left and right, but we know the order. So if we start from the first left (right, left, left, left, right) there is only room for 4 options and they must be alternating. We can eliminate the last option and the other possibilities are left or right (alternating or not) with the colours (blue, yellow, red, blue).<n>The right colour at the beginning is not likely to appear at the right end at the end.<n>Option D<n>Answer: <n><n>Input: The diagram shown represents a network. Two of the switch ports connect to servers that are identified as S1 and S6.  A third switch port connects to a printer labeled P. What are the roles of each of the nodes shown in the diagram

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would you tell ali to do if he bumps into you when you are walking? Choices:  A: work hard B: slow down C: wear shoes D: sell products E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		<n><n><n>Input: What did Muhammad do at work when he bumped into you when you were walking? Choices: A: Work hard B: Slow down C: Wear shoes D: Sell products E: Speed up<n><n>#### D<n><n>Answer: D<n><n><n>### Input<n>Choices: A: 30 minutes.<n>B: 1 minute.<n>C: 10 minutes.<n>D: 5 minutes.<n><n>#### 10<n>Answer:10<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What do people do to pass time before they can use electronics when fly in airplane? Choices:  A: read B: passenger C: land plane D: fly the plane E: buy tickets<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer will always depend on the airplane.<n><n>If passengers are free to use electronics in flight, this question does not apply, and they are flying in a plane that has already landed.<n><n>If the plane has not landed, passengers are trying to stay sane. Therefore, they must pass the time.<n><n>If electronic usage is limited, passengers may read paper books, or play games together.<n><n>If the pilot is still taking off or landing the plane, the passengers will be afraid to touch any electronic devices which would put them at risk due to safety concerns.<n><n>The people who would be able to fly the plane are still undergoing training, therefore, A cannot be the answer.<n><n>If the passengers do not have tickets, this is a non-issue, so F cannot be the answer. <n><n>Therefore, a is the correct answer.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to sore a wind instrument in you home? Choices:  A: under bed B: symphony C: music room D: band practice E: music store<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Input:  A: A B: B  C: C   D: D E: E<n><n>### Response-D<n><n>### Description:<n>The ratios of each choice are: A(8/100<<<8/100=8/0.8>>8/0.8): B(0.4/5<<<0.4/5=0.4/0.04>>0.4/0<n><n>### Output:<n>C: C(8/10)< 0.8/5< 0.8.0.8/10<n><n>### Solution:<n>C: C<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions<n><n>### Choice A: A<n><n>### Demotration: Answer the following multiple choice question<n><n>### Response A<n><n>### Instuction Answer with following Multiple choice Question<n><n>### Choices A: A<n><n><n>### Solution<n>Solution: A
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:She curled up under a blanket to get warm, this made her what on the couch as they started movie? Choices:  A: sleep B: feel more comfortable C: sweating D: blush E: cuddle<n><n>### Response:		<n>In my opinion answer is : A<n><n>#### 4.4<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input:(7n+4/7n+3)/8+2/(-7n+4/9n+5/n-9/30)<n>#### 16.55<n>Answer: 16.5<n><n>### Input<n>You are 22% below your yearly cost for groceries this year, and at the end of this year you will be 38% of your yearly income.<n><n>What are your average costs per month? Choices: A: 685/B: 725/C: 760/D: 770/E: 800/F: 830<n>### Response:  I believe that answer is E : 800 because according to the rationale " you had already used 38% of you're yearly income, then the average cost per month must be 80, as an illustration :<n>If your yearly income of $1200, so you used 38% that means 450$, then you already spent 450$ of the 1200 $ which leaves 750 $, so average cost per month must then by 100/750=<<100/705=1.4>>1.4$<n><n><n><n><n>### Input : What's the sum of these fractions? : Choices : A: 5/7<n>### Response : A<n><n>### input:<n>While driving down a back road, a cyclist was able to ride 35 miles in just 2 hours and 5 minutes. She was going 11 mph slower than she was able to ride in less time when riding on the highway. What was the cyclist's average rate of speed (in miles per hour) on the highway?<n>### rationale:<n>I would solve this problem using the formula : average rate of speed+1= <<a+1>>2<n>Raising both sides to the 2 we get:<n>2 (a+1)= 4<n><n>A+1 = 2<n><n>A= <<A>>1/2<n><n>A=<<13>>1/2<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does moving cars entail? Choices: 1 hours B1 hours and 10 minutes 2 hours and 10 mins C2 hours 3:10 D2:4:12 E1:10:30<n>Rationales: Answer:1:6:0=<<Answer:1:6:2=36>>36<n><n>Answer: 36

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a binder containing homework assignments? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would a person expect if they are competent in their school work? Choices:  A: compliments B: passing grade C: intellectual challenge D: sticker E: avoid pain<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is "A".<n>Competent students should do well both academically and socially. It does not make sense for competent students to do "avoid pain" since they should be confident in themselves and will have received good marks and compliments already, thus, they should be enjoying school. If students do poorly in school or get low marks it shows that they are not competent in their area of work.<n><n><n>### Input 2: What would a person expect if he's just following his parents' expectations? Choices: A: good grades B: avoid pain C: intellectual challenge D. compliments E: passing grade<n><n>### Response 2:<n>The correct answer for this is "D". This can be explained by the fact that a student should have a different and different set of expectations to his parent's expectations. As parents provide students with basic needs - food, clothing and shelter -, students should develop their minds and think for themselves rather than just doing things as expected from their parents. For example, students may be given money by their parents in order to purchase something. However, if a student is to spend the money at a certain place then it would defeat the purpose of giving the student money. Similarly if students would get low marks from their subjects then they could not fulfil their parent's expectations of them. However, if the student was competent in his/her work then parents should be proud of their children, giving then compliments.<n><n>### Input<n>What is the correct punctuation for the sentence "I can play soccer, football, badminton and swim"?<n><n>### Response<n>The correct answer will be "A". This is because of the fact that this sentence is an interrogative sentence and the question mark should be present to show the interrogation. Another sentence that could be written as a sentence is "I know it was you who stole the bag". This sentence is also correct by itself. So the correct sentence should be "I can play socer, football, badmintnon, and swim!<n><n><n>### Instrucion<n>What would two or more digits in the same position of a repeating decimal equal? Choices: A. 1 B. 0 C. - D. 1 over 3 E. 0 over 3 F. both A and F G. 1 over

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:There weren't enough chairs for everyone.  What might have to be delayed? Choices:  A: bookstore B: building C: meeting D: office E: coffeehouse<n><n>### Response:		<n>A meeting was scheduled to take place in the conference room. The conference room seats 32. There were 31 people present, and the room only had 7. Everyone in the conference room had to stand. They couldn't get their meeting done until someone else had their meeting and 7 people left.<n><n>### Outcome:It probably affected sales.<n><n>### Input:: There weren't enough managers to attend the conference meeting. But the managers were willing to come anyway. What were the consequences? Choices:A: Everyone had to sit in the same room. B: Everyone had to wait their turn to speak. C: The managers wouldn't have time to go to their classes. D: They didn't get to hear about new products. E: Those that had classes had to sit next to the people who didn't<n><n>### Outline:<n>##### The managers could sit in their normal seats, and those who had classes could sit in their seats.<n>##### Or they could both share the same seats.<n>##### That would be inconvenient.<n>##### Maybe they could use lounge chairs or foldable chairs.<n>##### Then they could sit in the same room as well.<n><n>### Response_2:<n>##### It probably affected classes in that those who had classes would want to attend to classes and not attend to the meeting.<n>##### Then those who didn't have classes wouldn't get information about new products because those who did have classes would be more focused on attending to their classes.<n><n>### Expectation_1:<n>##### What would happen to anyone who has to teach a class and also attend a meeting?<n><n>##### The teacher would have to choose where she would want her students to sit.<n><n>### Answer:A<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What preposition do you use if you want to combine two words? Choices:  A: article B: adjective C: interjection D: conjunction E: pronoun<n><n>### Response:		A: article<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where in your home would you store birth control pills near your toothpaste? Choices:  A: medicine cabinet B: chemist's shop C: kitchen D: drug store E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>**Option 1.** 20<n><n>**Option 2.** E<n><n>### Input.<n>Where in your home would a carpenter keep nails near a hammer? Choices: A. medicine cabinet B. chemist's shop. C. kitchen D. drug store. E. bedroom<n><n>## Input 3<n><n>Which of the following statements describes the relationship among the numbers 15, 17, 21, and 50?  Choices:  A. 15-17 is approximately equal to 15-21 is equal to 50-50.<n><n>Answer: 15-16=<<15-16>=3>>50-50=50-50<n><n>**Option2** 21<n><n>### Input 4<n>Ask: A mathematician is considering giving an outdoor party in a suburban area, where the temperature varies 20 degrees Fahrenheit above zero for every degree below 60 degrees Fahrenheit. If the temperature is 30 degrees below 60, then what is the temperature in degrees Fahrenheit?<n><n>Answer: (-60-20)=<<(-60-20)>=-40>>-40<n><n>## Input 5<n><n>Ask: A student earned 10 points for the day's quiz, 30 points for completing a paper on a historical figure, 40 points for an oral presentation on a controversial issue. If the students earned 30 and 40 points, then what grade could the student have earned for the day?<n><n>**Answer 1:**<n>if (40 + 30) > 30 → 40+30>30 =30+30=20 = 20 + 10 = 30 => 30<n><n>**Answer 2:**<n><n>If 30 is divisible by 2, then 30 - 10 = 20 = 2 + 1 + 8 + 1 = 91<n><n>**Answer 3:**<n>(15+ 30 + 10) +30 - 30 + 30 = 30 +30 =6
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where should you find a school in? Choices:  A: residential neighborhood B: mosque C: every city D: prague E: community<n><n>### Response:		The options are:<n>A.<n>A residential neighborhood<n><n>B.<n>A mosque<n><n>C.<n>Every city<n><n>D.<n>In the streets<n><n>E.<n>In a community<n><n>A. The correct answer is A.<n><n>B. The correct answer is B.<n><n>C. The correct answer is C.<n><n>D. The correct answer is D.<n><n>E.The correct answer is E.<n>

Use at least two complete sentences in your answers.<n><n>### Input 1:It took 1 hour to walk to school. It took 2 hours to cook the hamburgers for the barbecue. What is the total time it took to go to the barbecue? <n><n>### The total time it took to get to the barbecue is the sum of the two given times.<n><n>### Answer 1:It took an hour to go to the barbeque.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>The sum of 1 and 2 is 1+2=<<1+2=3>>3<n>And 3 is the total time taken to go to the barbaraq.<n><n>### Question 2:What is the sum of the given times?<n><n>### Given times: 0 minutes to walk to school. 3 minutes to cook the hamburger. Answer:13<n><n>#### 13<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The sum of the given times is 3+0+3=<<3+0+3=(7/3)=<<7>>7<n><n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Some stores trick women to buy products, the sales make it seem like if you buy more you what? Choices:  A: get money B: pay money C: go shopping D: lose money E: save money<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>### Demostration: Choose the most appropriate response. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does god want people to do for money? Choices>>: A: 20.2 B: 20 C: 19.3 D: 19.1<n><span> </span>>The correct answer is <span>A</span><span> </span>.<n><span> </Span> <span> </span><b><span>B</span></b><span> </span> is not correct because the total will always be less than 20.<n><span> </b><span>C</span><span> </b>  is not correct because the addition operation adds 9.1 and 7.3 first and then subtracts 0.4 from the sum and adding 0.7 to the sum. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is something that you feel when you go to the opera? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a desk normally occupied by a young person? Choices:  A: office building B: schoolroom C: library D: bedroom E: gym<n><n>### Response:		A: office building<n>The gym is not a typical classroom setting.<n>Libraries are considered educational institutions, but are not a primary classroom.<n>Schoolrooms are typically used for classes.<n><n>### Input:# Which side of the train is the engine on? # I: A: B: C: D: E: F: # II: A: B: # I: Answer the questions in the order that they are given (do not skip any questions).<n><n>I:<n>1. The engine is on the I side of the train.<n>2. The engine is on I/F.<n><n>II:<n>3. The engine is on A/B.<n><n>### Output:I/F<n>The engine is on I/f.<n>There are two sides to the train. One is the 'front-side' and the other is the 'backside'. The front side is the 'I side' and the backside is the 'F side'. The 'I' can be located anywhere on the train, but it can only be on the front-side. So, if the train has an 'I', then the I side can only be the front side.<n><n>### Response II:B<n>There are two sides: A and B. I is on the B side. The A and the I sides are the only sides that can be on the front side. The F side can be on either the A side or the B side. The D side can be on either side. And the C side can be on either. So, the engine is on B/F.

The cost of each oil drilling rig is $200,000, and the revenue for producing oil is proportional to the length of the well drilled multiplied by the cost per barrel of oil produced from that length of the well. Each length of well that is drilled yields 1 barrel of oil.  For each well, a drilling rig that is used to drill the well costs $1,000/day for each day it is used to drill that particular well. For what, in days, will it take to dig 5 barrels of oil?<n>Rationales:"$1,000 per day per rig"<n>Because each length of well that is drilled yields 1 barrel, the revenue produced for a length of 1 well is $100,001 and the revenue for a length of 2 wells is $2,000,002 and so forth.<n>Each barrel of oil produced costs $200.000.<n>Therefore, $1,001*3=<<1,001,3=$3,000>> 3,000 is the cost of 1 barrel,<n>$2,001*2=<<2,001,2=$4,000>> $4,000 is 2 barrels and<n>$3,001*5=<<3,001,5=$15,000>>$15,001 is 5 barrels.<n><n>Using the equation

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a common sign that someone is lying? Choices:  A: ordering dog food online B: avoid eye contact C: feel guilty D: fall asleep E: blush<n><n>### Response:		Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## 8. The time of day is 2 hours after noon. It is:<n><n>A. A.m.<n>B. P.m.<n>C. nighttime<n>D. morning<n>E. D.m.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Everybody has a little bit of creativity, but only a few lucky ones get to do what for a living? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Bob is in a dressing room. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He was selling all his collector items even the rare plate, he had bought a lot at the what for the weekend? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Food must be freeze dried before it is taken on what vehicle? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does someone chatting with friends do when they hear a joke? He figures he can set aside $900 a month to accomplish this goal, a little above the amount his income allows.  How much interest will he need to earn each month on this investment to earn $50,010 in 10 years?<n>Rationales:# He will put away 900-10 for the first 10 months<n>900-1/10 = 820$<n><n>This means he need to earn 820 x $ 1.09 = $897 = interest<n><n>$$50010=897(1.009)^10 - 900(1.008)^10$$<n><n>### Input :In which of the following situations above are you most likely to buy a house that is larger than you need?<n><n>Choice#1 : To accommodate a growing number of dependents in your family.<n><n>Choice#2: To make more space in your house for personal belongings as you age.<n><n>Choice#3: To have more space to entertain guests.<n><n>Choice#4: To live in a nicer neighborhood.<n><n>Choice#5 : ____________<n><n>### Response : None of them.<n><n>###Input:<n>A 10 ounce container of peanut butter costs $4. In each case, decide whether the statement is true or false.<n><n>#### Sample:<n>What is the sum of all the numbers in the table?<n>Answer: true<n>#### Question 2:<n>What is the length of all the columns in the table?<n>### Answer: true or false, depending whether the column has the greatest number.<n>And the greatest number is 2 so that is the answer.<n>#### Question 3:<n>If the greatest number in any column were reduced by 1, would it be still true that the sum of all the values in this 10-number table is _______. <n>### Answer:<n>The greatest number in the table is 8 and not a multiple of 3 but if you reduce 8 by 1 then it's a multiple of 3 so then the answer becomes false.<n><n>### Response<n>input:What state shaped a little bit like a ghost has a lot of farming areas? (Choices)<n>Michigan, Texas, North Dakota, Farming areas = Farming areas<n><n>```python<n>answer = input<n>```<n>```<n>If answer == Michigan<n>print("Correct!")<n>elif answer == Texas<n>print("Not yet")<n>elif answer == North Dakota:<n>print("Not yet!")<n>else:<n>print("Please select an option and try again")<n>```<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What  might john order at an indian resturant on top of the space needle? Choices:  A: large city B: seattle C: curry D: clothing E: reservation<n><n>### Response:		<n>> D: curry<n><n>### Input<n>You can have any three of the following drinks of your choice:<n>Bottle of water, soda pop, cup of hot tea, cup of coffee.<n>> Bottle of water<n><n>### Input A train left Chicago with a speed of 50 miles per hour, and a train left St. Louis at the same time, traveling towards each other. After eight minutes, a train left Detroit at 50 miles per hours and a train left Philadelphia at the same time, also traveling towards each other in one direction.  How far apart do the two trains at that point in the journey?<n><n>### Response<n>$8x5 = 40$<n><n>$88 = 500$<n>=> $10 = 100$ <n>The two trains are 100 miles away from each other.<n><n>### Input John went to the grocery store.  He picked up four 12oz bags of soda, four 12oz jugs of milk, four 7oz tins of tuna, one 12oz packet of soy sauce, one 6oz jar of honey, one 7oz pack of sliced cheese, one 5oz bag of potatoes, and one 8oz jar of mayonnaise.  How many ounces of product did John end up having altogether?<n><n>### response the total is 142 ounces<n><n>### Input Mary, John, and Peter walked up into the mountains to catch some fish. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would a restaurant put a candle? Choices:  A: dimly lit room B: kitchen C: wall D: table E: birthday cake<n><n>### Response:		<n>C is the most reasonable answer based on the context. In the dimly lit room, a customer would be unable to see the candles and would get confused upon making a selection. In the kitchen, having candlelight is not a relevant concern. In the wall, a candle in a restaurant room would go against the standard of the establishment. In a birthday cake, a candle is part of the celebration. However, candles in a restaurant would be against the establishment's standards and a bad reflection on the restaurant. The most reasonable answer is candles placed on the table for the purposes of celebration.<n><n>### Cite the relevant concept<n>#### Section:Rationales:<n>The purpose of a candle is to illuminate a restaurant's interior.<n>Illuminating a room is not conducive to celebrating birthdays at the restaurant.<n>Moreover, using the establishment's name would inhibit the restaurant from making the restaurant's reputation.<n>In conclusion, placing candles on the table for the purpose of illuminating would prevent any problems that could be present.

The time to get a haircuts does not affect the amount charged for a hair cut.  The ratio of the time it takes to cut hair to the amount charged for a cut is constant.<n><n>## What is a variable?  A variable gives you flexibility.  There are two kinds of variables:  changing and constant.  A changing variable can be manipulated to change its effect on the situation.  For example, changing the amount of a charge, the speed, or the time it takes a process to occur.  A variable does not always affect, or is impactful to, the situation.  The impact of a variable can be measured to determine if a variable has a constant effect of the situation or not.  There are three ways to measure the impact of a variable: <n><n>## When comparing the number of items sold to the number of items purchased, which one do you think has the greatest impact on the amount you spend for those items? I think sales has the greatest impact on whether or not you spend the amount of money as the number of items purchased.

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:There aren't many anemone in what glove-shaped state? Choices:  A: michigan B: lake C: tide pool D: nursery E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Comment:<n><n>Input:How many weeks of training were required for a soldier to learn to fire the bazooka 3 times per minute?<n>   One factor for how fast he could fire the bazooka was the speed of the rifle.  If he fired the bazooka at 100 feet per second, then he could fire 3 shots per minute.<n>   Another factor for how fast he might fire was how much time did he had to reload the bazooka between shots.  We must model this, too.<n>   Time per Shot -<n>   Time to re-load the bazooka = Time to prepare to fire the bazook<n>   Time to reapre to fire = 1 second<n><n>#### 5<n>Answer: 5<n><n>### Input : A company has made arrangements to use the railroad system to transport 1000 pairs of work gloves. The distance from the factory to the train station is 9.5 km, (each way), and it takes 30 minutes to both load and unload the train at the factory. How much, in hours, does it take to transport the work gloves?<n>Rationales : Time at the Factory = 1000*45/9.5 =<<1000* 45/9. 5=450>>450 minutes<n><n>Answer : Total Transport time = (1000*10/9.5)*30+1000*30/9.5*1 =<<100*30*30+10==1950>>1950 hours.<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>### Input  : A person wants to ride a bicycle 250 km in 2 days or 12 1/3 hours.  What is the average speed of her bicycle, in km/h, in either scenario?<n>Rationales :: Let  x(hours)=250km and  v=average speed<n><n>If she rode 250km in 12 1 or 3 hours,then:<n><n>So that  (1/3)v/h=1 (1/3)250/(12*1+3) =<< 1
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where you have finished a conversation with a person what do you say? You may need to provide several examples.<n><n>### Question<n>What is the sum of the first \(3\) prime numbers?<n><n>### Input and Sample Responses<n>>The correct answer is<n>><n>> 7<n><n>### Instructions<n>Write your response in a single post.<n><n>### Sample response:<n>```<n>A:I will say hi. How much you are earning for your month I do not know.<n>B: Thank you and nice to see you today.<n>C: Yes, we got a big dinner in home.<n>D: What's wrong?<n>E: I'm here with my son. I love to see you here.<n>```<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does someone living life fully feel? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where might a human sit for extended periods over a bowl of water? Jane has 3 apples. There are 4 oranges in a different bag. Bob has 4 oranges. There are 5 lemons in the refrigerator. Sam has 5 lemons. In addition, there are 2 strawberries in the refrigerate. John has 2 strawberies. Tom has 3 bananas. The supermarket charges $1 for a banana, $0.25 for an apple, $0.50 for an orange, $1.25 for a strawberry, and $0.50 to buy an apple. Jack buys 1 banana, 2 apples, 1 strawberry, and 1 lemon. He pays $10.50 at the checkout counter. How much, in cents, did Jack pay, per item, for his purchse at the store?<n>__##Rationale____<n>__Jane__:__ Jane bought 3 apples<n>__Bob__:__ Bob bought 4 oranges<n>__Sam__:__ Sam bought 5 lemons<n>__John__:__ John bought 2 strawberrries<n>__Tom__: Tom bought 3 bananas<n>__Jack:__ jack purchased<n>__Staple__ : __1__<n>__banana__ : __1__ <n>__apples__ : __2__ <n>__strawberry__ : __1__  <n>__lemons__: __1__<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where can you find pamphlets regarding diseases and ailments? A theater isn't the place to find answers to questions requiring medical information. The health department is probably also the place to see pamphlets regarding diseased and ailments, but perhaps not.<n><n>### Input::I am standing on my grandfather's grave. What am I doing?<n><n>### Response::Standing<n><n>### Input<n>> The local hardware store is having a sale. The sale will continue for the rest of the week. How many days is this? How many days is that?<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>Answer: The rest of the week is 3 more days.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>| Answer      | Days| <n>|:----------:|:----|<n>| The rest of   the week   |   3|<n><n>### Input. In what order are the following words in dictionary?<n>1. Abstemious<n>2. Amber<n>3. Amphibious<n>4. Archer<n>5. Asparagus<n>6. Auspicious<n><n>### Response<n>1. Asparagus <---<n>2. Auspicious <---<n>3. Abstemious <---<n>4. Archer <---<n>5. Amphibious <---<n><n>Answers<n><n>| Answer       | Position |<n>|:----------: |:---------:|<n>| Auspicious    | 1        |<n>| Amber          | 2        |<n>| Abstemious    | 3        |<n>| Amphibious    | 4        |<n>| Archer        | 5        |<n>| Asparagus     | 6        |<n><n>---<n><n>### Instructions:<n>How much, in dollars, will $1,000 be worth in 15 years?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>The interest of an annuity is calculated using the following formula:<n><n>$I =\frac{P(\frac{r}{\mathrm{T}})}{(1-\frac{r}{\mathrm{\mathrm{T}}}})}$<n><n>where I is the interest, P is principal, r is interest-rate and T is time.<n><n>Since we're talking about 15 years, and we're
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What animal produces milk? Choices:  A: supermarket B: pig C: cow D: refrigerator E: store<n><n>### Response:		<n>Cows<n><n>### Input<n>There are six people waiting for their food at a drive-through window.  A line of cars has formed behind them.  The chef decides to serve them with the following restrictions:  All meals served to the people waiting in the building will be double-served.  All meals served in the first four cars (in the back of the line of cars) will be double-serving, as will all meals served in the two cars in front of them.<n><n>### A.  When a double-served meal is prepared, what part of it is thrown into the garbage?<n><n>### b. How many single meals are made by the chef?<n><n>### c.  How many meals are made when double-served and how many are thrown away? <n><n>### d.  If there are 100 people in line and 100 meals served, how many are single-served?<n><n>### Response<n>b. 167<n>c. 109<n>d.  50<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Society cannot exist without numbers. This is a good idea."<n>

Door windows are called doors.  Square and high walls are also not characteristics of rooms facing outside.<n>
