Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Why would someone be wet after being full of fear? Choices:  A: run B: swimming C: calculate things quickly D: fight enemy E: urinate<n><n>### Response:		Excluding any of the letters, D or E, from this statement gives the correct answer.<n><n>#### C<n><n>Input: A man bought a car for $25,000 to transport his family on a road trip to the Grand Canyon.  He paid $500 in fees and spent a total of $1,530 to fill the gas tank.  What was the cost of gas per gallon for the trip to the Grand Cayon?<n><n>Input: A woman has three daughters.  One of the daughters, who lives to age 61, is an only child.  Each of the other two daughters is married and has exactly two sons.  How many children are there in the family?<n><n>Input: How many different four-letter words can be formed using only these letters: A F T H I R A C K<n><n>Answer: There are 24 words that are possible. However, to make things easier I will use the following logic:  The first letter may be a, f, t, h, i, r, a or c. However, it must be either a or f.  The second letter must be a (since either it is f). Finally, the third letter either can be an a or not. If it is not, the fourth letter can be either an a or not. Therefore, the final word for a non-unique word can be:<n><n>a a a a<n><n>or<n><n>a a a c<n><n>or<n><n>f f f f<n><n>or<n><n>r r r a<n><n>or<n>ac ac ac<n><n>or<n>fh fh i<n><n>or<n>f a c a c<n><n>or th th a<n><n>or<n>f th a h<n><n>or<n>h a a a<n><n>h h a a a<n><n>Thus, there are 6 unique words and 24 non-unique words.<n><n><n>Input: A 9-digit number with leading zeros can be uniquely represented as a string of 3 digits followed by a string of 6, or<n><n>#### 6<n><n>Input: The following strings are equivalent in length: (3 words)<n><n>#### 3<n><n>Input: The letter X appears in the phrase BLACK CAT how many times?<n><n>#### 1 time<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Dan outfitted his house to run on the oldest heat source on Earth. What is the oldest heat source on Earth? Choices:  A: fire B: solar energy C: sun D: house E: coal or wood<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: B<n><n>### Input<n><n>How much more is 8% of 32% of 53% of 68% of 92% of 127% of 178% of 291% of 464% of 503% of 301% greater than 100%?<n><n>### Response<n><n>Answer: 464%-100%=<<464%- 100%=64%>>44%

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would cause someone to use invitro for reproducing? Therefore, someone would use it to produce more children and more babies.<n><n>### Input is the process of selecting among alternatives. It's about selecting the right action. Choices A B C and D are incorrect. D is the correct answer.<n><n>### Response is:<n><n>D is the answer. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The janitor got his pail out of where? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sally took her medicine and experienced strong side effects. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James was delayed for a couple of hours because he had a connection. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is the opposite of foolhardy? Choices:  A: thoughtful B: discreet C: calculated D: cautious E: careful<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Detailed Response (include code):<n><n>```<n>import re<n><n><n>class Solution:<n>    def wordPattern(self, p, s: str) -> bool:<n>        if len(s)!=len(p):<n>            return False<n>        else:<n>            tmp=[0] *len(p)<n>            for c in s:<n>                for d,e in enumerate(p):<n>                    if c == e:<n>                        tmp[d]=1<n>                for d in range(1,len(p)):<n>                    if tmp[d]==0:<n>                        return False<n>            return True<n><n>s="1 1234"<n>print(Solution().wordPattern(s,p="23"))<n>```<n><n>### Answer:<n>True<n><n>### Instructions:Write code within this container to solve the problem described.<n><n>### Output:<n><n>```<n><program output><n>2<n>3<n>4<n>```<n><n>#### Program Output Description<n>Sample Output 2, 3, 4.<n><n>### Detection:<n>Write a program that takes in a collection of sample output strings and compares the collection to the expected output of the current solution on the current input.<n>The collection should be a list of the strings.<n><n>The first argument is a list of samples, followed by the expected output, and followed by the expected collection of empty spaces followed by the expected newline character.  <n><n>### Demonication:<n><n>#### Input:3, 2, 4,<n><n>### Response Structure:<n>1. 3001022400<n>2. 40010120005500<n>3. 0<n><n>### Output Structure:<n>10224 (String length = 10)<n>401012 (String length = 8)<n><n>#### Output<n>401009000055<n><n><n>### Difficulty Rank:<n>Medium<n>

They will feel sorry for you, but you will learn your lesson.<n>```<n>### Input-Demonstration:Crossing the street<n>---<n>This question doesn't go to the point where you don't feel like answering in a few words that are easy to remember because it's already provided.<n><n>### Response-Instructions:Answer a short response.<n>---<n><n>### Input-Response:<n>The answer is C. That's because you should always follow the rules or it might end tragic.<n><n>### Input -Demonstration:<n><n>### Response - Instructions:<n>Answer a paragraph response.<n><n>### Length:<n><n>### Subject:<n><n>---<n><n>#### Input:<n>A woman is purchasing a new home. She has $10,000 set aside to spend on a home. Her best choices appear to be the houses which sell for $25,000, $45,000 or $65,000. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:She was bad at dancing, so what basic skill did the instructor teach her? Choices:  A: euphoria B: rhythmic movement C: music D: moving body E: having fun<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Output: A<n><n>## Description<n><n>This code runs on the server, not a browser, so there are no "interaction" events.<n><n>## Constraints<n><n>- No more than 1000 characters of code.<n>- One integer per line of code, and each integer must be positive.<n>- Input cannot be empty.<n>- Output cannot be empty.<n><n>## Approvals<n><n><input id="input13" type="checkbox"> &nbsp; <label for="input13">This task is easy for me</label> <i id="input14" class="ui-icon ui-icon-circle-check ui-icon-shadow"></i> <n><input id="check13" type="hidden"><n><input id="radio1" type="radio" onclick="this.checked = false; document.getElementById('check14').disabled = true"><n><input id='unchecked1' type="checkbox" onclick="this.disabled = false; this.checked = false"><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If a student was about to graduate, they would no longer be attending what? Choices:  A: library B: parties C: kindergarten class D: bar E: school<n><n>### Response:		D<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James wanted to stop competing.  What might he have been feeling? Choices:  A: pressure B: death C: trying harder D: quitting E: winning or losing<n><n>### Response:		<n>  > A: Pressure<n><n>### Answer: If you select or write the right answer, you are correct. If you select or write any other answer, you are incorrect (except for answer choices that are not listed, in which case you may see 0). Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur. The restaurant manager knows that it takes 25 minutes exactly to seat one table and 8 minutes to serve 15 guests from a table. The number of tables and seats in the dining room is given by the formula x2t for x in the set {4, 1, 8, 2}. What is the manager’s minimum number of waiters for the given number of tables?<n><n>### Rationales:  The manager knows that it takes an average of 25*(6/8)/15=25/15=<<25/(6/8)/13=30/13=<<30/(6/8)/22=40/22=<<40/(6/8/22=75/22=3.27>>3.27 minute to seat a table and 8 minute to serve 15 guest from a table<n>The number of tables = x2t and number of seats = x2t.<n>And x is given and 6/8 is known<n><n>For example, let's do 8 table.<n>The formula of tables is 82t<n>And the formula of seats is 82t.<n>Thus, (82t)2t<n>And since 8=4<n>82t+6t = 4+4<n>Thus, 8t+6t = t+6<n><n>If there are 5 tables. Then 52t+5t 52+5t=15 + 5 (there're 5 seats)<n><n>If there is 4 tables. Thus, 42t+6t=19+6 (=13)<n><n>Thus, 19t2t<n><n>We assume the 19=m and 2t=n.<n><n>And we can get m=3.27 and n=8.83.<n><n>####134<n>Answer: 134<n><n>### A<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>### Demostr

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where can you find a movie theater along with other stores in one placE? Choices:  A: downtown area B: urban area C: new york city D: shopping mall E: military base<n><n>### Response:		D<n>#### A: downtown<n><n>Input: An elevator car falls from the top floor of a building in downtown Los Angeles to the ground floor in just 8 seconds. At what, in feet per second, does it fall?<n>Rationales:#1 Elevators in buildings do have an upper limit on which floors they can access.<n><n>Since an elevator moves at 10 feet per second, after 8 seconds, it will have moved the total distance of 82 feet.<n>The vertical distance between floor 60 and floor 10 is 50 feet.<n><n>#### B: urban area<n><n>Input: A taxi in a large urban area is traveling south at 24 mph. At a street intersection, the taxi stops at the intersection for one minute. How far, in miles, will it travel during that one-minute stop; and how far north did it travel before stopping?<n>Rationales#1 Stop and go rates differ for different purposes.<n>Stop and go rates are especially high for stop and go traffic caused by frequent traffic signals.<n><n>Stopping for 1 minute causes the driver to travel farther than just the distance of 24 mph for 1 minute; this additional distance is added at a low rate, and becomes zero near the end of 1 minute, since the car is stopped.<n><n>The formula \(S=(\frac{s}T)^{n}\) indicates a stop for \(n\) seconds requires that one must travel \(S=\left(\frac{s}{T}\right)^{n}\) times the value of s in kilometers after stopping, where \(T\) is the rate with the car is traveling when stopping; and \(s\) is the distance traveled during the stop, in kilometers.<n><n>#### C: new york<n><n>Input: What is the difference in latitude and longitude, in kilometers, between 12 degrees north and 72 degrees north latitude?<n><n>Solution: 60 degrees<n><n>#### D: shopping malls<n><n>Input: The local shopping mall is located in a suburban area about 35 miles away from home. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The only baggage the woman checked was a drawstring bag, where was she heading with it? Choices:  A: garbage can B: military C: jewelry store D: safe E: airport<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Input : The only baggage the man checked was a duffel bag. where was he heading with it? Choice: A: garbage B: military C: bank D: hospital E: bank<n><n>### Response :<n>B<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you expect to find a pizzeria while shopping? Choices:  A: chicago B: street C: little italy D: food court E: capital cities<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Which of these areas of a neighborhood would you expect to find various businesses that sell basic human needs or have services that people regularly purchase?<n>#### The choices are:<n>A: **chicago**: A downtown is an area of a city, usually with a focus on commercial areas.<n>B: **street**: A street in a downtown or business area would probably attract more businesses.<n>C: **little italy**: Little italy is often a subdivision of an inner city. A business would want to set up shop in an area that will attract many customers.<n>D: **food court**: A food court is a popular concept in a shopping mall that allows fast food shops to be in a common area. This is not as likely to attract a pizzeria.<n>E: **capital cities**: Most pizzerias would not choose to set up shop in the capital unless a government contract can be negotiated by politicians or government bureaucrats.<n><n>### Output:F: Both C and E<n><n>#### What kind of business will best match up with your answer?<n>#### A pizzeria will be able to serve more customers from a location in a downtown area close to city hall or in the little italy district.<n><n>### Input<n><n>Input: Which of the following is true about a _farmers market?_ Choices: A: There is food only at farmers markets. C: Most farmers mark<n><n>#### D: Farmers provide goods of all kinds not only food D: farmers markets are mostly outside<n><n>#### Answer:  D<n><n>### Output<n><n>#### A farm stand provides vegetables or other food product grown on a nearby farm and may be a stand, a stall, or a booth<n><n>### Question:Which of the following is a reasonable description of a farmers market?<n><n>#### B: Most (farmers markets) are indoors.<n><n>#### A: Farmer markets are an organized marketplace where farmers and others involved in food manufacturing can sell a variety of their goods.<n><n>#### C: A farmer's market is typically somewhere in a public place where farmers sell their products to consumers.<n><n>#### D: Farmer mark

Choices:  A: freeway B: radio C: wires D: computer network E: electrical circuit<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is an analogy question:<n><n>The analogy between the files transferring through the computer network and files traveling on a freeway is that if two cars travel on the same lane of a one lane car the road they will share the lane. The car traveling on the right side will move to the left hand side of the lane to let the car traveling on the left side pass. If the car traveling on ther right side move fast and the car on the left side is move slow, it will take more time for the car traveling on right side to let the car travel on the left side. When they are done, the car passing will also return to its right side. In conclusion they share the same lane and that is the relationship between the wires and the electrical circuit.<n><n>### Input<n>Answer the following multiple choice on the question: How should you interpret the following sentence of prose? "The dog ran away and its house was destroyed." The answer will either be on the question:<n><n>1. A: The dog did not eat the house it ran away.<n>2. B: If the dog is not in the house, it should not be in the house now.<n><n>### Response<n>The correct answer is number 2 but not 1.<n><n>Answer: 1. Dog did not eat the house, it ran away.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The house is referred to in the past tense, which represents its state.<n>The dog is in one sentence (The dog has been found by his master) and eats the house in another sentence(The dog destroyed the house) if the dog had eaten the house then there would be no house left. Dog and house destroyed are past tense so dog ate the house means that dog can not be in the house because dog was destroyed.<n><n>**The house did not eat the dog therefore there was dog in the house.**<n><n>Answer:2. If the dog is not house then the dog is not with its master and should not be in the dog house.<n><n>Explanation:<n>In question:<n>The dog ran away from the house.<n>The house was destroyed in a fire.<n>Therefore if the dog ran away then it should not be in its house now. Choices:  A: painting B: hen house C: california D: virginia E: movie hall<n><n>### Response:		A fox was thirst after painting during the drought.<n><n>### Input : A 20-liter carton of milk was priced at $3.99 a liter, $79.70 in total, and a carton of juice was priced at $2.29 per liter, $47.67 in total. You wanted to buy the same quantity of each, but you were only $7.72 short. Did you choose correctly? Explain.<n>#### 5/8<n>Rationales: 20liters*3.99=<<20liters* 3.99=79.7>>79.7 so for milk cost, $79. 20-79.7=<<20-79..7=10.7>>10.7 now 20/20-79=<<20/20=1>>1. 1/20-7.7=<<1/20-2.39>>2.39 so 2.39*20 =<<2.39* 20=47.98>>47.98 so choose 47.98 liters.<n>For, juice 20/2.29=<<20/.229=9>>9 so 9/20=<<9/20=0.45>>0.45 so 20/0.45=<<20/0.045=45>>45 so, 45-45=<<45-45>=0>>0 so, choose 45 liters.<n><n>### #1 Answer: A fox was hunting in the forest, searching for water.<n><n>### Question 4<n>Rationales: $3.79-0.21 = $3.58.<n>56-17 = $39.00/56 = $0.71, so answer A.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>I took out the last 4 digits of each price and the last 5 digits of 39 and subtracted them to get 08<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The evacuation became mandatory, so what came on the TV? Choices:  A: advisory B: mandate C: soap opera D: elective E: optional<n><n>### Response:		<n>Advisory - A<n>Mandate - B<n>Soap opera - C<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>### Input<n><n>The evacuation became **mandatory**, so what came on TV?<n><n>### Examples<n><n>In my mind, the question indicates that a mandate is in place. This is an option, or an obligation if not followed.<n><n>### Exemplifications<n><n>An event became mandatory.<n><n>### Task<n><n>Complete the request.<n><n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Who was the head of the branch yelling at? Choices:  A: owner B: foot C: subordinate D: base E: point<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>From the context of the problem, he is trying to get the subordinate to do something.<n><n>### Input : What's missing in this phrase from the paragraph?<n><n>### Response : A<n><n>### In the following case, the 9-member team is divided into three teams of 3.  The first two groups each play three games against each other, and the third plays three games against the other two groups.  All groupings are within the same team, in order to keep the division as fair as possible.  Which of the following is a winning outcome for this situation?<n><n>### Input<n>A: Lose out on all games<n>B: 3 Wins<n>C: 1 Loss<n>D: 1 Loss, 1 Tie, 1 Win<n>E: 3 Losses<n><n>### Solution:<n>The answer is C (1 loss, 1 tie, 1 win)<n><n>It is stated that in order to keep the divisions fair in the scenario (paraphrased from the prompt), the team is divided into groups of 3 with all groupings within the same team.  A team with 1 loss and 2 wins gives it a chance for 1-2 wins, with the lowest probability of winning 2 games, and it loses the one game for sure.  1-2=<<1-2=1>>1 (the one game that was lost for sure).<n>So, we have 1 loss, 2 wins, 1 tie (for that one game).<n>So, the answer is C: 1 Loss 1 Tie 1 Win.<n><n>### Here the number "3" represents:<n><n>### Solution :<n>It is the number of teams, and the teams would like to choose the best combination of groupings that all teams will win.<n>The number "5" represents the number of games.

Choices:  A: alive B: health C: fun D: playing dead E: black<n><n>### Response:		The animal that is alive or has life.<n><n>### Input:(1) Find the length of the diagonal (1/2 sum of the areas of the two squares), given that the square on the left has an area of 20 and the square on the right has an area of 40.<n><n>(2) Find the area of the larger square.<n><n>(3) Find the area of two circles, given the radius of the larger circle, which is 3, is the same as the smaller circle, which has a radius of 3/2.<n><n>Rationales: Let the smaller square be \(s^2\).<n>let one larger square be \(40^2\).<n>Let the second larger square be \(41^2\).<n><n>Because \(\(\frac{1}{2}\sum\limits_{a \geq 1}^n(a^2)=n\cdot{\frac{\sqrt{5}}{2}}\\)<n><n>$\begin{array}{l}<n>\text{40}^{2}=(4\times10^{4}+49)\times10^{2}=4\times100\times100+49\times100=400\times12000+49000\\<n>20^{2}=(2\times10^{2}+18)\times100=2\times1000+18\times100=\text{11,100+1,800=20,900}\\<n>200(\sqrt5-\frac{1}{2})=200(\sqrt2-\frac{7}{2})=\sqrt2-\frac{21}{4}-\frac{1}{2}=\sqrt2-\frac{14}{4}=\sqrt2-\frac{\sqrt2}{2}=\frac{\sqrt2}{1}=\frac{1}{2}<n>\end{array}<n>\tag{A}\label{A}<n>\begin{array}{l}\text{400}\sqrt2-\text{1400}+400\sqrt2-\left(\frac{49}{2}\right)200\sqrt2=\text{%<n>500}-\text{250}+100+100-\frac{35}{16}=\text{%<n>6

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do bees congregate with red flowerS? Choices:  A: trash can B: honey C: bouquet of flowers D: rose garden E: field of flowers<n><n>### Response:		<n>C<n>#### C<n>#### E<n>Answer: C<n><n>Input: There are 2760 crayons in 25 packs of crayons. Each pack has 112 crayons. Find the ratio of the the number of boxes of crayons needed to the number of crayon packs<n><n>Output:<n>60/25<n>#### 60<n>Answer: 60/25
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The city's community garden was demolished for yet another what? Choices:  A: wasteland B: ocean C: desert D: parking lot E: flowers<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Explanatory<n><n>![](./readme.png)<n><n>### [1]:http://prntscr.com/b38i2o
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The skin was cut while chopping onions, where was this skin likely cut? Choices:  A: looking good B: beauty C: tardiness D: handsomeness E: neatness<n><n>### Response:		<n>**Choice:** B<n><n>The question asks about the purpose of the man's grooming activities prior to a job interview.<n>Because the man chose to appear "neat" (choice E) this must be what he is attempting to portray.<n>Therefore, the correct answer can only be "beauty" (choice B).<n><n>### Explanation:<n>Because the man used grooming before a job interivew, it is clear that the purpose of this grooming was to improve his appearance.<n>Grooming prior to the interview would not be expected for a tardy or late individual, as these things are out of a person's control.<n>Also, grooming for the day of an interview would not portray an individual who is "handsome" or "good looking" because of the ambiguous wording.<n>Thus, it is clear that this type of grooming implies either a "beauty" or "cleanness" appearance.<n><n>### Input<n>The boss wants you to give an appropriate amount Choices:  A  **improve yourself** B  **become knowledgeable** C  **have tools** D  **persistence** E  **have more knowledge**<n>Rationales: This passage contains a prepositional phrase "  to work..."  that requires a 2 to complete. The police plan to bring these members of the criminal organization into court to stand trial. The court proceedings are to begin at 10:00 a.m. on a Friday morning. The group has committed so many crimes that they are considered a serious threat to the safety and peace of society. In order to ensure a reasonable level of safety among this large group being brought to court, it is decided that the police will transport them to court at 8:00 a. m.. and will have them in the courtroom by 10:0 am, and as an extreme measure, they intend to provide armed guards to the court. Write a paragraph that describes what is likely to occur and why.<n><n>Response:<n><n>Answer:<n><n>In a large courtroom, we'd have 100 people of potential criminal who already has done his crimes, the judge, the prosecuter, the defense lawyer and the armed guards. The defense lawyer who will bring up all the defense points will most likely be the one who has the most experience, so that is the case it would be. The prosecuter will have to prove all the crimes they've done, which of which, have more documents to prove their case. The process on whether the verdict is guilty or not is long and may take months. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy tickets at a ticket booth for games/ Choices:  A: train station B: cathedral C: metro station D: fairgrounds E: amusement park<n><n>### Response:		Answer B<n>### Justification:<n>C: metro station<n><n>### Input :The grocery needs to place an order for 90 pounds of cucumbers, 30 pounds of carrots, and 15 pounds of broccoli. What value of x could be used to represent this order?<n>Choices: a:80<n>b:155<n>c:110<n>d:90<n><n>### Answer :d<n>### Justification :<n>1. 90×3=<90×3=270>270<n>2. 90+90+30+18=<90+90-30+18=-18>-18<n><n>### Input<n>Which is faster, a bicycle with friction wheels at an average speed of 12 mph or a motorcycle with no friction wheels at a steady 60 mph?<n><n>### Answer<n>If we are using mph,bike =<<cycle>>then bicycle<n><n>### Rationale<n>A: bicycle: 45mph(mph) and no fuel burn<n>B: motorcycle: 60 mph (mph) and fuel burn<n><n>**The fastest would be the motorcycle. 45mph (mph)**<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If somebody likes temperatures cool, they might have more than one electric fan where? Choices:  A: home B: hardware store C: home D: hot room E: office<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A: home<n><n>#### B: hardware store<n>#### C: home<n>### Demonstraion:<n><n>The first rule: For a letter that does not have any preceding vowel, and there is no preceding vowel, if the letter is silent, the letter is _d_. The number _d_ is equal to the number of vowels in it. The other rules. If there is a preceding vowel, then the letter is silent. The last rule: If the vowel is silent, it is silent. The number _d_ equals the number of vow<n><n><n>### Input Choices:<n>#### A: (home)<n>#### B: (hardware store)<n><n>#### C: (home)<n><n>#### D: (hot room)<n>#### E: (office)<n><n><n>### Question:<n>Which of the following is true?<n>A. All of the choices are true.<n><n>C.All of the choices are false.<n><n>D.Choice 5 is true and choices are false.<n>#### A: (C)<n><n><n>## Tasks:<n>### #1.<n><n>#### D:<n>There are 2 things that are in the second paragraph<n>**Cool Off: The first rule: For a sentence that does not have any following vowel, and a letter is not followed by the preceding vowel, if a letter is silent, the last letter is silent. The letter is silent, and the letter is silent. And so on.**<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He had done a great job with the scary decorations, they were completely what? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is done to wood to attach something to it? The tree was 4 feet in diameter. George has 1 dog and John has 2 dogs. How wide is each dog's section of the tree?<n>Rationales::The number of times that the diameter was cut down in the tree was 4 in the tree.<n>It was divided between the number of dogs = 5<n>Thus, each dog got 4/5=<<4/5=0.8>>0.8' section of the tree.<n>#### 24<n>Answer: 24<n>### Instruction_2:<n><n>### Demstration:The carpet stores is trying to sell a 2-foot by 3-foot wall-to-wall carpet by the squeeze. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is likely to have more than one level in a city? How far from the average can you be off when making an estimate of the amount of time it takes to regrow a cow claw? Explain the reasoning, using arithmetic, for getting to your answer.<n><n><n>### Response 1<n>Cows have nails or claws in different sizes and shapes. If we take any cow, we can get an average of about 18 min. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John and Jane were a couple. Including tax, how much is the tax on a cell phone that retails for $400?<n><n>### Answer：<n>#### 55<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple answer question.<n><n>## Input:Sally decided to re-furbish her den. How much will she spend to have a new rug installed? Choices: 1: A: less than $500 B: more than $400 but less than $50 C: exactly $500 D: exactly $300 E: more than $300 but less than 400 F: more than $450 but less than $400.<n>#### Answer: 1 and 5<n><n>### Inputs:<n>A new computer costs more than $40,000, but less than 32,000.  How much does the new computer cost?<n><n>### Solution：<n>#### 26702<n><n>### Input<n><n>A company offers a discount of 10% off all merchandise. How much discount does $120.00 merchandise receive on the sale?<n><n>### Solutions：<n>#### 12<n><n>### Instuction:A company offers a discout of 10% on all merchandise, 15% over sales and 20% on all specials. Choice: A: all the figures are the same in each case. B: The discounts on specials are less, but the other figures are the same C/D: the figures differ in amount and are not the same. E:  The discount on specials is the highest. F:  The discounts on all other merchandise are the highest. G: The discounts from sale to over sales are the highest. Other:<n><n>### Answer: E<n><n>### Input <n><n>Two friends decide to buy a motorcycle to ride on their summer vacation.  They decide to ride to a distant town, and are unsure if there are rest places along the way.  They are given $25 and must spend less than $30 to make
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where are people likely to stand at an intersection? Choices:  A: cars B: city street C: street corner D: fork in road E: at a red light<n><n>### Response:		<n>Choice C: People will stand on the street corner because they want to make sure they have a safe view in all directions.<n><n>### Input : If you were to travel to a nearby country that speaks a language other than English, which of the choices below describes where you would go to learn the country's language? A. An immersion school B. A school that teaches English as a second language C.<n><n>### Response :<n>Choice C: You would attend a school that teaches English to people from other countries.<n><n>### Submission format:Please write your response in the body of the email.<n><n>### Checklist- Make sure you have done the following before submitting your response:<n><n>- Your complete response should start by restating the task or question being answered.<n>- Include each relevant detail from the instruction or question in order.<n>- Provide at least one appropriate response.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John moved away from his family.  He was a bit upset that he had to do it, but he needed the job.  Still, he would have preferred it if the job were what? Choices:  A: present B: stay here C: closer D: available E: come here<n><n>### Response:		I wish the job was closer because I just started here."John had to stay away from home and his family."<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does a chef do when working in the evening? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The hippy wanted peace with all humans, he had strong what for them all? The average weight of his herd is 320 pounds and the average age of his herd is two years old. How much, in pounds, is the average weight of each calf?<n><n>### Rationales : Each calf is a quarter the weight of the average of his entire herd of calves, which is one eighth the weight of the entire herd, or one twelfth one-eighth.<n>(1/4)(1/2)(1/4)(1)=<<(1/4)(I/J)=1/16>>1/16 the weight of the average calf<n>640/16=<<the weight of the average calft=<<640/14=45>>45 lbs. (with remainder as we have fractional numbers)<n>#### 45<n>Answer: 45 lbs<n>

Choices:  A. bias B. fallacy C. prejudice D. reasoning E. assumption<n>Due: 11/12/22<n><n>### Example Of Logic Fallacy Correctly Used:<n>A logical fallacy would be an indication of poor reasoning.<n><n>### Example of Logical Fallacy Incorrectly Used:<n>An example of a logical fallacy is prejudice.<n><n>### Correctly Used Logical Fallacy:<n>The correct answer for the logical fallacy is **assumption**.<n><n>### Response To Instruction:<n><n>### Input<n>Choose from the following choices the best response to the given sentence.<n><n>#### I am leaving as soon as I ________.<n>Complete the sentence with either of the following:<n>**A. see**, **B. hear**, **C. taste**, **D. smell**, **E. touch**<n><n>A: hear is better.<n><n>D: touch is better.<n><n>Answer: D<n><n>#### A. hear, B. smell, C. taste, D. touch, E. see<n><n>Input 2022:<n>Choose from the options below the appropriate pronoun to replace the italicized portion of the sentence.<n>A: I _______ my car last week.<n><n>B: He _______ up at midnight.<n><n>

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James needed a garage because he spent a lot of money on what? Explain how to build a response and provide guidance on improving future responses.)<n>### Response:(Good response:<n>Write a response that appropriately fills the request.<n><n>A good response will:<n>> - be relevant to the request<n>> - have an answer that is logical<n><n>A response is appropriate if it:<n>> - is relevant<n>> - is logical<n>> - has detail and makes sense<n><n>What is the main point of a logical response? Its main point should convey the reason and/or evidence to support the answer.<n><A><n><n><A><n><A><n>> - use clear language<n>> - describe an event or action in chronological order<n>> - follow the correct format (ex: APA)<n>> - check your citations to make sure they are correct and make sure you have included both direct and indirect sources in your citations<n>> - include a properly formatted reference list<n><n>How do I cite an author? -<n>> - If the author is mentioned by name then don't include name of the author as a reference. (eg - Smith (2022) indicates the date)<n>> - Don't include author in in-text citations<n><n>How do you cite an e-book? -<n>> - name of the author and year in (...) indicates the year<n>> - Use the name of the e-book and the name. (eg - Smith, 2022)<n><n>How do you quote a paragraph? -<n>> - use double quotation marks<n>> - put both the in-text and full-reference citations in parenthesis<n><n>How do I do an author date citation for an indirect source? -<n>> - include the article title in parenthesis<n>> - include the name of the author in parenthesis<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you sit in a chair to watch four-legged animals complete? Choices:  A: bookstore B: house C: race track D: friend's house E: building<n><n>### Response:		<n>Write an answer that appropriately completes each request.<n><n>#### Demonstration: A: bookstore<n><n>### Demand: A bookstore will open in your neighborhood. How will this affect you? Choices: $$I$:  I won't go to the bookstore $$II$: I don't mind the addition of a bookstore $$III$: I prefer to go to the bookstore that's already in my neighborhood $$IV$: I might go to the bookstore more often $$V$: I always like to shop locally $$VI$: I haven't decided<n>Rationales: Since a bookstore is opening in my neighborhood, I might go to the new bookstore more frequently.<n>The additional choices are:<n>$$I$$$$I$$$$$: I won't go the bookstore because the bookstore is already in my neighborhood.<n>$$II$$$$II$$$$$: I won’t mind the addition of the bookstore to my neighborhood.<n>$$III$$$$III$$$$$: Since a bookstore is already in the neighborhood, there’s no point in going to a new bookstore.<n>$$IV$$$$IV$$$$$: Since a new bookstore is opening in the neighborhood, I will go to the new book more frequently.<n>$$V$$$$V$$$$$: I like to shop locally, but I’ve been to the existing bookstore before, and there's a good chance that I'll shop there even more.<n>$$VI$$$$VI$$$$$: Since I haven't been to the existing book store before, it's too early to tell if I'll go to the new book store more frequently or not.<n>#### Demonstrations:<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>#### 4: B<n><n>In your community, there’s a community pool.  For the next 8 months, there will be no swimming pool.  On Saturday morning, you don’t have any appointments and you don’t have anything else you want to do.  You’re not taking a trip out of town this weekend.  Since you’re looking forward to swimming on the weekends, you're planning to go with your friends to the beach on Saturday.  You’ll need to rent a beach house and arrange how to get food and snacks to the house.  How many people, including you, will be able to fit
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What emotion do people expressing themselves show when they trip in front of a crowd and break their leg? Choices:  A: communication B: suffering C: pain D: laughter E: embarrassment<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer is E: embarrassment.<n><n>---<n><n>Input:The car-rental agcy car charges $30/Day.<n><n>Input:  What is $80+$15 for 10? How much would $60+$8+$16+$15 be if you had to add this amount to get to an even number?<n>$90<n>$90+15=<<$90+1$5="> $90+$26=<<$90+$2$6=92>>92+26=$118<n>$118+$15=<<118+$1$5=">">"<n><n>#### $40+$50<n><n>When you do this, you'll need the order of operations, which are parenthesis, exponents, multiplication, division, addition, and subtraction. The way order of operations works is PEMDAS. P is for parenthesis, and E is for exponents, M is for multiplication and D is for division, A is for addition and S is for subtraction.<n><n>$200-$250+$25-$450-$20-480+$5 =193$<n><n>The correct answer is 193.<n><n><n><n><div class="row"><n>	<div class="col-lg-9 col-md-9 col-sm-8 col-xs-12"><n>		<n>		<b>Task</b><n>		<ul class="list-unstyled"><n>			<li>In order to pass this module, you must solve the number of questions provided. <span class="badge pull-right">9</span></li><n>			<br style="clear:both" /><n>		</ul><n><n>		<b><p style="clear:both">Solve each problem. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What could a balalaika be needed for? The first statement means "is x greater than 0" and the second statement is "is x more than 0". <a href="https://math.stackexchange.com/questions/680890/why-does-0-less-than-a-0">Why does $\frac{a}{0}$ always produce a number?</a><n><n>#### 💡<n>The answer to the question is "is x greater than or equal to 5"<n><n><a href="https://i.stack.imgur.com/0Z4Ds.jpg" rel="nofollow noreferrer"><img src="https://i.imgur.com/8mJlC0D.jpg" title="source: owner" /></a><n><n>### Input : Which of the following lists contains one more number than a list of six whole numbers? Choose from A, B, C.<n>### Rationale : Which number comes after 6, and before 7, 8, or 9?<n><n>### Input for instructor to solve and mark correct or incorrect :<n>- One more number than a list or six<n>- Whole numbers<n><n>### Solution:<n>E=A=6B=B+1C=B+1-A=B+7<n><n>The answer is C<n><n>### Instutor Remark :<n>The second number from the beginning is 7<n><n>### Solution :

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A wife asks a husband to stop being married to her, what is he likely to feel even with friends? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would you change the learning process to be if someone does not like learning? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The woman picked from an apple tree while surrounded by other trees, where was she? Choices:  A: illinois B: woods C: new york D: indiana E: farmer's market<n><n>### Response:		E, farmer's market.<n><n>### Response Rationale:<n><n>### Demand:<n><n>### Roughly 40% of US consumers don't trust food labeled “organic”, according to a recent survey by Consumer Reports. As a result, the USDA organic label is increasingly valuable in the marketplace, and its requirements are evolving as the industry itself evolves.<n><n>To begin, the amount of money consumers are willing to spend per unit on food is lower for food marked “organic” than it is for food marked “conventional.”<n>We find a similar pattern in the USDA’s data on the cost of production.  The difference in the average cost of organic and conventional production is very small – not even half of a penny – $48.30 per 100 pounds versus $48.21 per 100.<n><n>On the other hand, organic prices paid at farmer’s markets are on average 57% higher than prices for conventional produce (see Figure 2).<n><n>### What’s the reason for the price difference?<n><n>### Organic foods cost more on average because consumers are willing to pay additional premiums for the foods.<n><n>The 47% average premium for all organic foods is consistent with the overall market for organic foods: 83% of all US farmland in production received no certified organic practices. Organic sales at farmer’s market would only reflect certified organic crops, not all organic crops. In this case, organic sales at farmer's markets would be the best proxy for the 100% organic premium.<n><n>### **Demand**:<n><n>### Organics are valued for <n><n>### The primary reasons for the organic premium in food are (and for US farmers these reason is that they receive a premium for their organic foods).<n><n>### Response rationale:<n><n>## <n><n>### Input (multiple choice):Which of the following is the most appropriate response to the request to “Write a response that appropriately responds to this scenario.”<n><n>### Demolition:<n><n>### In 20% of cases where children were

Choices:  A: apartment B: classroom C: buildings D: car E: audience<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is B: classroom<< B: classroom>><n>The size of a classroom determines the number of people it can comfortably contain.<n>#### 130<n>Answer: D<< Answer: D>><n><n># Task C<n><n>#### Instruction:<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions. Note that the answer for each question is a whole number.<n><n>### Response 1:<n><n>Input:  The population of a village is to be reduced from 1200 to 560. How many people, in terms of dozens, must be removed from the village?<n><n>Rationales:  The village population is 12-36=<<12-36  =95>>95, which is a multiple of 12.<n><n>95+1=<<95+1= 96>>96 people must be removed from the population to reduce it to 560 people.<n><n>96-56=<<96-56 = 40>>40 people must be removed<n><n>#### 40
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:In what place could you find air that has been breathed by only a few people recently? Choices:  A: train station B: house C: cupboard D: cricket stadium E: surface of earth<n><n>### Response:		<n>A<n><n>### Rationale:<n>* Trains are often crowded with a lot of commuters<n><n>### Reference:<n>* https://stackoverflow.com/questions/17735436/multiple-choice-question-test-java<n><n>### Link:<n>* None

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you find a sign with some people lined up next to it? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The whole family was playing cards, they were full of joy and what?
