One of the three digits is 10. If 10+1=<<10+1=11>>11, the three digit products must be even to add up to 26403.<n><n>### Answer:<n>>27303<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:How can you get in shape if there is no land nearby? Choices:  A: swim B: jog C: excercise D: work out E: rock climb<n><n>### Response:		Choose answer B, C, E, or F<n><n>Input:A farmer wants to sell his field of corn. One acre produces 80 bushels of corn per year. He sells the crop each year for $3.40 per bushel. How much, in bushels, does his crop produce yearly?<n>Rationales :<n>Based on the acreage stated the field produces <<80(1)/3.4=<<80(1)/(3.4)>>40 bushels per year.Since the field produces only 40+<<1=2>>41 bushels it will take 2 years for the field to generate 80 bushels per year (given all other conditions remain the same during the 2 years production).<n>The 2 year production would be: <<41(2)/(3.4)=<<(41(2))/3.4>>53.60.<n>#### 53.60<n>Answer: 53.6 bushels<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What are ai machines known for doing? Choices:  A: fly B: milk cows C: eat D: answering questions E: fail to work<n><n>### Response:		A or answer A: The correct answer is A: fly because artificial intelligence machines make planes to fly.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:People are purposefully harming others, what trait are they exhibiting? Choices:  A: deceptive B: altruistic C: stupid D: cruel E: agressive<n><n>### Response:		If an attacker has a weapon and purposefully hurts someone, there is a threat.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The person is laying on the beach, why would he do that? Choices:  A: sun himself B: thank god C: race against time D: express love E: to think about things.<n><n>### Response:		<n>* The right answer is A and B!!!<n>	<n>### Demonstraion:<n>* I don't know how to prove it in an explicit mathematical way. But i guess that the reason might be sunning himself. Because it could make him feel warm and to show his friends that he have done something. <n><n>### Instructions:Solve each expression. Assume that all variables are non-negative.<n><n>#### 5*6+(2^2+14)*7*6+11<n><n>**_How to Solve It, I don't know._**<n><n>#### 29*72/(5*9)*18+8(28/69)<n>#### 252+__(8+__)/85<n><n>### Demotraiton:<n>#### 29*(6*7)+__<n>#### 25*(5*(25/6)+__)<n>#### __(25*(47/38)+__)<n><n>### Demetraction:<n>The right answer is _382__. I got this answer from solving the last equation in the book with the help of algebra tiles.<n>![](img/algebra.jpeg "Algebra Tiles")<n><n>### Demosntration:<n>[Here](https://www.khanacademy.org/math/algebra2/algebra-tiles/v/algebra-tile-example-inverting-two-digit-numbers) is video about how to do algebra tiles<n><n>### Instraction:Find the rule. Use and justify the rule to generate all values for the expressions.<n><n>### Rule: Whenever you see a fraction with a whole number in the denominator, you should divide the whole positive number by that fraction's top whole number.<n><n>So 3/4=3*/4=7/1==7.<n><n>### Demo:<n><n>### Instraciton:Rewrite each expression.<n><n>*15*(3/4)+(1*(5/8))*2(7/9*(12/13))<n><n>*In the same time i didn't manage to find the rule!!<n><n>#### 5*(7+__)/-((8+__)*7/9)<n><n>#### 5^(7*2)*6
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does someone want when having fun with their friends and trying to fit in? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would a ficus plant brighten up a room? What is the population of the town in A.D. 935?<n>### Rationale B: The number of people is doubling every 30 years so the number is 2x2x2x2...2 until it gets to 4,775 and so in 30 years another 459 is added to get to 935. <n><n>### Input C: A man is born on October 27th, 1892. If his birthday is always celebrated on October 27 each year, at what age is his birthday on a day of the week on which is it normally not celebrated?<n>### Rationales C: In general, we can count days of the week and multiply the number of years by the number of days of the week in a year. In this case, there are three possible combinations that need to be counted (days in a week-7,8,9 (26-Apr-27-Apr-28-Apr)).<n>8th birthday = Oct 27,8th Thursday  <n>9th birthday = Oct28,9th Friday  <n>17th birthday = 28-Apr, 17th Thursday<n>If his 35th birthday is October 28, Sunday, then his age on 9th of that year was Friday and his age after the year is Sunday. If his 35th age was Sunday then his age on 8th of that year was Wednesday and his age after the age is Saturday. Thus the answer is 9.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He wore the wrong shoes while walking all day, now he has what on his heels and toes? Choices:  A: exercise B: moving forward C: feet D: blisters E: locomotion<n><n>### Response:		<n>### Demonstraition:<n>1. A: exercise<n>2. B: moving forward<n>3. C: feet<n>4. D: blisters<n>5. E: locomotion  <n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:When he was a small child he called the giraffe mascot a cow, it was a fond memory of the now defunct what? Choices: A, America B, South<n>America C, South Africa D, Europe<n><n>### Response<n><n>A: America<n>#### 1<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>A: A dog is a cat?  B: The cat was to the dog as the apple was to the cider.  C: The apple was to the cereal as the cereal was to an oak tree.  D: The apple was to an oak as the cereal is to a wolf. G: The cherry was to the pie as the chocolate was to an oak.<n><n>### Response G: The cherry is to the pie as the oak is to the apple. <n>#### 1<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Having a car in the city seemed to be more trouble than it was worth, the man still had to walk to and from the what after commuting? Choices:  A: driveway B: the event C: scrap heap D: parking garage E: repair shop<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Explanation:Cars are parked at the garage or in the repair shop.<n><n>### Input:\<n>> * In 1892, the first airplane with enclosed pilot and passenger space and fixed wings was exhibited at the Heliographic Exhibition in Paris. This was the work of who? Who exhibited the first fully manned airplane in 1903? Choices:  George Curtiss (Choices: George Curtiss (B) & Louis Blériot (C)) Robert Esnault-Pelterie (Choices: Robert Esnault- Pelterie (B) & Gustavo Bargellini (C)) Gustave Blanchard (Choices: Gustave Blanchard(B) & Auguste Bérat(C)) Leon Bollee (Choices: Leon Bollee(B) & Armand Duval(C))<n><n>### Response:\<n>> * George Curtiss (George Curtiss (B))<n><n>### Explantation:\<n>> Gustave Blanchard was the second French man to build a biplane, and made the first French airline ticket sold to the public.<n><n>### What does it mean to have one or more than one of the following? Choices:  None of the above (Choices: None of the above(B) & One or more than one of such options (C)) One of the following (Choices: One of the following (B) & One of such options (C)<n><n>### Response::<n>> * One of such options (One of such options(C))<n><n>###### Explanation:\<n>> This word does NOT mean: None of the above.<n>> This word DOES mean: One of such options. In other words, it is one of the listed options.<n><n>### If you have a cell phone, you will probably take it with you virtually everywhere you go. You use it as needed to talk or text other people. Which of the following is a text? A phone call (Choices: A phone call(A) & A text (B)) One word in a text (Choices: One word in a text(B) & One line in a call (C)) One-click message (Choices: One-click message (B) & One word of a text (C)) Short text that

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would a ticket help you to get to a different country? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A common saying, Sam thought, was to go forth, also this. Choices:  A: reverse B: backwards C: back and D: back and E: tally back<n><n>### Response:		E, back<n><n>### Test input:Input:<n>A woman who is eight months pregnant is walking down the street when a robber comes up behind her, points a gun at her, and demands her money. The robber notices that the woman is rather large, especially in the abdomen. He says, "Look, lady, you're either going to give me all your money, or I'm going to shoot you and then take your money."  The woman looks at the robber and says,<n>"I'd rather have my purse than be shot. Why don't you shoot me in the legs instead?" The robber thinks this over for a minute and says, "I guess I could do that if I had to."  The woman says, "Here, take my purse; this will be easier for me."  "OK, but when you give me the money, get rid of the gun and drop to your knees," says the robber.  The woman doesn't have a lot of choice and drops to her knees.  She then reaches into her purse, pulls out a pair of handcuffs, cuffs herself and says, "Now, go ahead and shoot me" The robber, puzzled, looks down at the cuffed woman lying on the pavement and the $40 in her hand. He looks around and sees a policeman sitting on the curb watching this event.  He thinks about this for a few seconds, pulls the gun away, hands the woman $40 and says, "Take this money and get a hotel; I'm going to go back to police headquarters."<n><n>### Answer:C<n><n>### Test solution:<n>Input:What is the difference in their ages: The man's age is four times the number of years remaining until her sister's wedding.<n>Rationales:<n>If the man's age is 4n, where n represents the number of years remaining for her sister's weddings:<n>4n=<<4n>>4n<n>(4n-n)=<<4n+-n>>(4n-n)<n>(4n-2n)=<<2n>>2n<n>(2n)-n=<<2n>><n>2n=n<n>n=<<2n/n>>2n/n<n>n
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A shower is an expected amenity when you reserve a what? Choices: A: a gy mnasiu B: motel room<n>A shower is an expect amenity when you reserver motel or room.<n> <n>### Input:<n>A car radio can tune to 111 stations, each with a call sign. How many different letters may be used in the call signs?<n><n>### Response<n>An  answer is below:The letters A-Z and 0-9 are the only two different letters that may be used in call signs.<n><n>### Input<n>A computer has a 256-page memory with 128 pages dedicated to memory for programs alone.  If a total of 100 programs are stored on the computer, where do the other 25 programs go (must be between available memory on the computer and 1 program)?<n><n>### Response <n><n>An  answer is shown below:The other 25 programs are stored on the page reserved for the operating system and the other software.<n><n>### Explanations:<n>A: The 105 pages are used for the OS and other system programs.<n><n>### B: In this  case, the page reserved the 256 pages in the computer is for the operating software.<n><n>##  <n>The answer's are below:<n><n>### Instructions<n>Answer the following multiple choice questions.<n><n>### Choice A, How many different letters may  be used in a call sign for a radio station?  Choices:<n><n><n>[C] <n>A: <n>There are 26*1=26  different possible options for the letter<n><n>### Choices<n><n>[B,] <n>A: 26<n><n>### A: How many different things  may be used  in the call sign for a radio sation?  Choices: <n><n>There are 27 letters that may be used to form a 27*2=54 different call signs.<n><n>[A] <n>A: The letters A-Z and numbers from 0-9.<n><n>### A choice may be used in a call to sign for a radio station.<n><n>###

A plane flies from Seattle to Chicago.  A commercial jet airplane has an average fuel consumption of 40,000 pounds of fuel/hour.  If a commercial jet has a fuel storage capacity of 240,00 gal, how many hours can the plane operate before it runs out of fuel and is forced to return to Seattle for more fuel?<n>Rationales:: The plane must return to Seattle for more than one hour of flight for the 40000 pounds to be consumed.<n>Thus, this will require more than two hours travel.<n>This would require more fuel than the plane has capacity to carry, thus a return to Seattle for more would result.<n><n>### Input A 35% of 1,000=<<35%(1000)>=350>><n>350/(35%*1000)=<<350/(34.5%*10%)*1000>><n>35/0.35=<<35/0.24>>3.667<n>0.24x3.667=0.88<n>0.88=<<0.88=>1.02>>1.02<n><n>### Output:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### A:

He lived with his children because he didn't want to go where? Choices:  A: republican party B: old people's home C: office D: park E: high school or college<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct response is to a senior's facility like a nursing home<n><n>### Outline:<n>#### Instruction<n><n>\[Lindy was a senor.\,\]<n><n>#### Demonstration<n><n>\[He lived with his children.\,\]<n><n>\[But he didn't want\ \to go to the\ \to where?\, i.e., a senior?s facility? \[e.?\]<n><n>\[Choices:  A:  Republican party   B:  Old people?s home\ C:  Office   D:  Park   E:  High School or college.\,\]<n><n>Answer: The correct choice is "E: High school or college"<n>\[Lindly was a senior.\,\]<n><n>But he didn’t want to go to the where? i.e., a seniors’ facility, such as a nursing home.<n><n>Choices:<n>A) Republican party<n>B) Old people’s home<n>C) Office<n>D) Park<n>E) High school or college<n><n>#### My solution<n><n>E:High School or College<n><n>Comment: Comments are not for extended discussion; this conversation has been [moved to chat](https://chat.stackexchange.com/rooms/138232/discussion-on-question-by-sami-nasiri-how-to-understand-this-exercise).

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Why might a person go to get counseling? Choices:  A: to be heard B: receive gifts C: understand themselves D: good things in life E: acknowledgment<n><n>### Response:		In psychology, counseling (professional counseling in the United States, and counselling or therapy in much of the English-speaking world) is a practice in which practitioners aim to build a trusting relationship with individuals in order to help them handle life difficulties in a more adaptive and positive manner. In many settings, it is considered an art rather than a science, a "profession of the heart", although at times it is clearly a business. Like other health professions, it has been subject to a significant amount of controversy. Some of the main points of controversy are the question of whether those who practice counseling do it more on the basis on humanistic qualities or by means of the evidence-based scientific approach of experimental medicine.<n><n>### Input :<n>I want to find a job as a salesperson in a shop. The shop is 100 feet from the start of a 5-mile bus ride to the nearest bus stop. The shop is also 100 feet away from the end of the bus ride. How far will I be from a bus stop after starting my bus ride?<n>Rationales : The shop is 1/2 of a 5- mile ride in length from the bus stop.<n>The shop is 1/4 of a mile from the bus stop. <n>And 100/5=<<100/5>=20>>20.<n>The shop is (20) miles from the bus stop. And,(20)*2=<<20*(2)=40>>40<n>And 10/20=1/2=<<1/2=0.5>>0.5 so after riding one unit on the bus, I will travel 50/0.5=<<50/0.05>>50 miles from the bus stop(because one round trip on the bus will take me back to the bus stop).<n><n>#### 50<n>answer: 50<n><n>### Question:<n>Write a response that meets the expectations by doing the following:<n>1. Demonstrate an understanding of your task.<n>1. Write your response in an informative manner.<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What might someone do who is having fun? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The old barn was beyond repair, they had to destroy it before they could what a new one? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:They wanted to eat at home but the cupboards were barren, so they had to go what? The phrase"charges.." shows that they're charging something. Thus, we have a verb (Charges).<n><n><n>- **Option B:** The answer is B because the text says, "(1) a car, (2) or (3) for the first week for..." **Rationale:** The author is talking about rental fees, thus, the question asks for an 'amount' of dollars paid. **Rationale:** Thus, the author is asking for 'amount', which is a noun. Option'B' is the only one that gives 'amount' and therefore the right choice.<n><n><n>- **Question 2**:<n>- **Option C:** The answer to this question is D. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:while luck plays a big role, every person who is great at something has focus and what to it? Choices:  A: hatred B: surprised C: compliments D: dedication E: solutions<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Input:While luck plays a big role<n>Every person who is great at a<n>lot can be something<n><n>(Luck):While luck playing a big role<n>Every one who great is at something<n><n>(A): hatred<n><n>### <n><n>(B): surprised<n><n>(C): compliments<n><n>(D): dedication<n><n>(E): solution<n><n>### A: hatred<n><n>## <n><n>### B: surprised<n><n>## <n>### C: compliments<n><n>## <n>####D: dedication<n>E: solution<n><n>### Demostration:  This shows 26+10=36<n>### Answer:<n><n>### (Rationales :)<n>#### 36<n>Answer: 36<n><n>### Instructions: Enter the question in the space below, then type the response that correctly answers the question.<n><n>##### Instructions<n><n>### Enter the question in the box below. Then type a response that correctly answers the given question.<n>### Instruxation: Enter the question in space below than type the answer<n><n>### Question :What is the best way to spell the first names of the following people?:<n><n>### Input<n><n>### Name<n>### <n>#### <n>### Name:<n>### <n>### Name<n>#### <n>##<n>### Input: If a ball is thrown straight up into the air at 300 feet per second at what height above the ground, in feet, will the ball land?<n>Rationals:<n>1. Let y be the height of the ball above the ground in feet.<n>2. Since the ball is thrown straight up, its change in height is always equal to its change in distance.<n>3. The change in the distance is equal to speed (V) multiplied by time (t).<n>4. V times t=speed (V) times distance (D).<n>5. So D=t-time (t) and D=yt<n>6. yt=yt.<n>7. Since the only thing changing is time (T), the height of the ball must be some constant.<n>8. We substitute that y=t.<n>9. (300)t=yt<n>10. t=300/y<n>11. But 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What chore might a child have to do after breakfast, before getting on the bus? Choices:  A: drop out of school B: ask questions C: enter school D: wash dishes E: read book<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Rationales: A<n><n>### Response2: B<n><n>Rationales2: B<n><n>### Response3: C<n><n>Rationales3: A<n><n>## Question<n><n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Find each of the following answers.<n><n>#### Question 2<n>Input: The car rental company charges $ per day or $ per week for rentals of a week or more. The fee to enter a theme park is $20 for adults and $10 for kids 12 and under. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. A lot of things can be learned about cars from attending car shows. Cars are very expensive, so only rich owners have many car show experiences and know a lot of unique car models. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where in a town would you put your shed? Choices:  A: next to the house B: keeping things in C: backyard D: farm yard E: ranch<n><n>### Response:		 Select the following options based on your choice.<n>Input:Where in a town  would you put your shed.  Choices:  A-R,  B-R,  C-L,  D-W,  E-W.<n><n><n>#### Answers:<n><n>Input: Where in a town would you run to escape a tornado? Choices:  C-F,  D-F,  E-F,  A-G,  B-G,  Tornado-G,  A-G.<n><n><n>#### Tornado<n><n><n>### Input<n>Given the choices: C-F, D-S, and E-S, what would you do?<n>```<n><n>### Write a response that appropriates completes the request.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If you're traveling along a highway what item made of paper can you use to find your way? Choices:  A: united states B: atlas C: developed land D: park E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		<n>Input:If you're driving along a highway what item can you use to find out where you are?<n><n>Rationales: An atlas will identify state or country borders and you can estimate how far the highway is from the border and then use the mileage marker sign to find your mileage from that border.<n><n>#### Answer: D<n><n>    An atlas will identify all land areas including countrysides so it is also correct to pick that option and will help you with your estimate.<n><n>### Input : The United States Postal Service (USPS) will use robots to deliver 40 to 80 percent of their packages by 2020. (Source: United States Postal Service) What is the main benefit of using robots to deliver packages?: <n><n>### Response : To work more efficiently<n><n>### Why it is correct:<n>Robots are capable of delivering packages in greater volume and will also allow the USPS to deliver more items without being limited to the number of routes that they currently have.<n><n>### Source: https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/innovations/wp/2017/01/16/the-future-of-the-postal-service-could-involve-robots/<n><n>### Rational for answer:<n><n>### Instructions: <n>Input: What is the highest number that has square root of 4? Answer choices: <n>1(1 is the lowest)  <n>2(2^1/2 is equal to the square root)  <n>6(6^1/2 is the same)  <n>16(16^1/2)  <n>144(144^1/2)<n><n>### Source<n>https://www.kindergartenworks.net/games/kindergarten-games-math/index.php/question/635/what-is-the-highest-number-that-has-square-root-of-4<n><n>### <n>What is the 3rd number in this pattern: 129 123136 1231231 1231431 12431234?<n><n>    The answer is 12318
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where in your entrance hall can you keep you head wear? Choices:  A: school B: large home C: house D: hat rack E: closet<n><n>### Response:		I will keep it on  my D.<n><n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If I wanted to see a lizard in its natural habitat but I do not speak Spanish, where would I go? Choices:  A: utah B: south america C: new hampshire D: japan E: new mexico<n><n>### Response:		A<n>Input:<n><n>### Question:<n><n>```<n>How much did it cost to send an email?<n>```<n><n>### Demostration:<n><n>```<n>35 cents<n>```<n><n>## Instructions<n>Rewrite each code in a way that makes it more efficient. Describe each change that you made and explain how your solution is better. If you cannot rewrite the code, explain why not and describe the reason you believe that code is not efficient.<n><n>## Solution<n><n>### Instructions<n>Use the code below and rewrite it in a more efficient way. Describe each change and explain why it improves the efficiency. If you cannot rewrite this code, explain why.<n><n>```python<n>def findMissing(N):<n>    number = [0] * N<n>    for k in range(1,N,1):<n>        number[k] = number[k-1] + 1<n>    missing_number = number[N-1]<n>    return missing_number<n>```<n><n>## Solution<n>The code above can be replaced with the more efficient while loop.<n><n>```python <n>i = 1<n>while (i <= n):<n>    number[i] = number[i-1] + 0<n>    i = i +1<n>print(number[n])<n>```<n><n>## Description<n><n>The code can be simplified to<n><n>```python 3<n>number = [0] * (int(9) // 2)<n>number.extend([1] * int(9) // 5)<n>i = len(number)<n>print(number[i % 2])<n>```<n><n>The code can even be shortened to<n><n>```python<n>#length  = 6<n>for i in range (0, length-1):<n>    number.append(0)<n>    number[len(number)-1] = i + 1<n>    print(number[len(number)-2])<n>```<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Sarah opened his chest and found a second heart. Choices:  A: istanbul B: animal C: antique shop D: human being E: bedroom<n><n>### Response:		A: istanbul<n><n>### Input"In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth."  The Bible is describing events that were important for humankind.  However, many scholars believe the creation of the Earth was probably gradual, and not the result of a single act.  Some believe life has existed on Earth for billions of years.  Humans use fossils to trace the evolution of life.  The theory of evolution states that life evolves through a series of small changes that result in increasing adaptability and complexity.  There are no fossils of a "missing link" that would connect reptiles to mammals.  Many animals and plant species have become extinct, due to a variety of causes, during the 1.8 billion years that the Earth has existed.  A species that has vanished due to human influence is called an endangered species.<n><n>Write an essay that discusses the points of view described in the reading above.<n><n>#### Point:<n>Write: First, point that first paragraph that describe creation of Earth it is a beginning of life.<n>We do not know it how long and how, life began.<n>Next point is describing the Earth.<n>An earth is only a one planet.<n>Furthermore explain of evolution.<n>In the evolution there are no fossils of missing link.<n>Simply it can not find out.<n>There are many species that have become extinct.<n>Endangered species are a species that will be destroyed if we continue using Earth not carefully.<n><n>#### Point 2<n>Write: After point 1 point.<n>Due to the earth, we have a life.<n>Since it will take a long, many years as history of a planet, human beings should love Earth.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What does a master carpenter use to put holes in objects? Answer: $3.9750<n>#2 How many hours can a car travel on $6.75 dollars in gasoline? How many gallons can a car travel each $6.75? Answer: 1.25 gallons<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a good place to buy moistener? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a lion likely to live? Choices:  A: veldt B: ocean C: savannah D: africa E: jungle<n><n>### Response:		<n>A)<n><n><n><n>### Input Choice A:  veldt<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Ocean<n><n>#### Savannah<n><n>####  Africa<n><n>####  Jungle<n><n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input: Please provide a summary of two articles from an outside source concerning global issues.<n>Rationales: Describe where you obtained the articles.<n>Describe the overall global issue presented by the articles.<n>Designate the title of each article in the summary.<n>Provide a summary of what you learned about that issue.<n><n>#### Articles<n>A) From: https://www.bbc.com/news/world-latin-america-46574511<n>Title: ‘World must act now’ to curb Amazon fires, warns Brazil’s Bolsonaro<n><n>#### B) From: BBC: https://www.huffpost.com/entry/brazil-amazon-rainforest-fires_n_5d0a559be4b0973583d212d4<n>Title: Bolsonaro's Amazon Fires Reveal The Cost Of His Deregulation Of Deforestation<n><n>#### Overall Global Issue<n><n>#### Article A<n><n><n>#### Article B<n><n>#### Overall global issue:<n><n>### Instructon:<n><n>### Response <n><n>#### How do you think the presidential candidate of your choice will manage and regulate global issues?  <n><n>#### How would you rank the four responses from worst to best?<n><n>#### Response 1: From: https://wwws3.nytimes.com/downsample/images/packages/longreads/2019/08/22/10/fashion-cover-400.jpg<n>Rank: <<6>>6<n><n>#### Response 2: From: https://static01.nyt.com/images/2019/_400x261/49266074E2C42F0EE057386D9B663CA8/4926f270-9d1f-11e9-96d7-bb024a9bdb51.jpg?quality=
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Everybody raised a drink and cheered, they were doing what? Choices:  A: were thirsty B: toasting C: getting drunk D: refreshment E: celebrating<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### A<n>#### B<n>#### C<n>#### D<n>#### E<n><n>### Instructions:Please respond to my responses in a word document that includes your response/answers.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John is getting something important. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He got a job dancing and waving an advertisement, he got to be outside instead of stuck inside the what? By how much is he taller (higher) from the base of the clif? Choices: 30ft 47ft 67ft<n><n>### Response A. If he is 15% of the way it means there are 40% left and 15>40 <n><n>### B. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where does someone lay with their leg elevated when it's broken? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Dry and cracked heels are found on? Choices:  A: boot B: the desert C: loaf of bread D: foot E: hock<n><n>### Response:		<n>The correct answer choice is C<n><n>### Justification:<n>A) Dry and cracked heals are found on the desert<n>B) Dry and crackied heels are found on feet<n><n>### Input#2:The word below is the plural form of the word "man." Which of the following words would complete the blank in the following sentence in the correct English form? "The children ______ played at the park." The answer choices are: A. men B. men C. man.<n><n>### Response#2<n>The correct answer is C. man<n><n>Justification:<n>A) The plural form of man is men<n><n>B) The word play is incorrect.<n><n>### Input - Third Grade Question:Which of the following numbers is the sum of 3 and 4?1. A 5 2.B 6 3. C 7 4. D 8 <n><n>### Third Grade Response: The answer is 7<n><n>### Third grade justification:<n>It is the sum of 4 and 3.<n>5 = 3 + 2<n>6 = 4 + 2<n>7 = 3 + 4<n>8 = 4 + 4<n>9 = 6 + 3<n>10 = 4 + 6<n>11 = 4 + 5<n>12 = 5 + 7<n>13 = 6 + 6<n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He had an index card he had to return, so where did he put it after finding the book he needed? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do I put my coffee mug after it's dry? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John is a human who is in a wheelchair due to an accident. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He would finally see idea become reality, never in a million years did he what that this would happen? Choices:  A: think B: patent C: determined D: work hard E: relax<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:<n>1. Create a single method named `print_array_helper` or `populate_array_helper`. The method must return the specified value.<n>2. Declare the `name` variable, assign a value to it.<n>3. Declare any helper variables that can be used within the `print_array` method.<n>4. Create the `print_array_method` method and declare/define the arguments required to call the method.<n>5. Use the `name = ""` statement, assign the arguments to the values specified within the parentheses.<n>6. Use the `print (name)` statment, call the `name` variable.<n>7. Call methods or functions to achieve the specified output.<n>8. The `print_array` or `populateArray` methods must return the appropriate specified value.<n><n>### Code:<n><n>#### 1. Create a method named print_array_helper that can print the specified values. <n>This method should have a minimum of 7 arguments.<n>In this method, the name variable, that is assigned, should equal any value specified.<n>The method should then print the name variable, surrounded in appropriate quotation marks.<n>Then, print one line for every argument passed into the method, within that line, each argument should be separated by a comma, and all arguments should have appropriate quotation marks around each argument.<n>#### 2.  <n>#### 2. Declare and assign any variable that could be used within the method. <n>In this method, you should declare any variables that can be used in the method. <n>Here, you should also assign a value to those variables. <n>#### 3.  <n>#### 3. Create the printArray method.  <n>Create a method named printArray. <n>This method will receive a list of any values, separated with commas, within the parentheses.<n>Each element in each comma-separated value, will become the value of an argument.<n>When called, this method will loop through all of the variables, one at a time, and print the name of each variable to the console.  <n><n>#### 4.  <n><n>####  4. Now, create a method named populateArray. <n>Create a method named populateArray and declare the method to return the specified value. <n>Create a new list and add any values specified to the list. <n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a negative effect to someone other than a spouse when two spouses are getting divorced? Choices:  A: lot of grief B: depression C: no spouse D: lose money E: children suffer<n><n>### Response:		It is a negative effect for the children to suffer.<n><n>### Input (continuation):If a loan officer is talking with a couple of prospective buyers, a good idea would be to have the loan officer discuss<n><n>Rationales: A: Buying the house<n><n>B: Saving for a down payment<n><n>C: Different types of mortgages<n><n>D: How much income is required to qualify

How much time will Jonathan spend taking the tests?<n><n>### Demostration:<n>Rationales:  If Jonathan spends 10 minutes taking the first test, he must spend 50 minutes taking the second test, since he will have 50 minutes to spare.<n>But for the first test he will spend 80 minutes (or 30 minutes plus 50 minutes)<n>For the second test he will spend 30 minutes (or 10 minutes + 50 minutes) <n>So total of 80 + 30 = 110 minutes (or 2.9 hours) taken to take both tests.<n>#### 2.9<n>Answer: 2.9<n>

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:He found the blowfish off the coast of the Carolina's, it was where? Choices:  A: rock band B: sea of japan C: sushi restaurant D: fish market E: atlantic ocean<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>C<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>B<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What area is likely to contain a large village? Choices:  A: rural area B: big city C: suburbs D: ohio E: countryside<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### Input: What is 2x-7?<n><n>__Rationales:__<n>R:2x-7<n>2:x<n>R:x-7<n>Addition:x-7<n>Sum:2x-7___x-7_______7>__<n><n>__Response:__<n><n>#### 2<n>Answer: 2<n><n>#### Input:What is twice the sum of 9 and 5?<n><n>### Rationales:__<n>__Response:__5+9=_____ 9+5=14>__<n><n>#### 14<n>Answer: 14<n>
