How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What do people use to absorb extra ink from a fountain pen? Choices:  A: shirt pocket B: calligrapher's hand C: inkwell D: desk drawer E: blotter<n><n>### Response:		<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Johnny sat on a bench and relaxed after doing a lot of work on his hobby. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Joe suffered many consequences from stabbing a stranger to death. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a great place to lay in the sun? Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is a bald eagle safe? Choices:  A: pine tree B: open country C: in washington D: wildlife refuge E: sky<n><n>### Response:		A: The correct answer is "A: pine tree"<n><n>### Input<n><n>The new car dealer has a used car for which the net cost of the vehicle equals the sum of the vehicle's wholesale price and the vehicle's manufacturer incentive.  How much, in dollars is the manufacturer's incentive?<n><n>### Response<n><n>The correct answer is $50.<n><n>### Additional Information<n><n>Because manufacturer's invoice = manufacturer's list price, this can be rewritten as $$$manufacturer's invoice_{1}=manufacturer's list price_{1}$$ and so $$$manufacturer incentive_{0}=manufacturer list price_{1}$$$ and $$$net cost_{1}=cost_{1}$$ Therefore we have the following equation: $$$net cost_{0}=wholesale price_{1}+manufacturer price_{0}$$$ Using the fact that $$$manufacturer price_{1}=manufacturers incentive_{1}$$ $$$wholesale price_{0}=cost_{0}-incentive_{1}$$$ And $$$wholesale cost=-incentive_{0}=-manufacturers invoice_{0}$$ Finally $$$net cost_{-1}=cost_{-1}-(-incentive_{0})=-cost_{0}$$$ And that is the manufacturer' choice of $$$50$$.<n><n>### Question<n><n>The correct answer above is: A bald eagle is safe in a pine tree.<n><n>### Explanation<n><n>The manufacturers incentive can not be used to subtract to increase the price, so $15 is subtracted from the wholesale price. Then the manufacturer's choice is $50. If they choose $15, then the new car dealer is paying $15 less, or $(cost)$$-(Manufacturer choice)=$$$55$$$. <n>

We may infer that the word “just” was used incorrectly. We expect an alarm to set off if proximity is “true” (that is, if the alarm sets off, we may infer that it finds something to be true).<n>Another choice of a synonym would be “If the sensor detects...”<n><n>#### Dear Sir:<n>If the sensor detects proximity it will set off an alarm.<n><n>#### ANSWER:<n>#### E<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where is there usually a fiddle playing? Choices:  A: music store B: dance hall C: orchestra D: symphony E: tennessee<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Demnstation<n>Input:Fred will read 8 books every week if he is in New York.  If he is in Paris, he does not read.  If he is at a cabin in the woods and has no reading materials, he reads 8 books every week.  If he is not at a cabin in the mountains during the summer, he reads 4 books.  If he is a student at a business school, he reads 10 books a week.  How many books does Fred read, on average, during his school years?<n>Rationales Choice A:  New York, 8 books/week.<n>Choice B:  Paris, 0 books/week.<n>Choices C-E:  Cabin in mountains, 8 books/ week.<n>Choice F:  Student, 10 books/week.  Choice B is excluded.<n>Cabin in mountains is excluded.<n>In summer, cabins in mountains are no more than 4/3=<<4/3=1>>1 day each.<n>Summer is 6 weeks or 42 days.<n>1/42≈<<1/42≈0.0238>>0.0237<<0.0239>>0.239 days.<n>239*8=<<239*8=$1968>>1968 books are read each year.<n><n>#### 1970<n>Answer: 1970 books<n><n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Can you name a good reason for attending school? When is it true that in a single statement, the same variable can have a different value?<n>Explained- When the same variable is used for multiple values in the same statement, then they will have a different value.<n><n>#### False<n><n>3. When is it true the same variable has the same value in multiple statements?<n><n>Explained the same variable has the the same value if the variable is a different name in the different statements.<n><n><n>4. What is a program?<n>Vocabulary- The collection of instructions called a "program" is written in a sequence of commands that is described using a programming language.<n><n>Explained: A program, and its individual commands, must be written using a programming language.  A programming language is a unique set of rules and words used to write codes to achieve a certain result.<n><n>5. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a good result of losing weight? Choices:  A: increased energy B: healthier C: loose skin D: beauty E: death<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### ##<n><n>Input:What is a good answer to the above question?<n>You should answer **E**, as this is not a multiple choice question<n>Instead, you should tell us an appropriate response. <n><n>#### ##<n>Answer:<n>E: death<n><n><n><n><n><n>**Instructions**<n><n>You know the question is, "What is the speed of a turtle crossing a road?"<n>If you try to answer the question, you might say 1 mile per hour, or any number from 1 to 1000.<n>That's because the question is not about the speed of a tiger crossing a river, or an elephant, a giraffe or a cheetah crossing the road.<n>Also, you cannot answer that the turtle makes no progress when crossing the road, as the question is not about a tortoise.<n>If you think the turtle crawls in the opposite direction of the road's flow, you can be wrong.<n>Finally, you cannot say nothing, either. If you give the answer of, "Nothing, he just stops dead in the middle of the road," that is also not correct, as the question is about crossings.<n><n>### What do you say to the turtle when he asks you what is your favorite color?"<n><n>**Option 1:** "Red"<n><n>**Option 2:** "Goldenrod"<n><n>**Option  3:** "Purple"<n><n>**Option     4:** "Green"<n><n><n><n>***You should say what's not a correct answer to the above question.***<n><n><n>### ## **<n><n>We want to know, "Is the answer to the above question, **Option  4**?"<n><n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple question.<n><n><n>### Demand:What is that thing you don't like about someone else when it is also true of yourself? You should answer "None of the above" because only 1 and 2 are multiple choice.<n>You do not need to specify which of the two you like, 1 or 2.<n><n>### Response<n><n><n>#### ##<n>### None of the above.<n><n><n><n><n>### Rationales:Option 1 and 2 contain a list of qualities in a person
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The accountant used a calculator regularly, he kept one at home and one at the what? Choices:  A: desk drawer B: desktop C: office D: wristwatch E: city hall<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Instructions:Use your calculator to calculate the square root of 17 for the specified interval.<n><n>### Result:The square root of 14 for the specified interval is 2.62.<n><n><n>### Instructor Guide:Slide to the next set of instructions.<n><n>### Answer:A.4+2*-6=C-2 is the next set of instructions<n><n>### Student Responses:Enter the correct response to the question above.<n><n>### Input 3:The gas tank of the car was full, and the temperature was 60 degrees outside. What is the formula for finding the percentage of the gasoline that will condense if the gas car is left in the garage over night and the temperature outside falls to 50 degrees?<n><n>### Answer 3:<n>Rationales:<n>- Since the temperature will drop, the amount of gasoline that can condense from the car's temperature will be smaller.<n>- The formula for finding the percentage decrease is 4%(change in absolute gas tank temperature / temperature of gas tank when not condensing)<n><n>The answer is 4% * (50 - 60) = 20%(50-60) = 0.2(50-65)<n><n>### Result 3:<n>Result:20%(5-15)=0.2(5-15)<n><n>## Instructor Guide:<n>- Slide until you get to the next instructions.<n><n>## Instruction:<n>- Use the given information in the instructions above to answer the questions below.<n>- Your answers must be in the specified format and in the spaces provided.<n>- Refer to the attached instructions for the format and answer template.<n><n>## Student Responses<n>To be filled in by learners<n><n>## Instructors Notes<n><n>- The instructor can review the learner’s response to determine if the content answers the prompt correctly.<n>- The instructor should also review the learners work to ensure that they are following the correct format.<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:It was a great rest, she had never felt this much what in the morning? Choices:  A: active B: hunger C: in motion D: wakefulness E: lay down<n><n>### Response:		B<n><n>### Instructions:<n>I need 25 hours of work to finish this project. How much, in hours, am I currently working?<n><n>### Response<n>Input: The time in minutes it has been since I started would be.<4 hours>>4 hours.<n>(4 Hours/24=1/24>>1/24=1 in 24 hours and a day)<n>And one half of a day is.<<6 hours>>6 hours.<n><n>### So (<6 hours>>6 hours/24=<<6 hours>>6/24=1<6/24=3/8>>3/8)<n><n>Input: 40% of the children are above average.<n><n>The number of children of interest is << 100>> 100.<n>The number of children above average is 30, or <<40%>>40% of 100<n><n>### Above average children:<n>100*0.4=<<100*(0.4)>>40<n>And 40 =40<n>(And 100*40 =<<100*(40)>>10% of 120, or 60)<n>Or (The total number of children in the population )/((The number of above average children in the population)/100) =<< 100>>100.<n><n>### Children below average:<n>(The total number of children - the above-average children) ==<< 100-40>>60<n><n>The number of below-average children is 60.<n><n>__Question 7:__<n><n>### Input<n>40% of the students at the school had ≥ 50% in exams<n><n>The total number of students:<n>100/100=<< 100/120>>100%(30/120=<<30/12>>25/20%, and 30+25=<< 30+27>>55/100%<n><n>Which is <<3%>>3% of 10 = 1+1=2 2/10=20% 20%

Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a person who is well educated? Choices:  A: illiterate B: knowledgable C: own house D: have enough food E: meet expectations<n><n>### Response:		D<n><n>### Rationales:The words used in this sentence can be considered antonyms. An antonym is a word that means the opposite of another word.<n><n>In this sentence, the word used for an educated person is the opposite of having enough food.<n><n>### A: illiterate<n><n>The opposite of illiterate would be literate, or well educated.<n><n>### B: knowledgable<n><n>Knowledgeable is not the antonym of illiterate.<n><n>### The meaning of the sentence is still the same even if either A, B, or D is replaced with C: This response would still be considered D.<n><n>### C: own house<n><n>Owning a house is not the antonymn of not meeting expectations.<n><n>### E: meet expectations <n><n>Not meeting expectations is the antonym of owning a house.<n><n>### 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Letters are sometimes delivered by hand through one of these. Choices:  A: mail box B: suitcase C: front door D: bowl E: post office<n><n>### Response:		<n>This is a new question, answer whatever is most appropriate.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>The options available for this question are choices A through D.<n><n>Rationales: Since the letters are being delivered by hand, we know the answer is not B, the suitcase.<n>C, the front door, is a delivery option if there is a human who will be able to accept the letter.<n>If there is nobody available at the front door, then D, the post box, will accept the letter.<n>However, it does not answer, since the answer was already available, that the mailbox needs to be a postage stamped mailbox in order for it to be the correct answer.<n>If we are using a regular mailbox and there is nobody home to accept the letter, it has to be placed in a post office and then the right amount of postage will be required.<n>The correct answer is the post office.

Choices:  A: dream B: fiddle C: watch film D: see new E: work<n><n>### Response:		None of these, a,b, or c are correct.<n>A, b, and c are all incorrect because they describe when there's nothing else to do or when you're supposed to do something different.<n>d describes when you have to do what there already expected to do which is answer your boss' question, not answer your boss' boredom.<n>the correct answer, E, tells you that you're actually supposed to do your work when you're feeling bored.<n>### Input: The total of $23.95 plus the 7.1% sales tax on that purchase comes to almost?<n><n>### Response B: $<n><n>### Correct answer:<n>Input:  A. It may contain 15 cards, each of which has a certain value and was removed from the box one at a time, each time the box is refilled with another card, starting at a value of 15, in each new sequence of draws. All draws start with the top card first, until nothing is left.<n><n>A. The box is filled from the same supply of cards before it is refilled on the first draw.<n><n>B. There always remain a few cards the sum of the values on which is less than or equal to the number of cards remaining after the last draw.<n><n>C. If the value that remains in the box after the last draw is not one, there is not a way to determine whether or not that value was one before the last draw.<n>#### A<n>Answer: No<n><n>#### B<n>Answer: Yes<n><n>#### C<n>Answer: No<n>#### D<n>Answer: Yes<n>#### E<n>Answer: Yes<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What can someone feeling happiness fall into? Choices:  A: lead to laughter B: love C: laughter D: smiles E: tears<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  B: love C: lead to laughter D: smiling E: tears<n><n><n>### Input<n>What fraction of the time is represented by the decimal? If the decimal is the amount _____.<n><n>###### My answer: 33<n><n>### Response<n><n>###### My response: 40<n>

Choices:  A: michigan B: wyoming C: mississippi D: tennessee E: mississippi<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>Rationales: Jackson is the capital of Mississippi, and thus, the Governor's office is located in Jackson, Mississippi.<n>The only Jackson with a Governor's office is Jackson, Mississippi.<n>Because you can only be the Governor of one location.<n><n>### Input The airport code for San Jose, CA is what: 1. JSQ 2. 131 <n><n>Input The airport code for Bonaire, Aruba is what:<n>1. BNI 2. BON<n><n>RationalesThe airport code for San Fransicso Airport is SJO, and there is no airport named San Jose.<n>Therefore, the airport code is JSQ and not SJQ<n>It is possible that SJQ is some other airport that does not exist, but it is more likely that it refers to San Jose, Spain as this may be the airport code for the airport near San Jose, California.  This is unlikely, and we will assign JSQ as the code for Bonaire Airport.<n>Note: There are several airports with the name San Jose Airport and Airport San Jose-Coto 470<n>This airport code does not look like it is from a country that is a member of IATA.<n>Because, no airport from the country should start with a letter that is outside of the alphabet, or with a digit.<n><n><n>## Input:<n>John has 3 coins. One is a penny, one is a nickel, and one is a dime. If he uses the coins in any order, he can make change for any amount. How many different ways can he make change?<n><n>## Response:<n><n>The response to this question is that the possible ways to make change would be 1, 2, 4 or 6.<n>The possible numbers of change for this problem are 18, 19, 20 and 0.<n>One possible way to make change for any number of 18 cents is for the three coins to be a penny, a nickel and a dime.<n>We can also use 19 cents by using two pennies and one nickel.<n>And for the coins to be 20 cents, both pennies or one penny and a dime must be used.<n>The last
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The man wanted to take a bus, but all the chars were full of people doing what? Choices:  A: sitting down B: refusing C: saving money D: sit down E: go outdoors<n><n>### Response:		Business<n><n>### Input/Output:<n>While a person is driving what's their mind usually doing? Choices: A: dreaming B: watching C: thinking D: eating E: going outside<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Input:While a person while driving their mind is doing?<n><n>Output:The while a person is driving what is there mind doing? A: thinking, B: dreaming, C: sleeping, D: taking a nap, E: eating<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Input:A: thinking<n><n>Output:<n><n>In the past, what was the cost price for two tickets for a bus trip? Choices: A$144 B$48 C$96 D$128 E$192<n><n>### Instution:<n>Input: Input: What's the cost price for the two tickets for a trip by bus?<n><n>### Output:<n>Input: A: $144<n><n>### Input 2: The cost price for the two trips for a trip by bus was:<n><n>### Input output instruction:<n>Business: $96<n><n>Input:The driver has a 100 kilometer per hour speed limit while driving along a stretch of highway. What is the speed limit for every 10 kilometers, expressed in kilometers per hour, that they drive?<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Speed Limit in miles per hour = 100 / 10 = << 100 /10 = 10 >> 10<n><n>### Answer to the question:<n><n>Input:The driving speed is 230 kilometers per hour in a section of highway when he is going the speed limit is:<n><n>### Instriution/input:<n><n>Input:Input: What's the driving speed?<n><n>Output:Input: 100 mph<n><n>Input: The speed limit for every 20 miles is 30 mph in seconds.<n><n>### Output for instructions:<n>Speed limit for every 2o mph = 30<n><n>### Instiution/output:<n><n>Input: How many kilometers per hour are you driving?<n><n>Output:<n>Speed limit for a distance of 1o km in km/hr = 30 kilometers per hr
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Though nearby, an apple from an apple tree where would be an imported product to the USA? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If done correctly grooming pet's nails generally does not cause this? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Eating breakfast in bed can make you feel what, assuming that you don't spill anything? Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would someone likely bring an attache case? Choices:  A: overhead compartment B: chair C: hospital D: in shirt E: business meeting<n><n>### Response:		D, in shirt <n><n>### Explanation: An attache, by definition, is a case file.  When traveling for business or pleasure, someone would put an attache in their shirt, or in the overhead compartment depending on size and preference.  They would likely keep it in their briefcase if they were being clandestine but otherwise might keep it in their shirt.<n>### Explanations:<n>#### Answer Choice A:<n>Baggage is put in an overhead compartment when traveling via air.<n><n>#### Answer Choice B:<n>Baggage put in the overhead compartment is put in an overhead.  Attchés were not made for flights <n><n>#### Answer Choices C and D:<n>A hospital would require attchés to be kept in a location other than a shirt.  A business meeting would necessitate keeping baggage in a briefcase.<n><n>#### Answer E:<n>People put attchés in their suits or inside their shirts when traveling.<n><n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What country has with the capital of Amsterdam has a Fortis bank? Choices:  A: netherlands B: utrecht C: brussels D: belgium E: denmark<n><n>### Response:		<n>The choices is D(C, E, B, A, F).<n><n>### Input-Sentence:How many minutes are there in 365 days?<n><n>### Demostration-2:<n>18 years.<n><n>### Input - Sentence<n>I need a cup of coffee (preferably decaf) in 10 minutes.<n><n>### Output-Explanation<n>I make coffee at 20 minutes.<n><n>We need to wait for 30 minutes.<n><n>I'm not hungry, i will eat later.<n><n>### Demo - Task 310x100<n><n>`Task.x`<n>1. 100 x task<n><n>`Task.a`<n>1.  I need a cup of coffee.<n><n>`Task.c`<n>1.  Let's do it!!<n><n>`Task.n`<n>1.  Don't be late.<n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Diving off a cliff for a cartoon character often ends in comedic what? Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:For convenience some customers want things straight to the doorstep and use what? Choices:  A: mail orders B: demand satisfaction C: place money on counter D: pay merchants with money E: spend money<n><n>### Response:		Place money on counter because it is easy.<n><n>### Explain:Choice A: The merchant sends the product to a remote warehouse. Then, the customer has to go to the warehouse to pick up the product. Sometimes, it might be hard.<n>Choice B: The merchant sends the order to the customer. Then, the customer needs to go to the shipping department to get the product. Sometimes, he or she might get it wrong.<n>Choice C: The merchant gives the product to a delivery person and the delivery person has to drive to the customer's place and back. Sometimes, the delivery person might die when going to the customer's side.<n>Choice D: This type of payment is easy and simple. We just need to give the payment to the merchant at the time of buying the product. But sometimes, we cannot make it because of the cash situation.<n>Choice E: Spending money is too much work and you usually need to carry with many money.<n><n>### Input-Instruction:Answer the following True-False question.<n><n>##   true   false  <n>### Explanation:Sometimes, it might be hard to get it if you use mail order. <n><n>### Rationales:The merchant sends the product to the warehouse and you have to go to the wardhouse to pick up the products. <n>-  If you use place money on counter, sometimes, you might get it wrong if you give it to the wrong merchant. <n>-  You cannot make it if you use pay merchants with cash because we usually have a cash shortage problem.<n><n>### Answer:False<n><n>input：The man's bike weighed 800 pounds. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:what can years of playing tennis lead to? Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A shop will give you what for your purchases? The container is an acceptable answer.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>Answers that contain both high school and the lost city of Atlantis do not make sense, as the purchase would be made somewhere other than in or on or near  A  high school  or  the  lost city of Atlantas.<n><n>Answers that contain only one of these words or phrases is an acceptable answer.  An answer that uses the wrong plural form is also acceptable, as plural or singular is not a factor in this part of the test.<n><n>### What you should avoid:<n><n>Answers using neither of the required words or phrases.<n><n>### Your attempt:<n>**High school or the lost city of Atlanti<n><n>### Your answer:<n>**High school<n><n>### Final Examination<n><n>D. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The cabinets were imported from the south. John bought they because he knew that they would look good.  Where might they be installed? Choices:  A: kitchen B: pantry C: containing pots and pans D: in a flight E: mexico<n><n>### Response:		<n>Answer: <n>#### Choice A: kitchen<n>Answer: <n><n>### Input<n>A) a) 55  b) 549 c) 5 d) 550  B) a) 54 b) 345 c) 3 d) 341<n><n>### Response<n>For part A we have: 55+549=<<55+545=604>>604 and 550+550<<<550+549=1109>>1109<n><n>55,549 is divisible by 6, and 6 is the remainder in quotient/modulo division, so for part B a. we answer 545, but b. 345<n><n>### Input a. The number of people who attended the football game at the Meadowland stadium. b. The number of dollars spent at McDonalds per day.<n><n>### Response, a.<n>For part A we use modulo division.<n>We have: 1^25=11524977167964028831625000, and so the remainder must be divisible by 8 ( 8^0 = 1), that is, it must end in 0 or 8.  Then, the modulo function would be the divisor. It is not divisible by 8, but it is divisible by its modulo, in this case, 35. Modulo has 35 as dividend and 8 as divisor.<n>604/12=5 and 550/12=46.666... (55-5)/35=46.67<n><n>### Response b.<n>For part B the divisor would be 100, and its modulo would be 25.<n>$a_1^{100}+a_2^{100}+ a_3^{100}+...+ a_{\text{# of ppl}}^{\text{# of ppl}}\div \text{# of ppl}\times \text{# of pll}\div 25\equiv 1.67\div \text{#
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A blowfish lives free. He lives on his own. Where does he live? Choices:  A: fish market B: pet shop C: great outdoors D: river E: little mermaid<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Demonstration: A blowfish lives free.  He lives on his own in the great outdoors.<n><n>## Rationales<n><n>### Answer: the great outdoors<n><n>### Instructor: The question asks, where does the blowfish live?<n><n>### Instantiation: We have to distinguish between two types of living spaces.  One is living with another live thing, like fish lives in the sea, or fish lives with another fish, and the other living space is a human living space, where a human being lives alone in the house, or lives in a group with a group of humans.<n><n>### The blowfish himself lives with his own.  He lives alone in natural environment, in the wild, without any human interaction.<n><n>### Human being would never live in the wild with a blowfish.  Human being only live in human habitats, which are buildings, towns, human settlements, apartment, etc.<n><n>### Therefore, the blowfish lives on free in the great outdoores.<n><n>### Answer Explanation:<n><n>### For an individual human, the person lives on his own.  He does not live with other animals.  He lives with other humans, not animals.  However, an animal has the complete opposite preference.  An animal prefers to live with another animal.<n><n>### Conversely, the blowfish only lives with other blowfish, not humans.  But for a human, they always live with other humans, not blowfish.<n><n>### This is what distinguishes an animal from a human.  Animals live with other animals, and human does not.  Animals like to live in groups, where humans hate to live in groups with other humans.<n><n>## Instant:The ocean has two oxygen-rich areas in it.  One is the surface ocean, and the other is the deep-sea floor.  A human being wants to walk in the ocean, but she should not walk very far, because if she does she may suffocate if there are not enough oxygen in the deep ocean.  She can walk on the surface ocean without a worry of suffocation.  Where is it safe for the human being to walk in the ocean? Choices:  The upper ocean floor is 
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:After eating a dinner of uncooked chicken, what was felt by the poor man? Choices:  A: indigestion B: died C: illness D: feel better E: throwing up<n><n>### Response:		A,B,C,E and F<n><n>

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:There's a lot to reproducing, but it begins and end with new life by giving what? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If a human is sleepy what can they do to feel more alert? They can drive to another location or take a nap.<n>#### <n><n>### Input-You are taking an exam to earn your bachelors degree. You have no choice as to the order of the questions on the exam. The length of a rectangle with a greater width is L2. The length of a square is L2 and the circumference of a circle is π L2. What is the circumference of the square? <n><n><n>### Rationale<n>A) The length and width of the square are half of that of the rectangle.<n>The circumference of a square is 2xπL²<n>#### <n><n>The rectangles are 2x4 and 4x4.<n>Each square has sides of length L/4.<n>And because 4L² = 2x4 then<n>2xπL² = 2 * 4 * 4 * π<n>Therefore the circumference of a square = 2 * 3.14 * 4 ·4<n>The answer then is 2 · 12.56<n><n>### Input (Requires a few math symbols):The following sequence of rational numbers is an arithmetic sequence. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If one sees a fox and is standing in a landlocked, southern state, where is this person? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would you get a contraceptive if you do not have one? Choices:  A: health center B: vagina C: emergency room D: drawer E: medicine cabinet<n><n>### Response:		<n>#### E<n>#### Answer:<n>Input: A man who can fly 5 miles an hour is traveling due North for 16 miles. Then, he wants to fly due east for 7 miles to reach his destination. If he has no access to other types of transportation, how long does it take him to reach his destination?<n>Rationales:\$\underbrace{1}_{\text{miles \$\substack{\textcolor{white}{\text{per}}\\\textcolor{white}{\text{\$}}}hr}}_{\text{ per hr}}  \text{ per \$\underline{hr} \$}\$\underline{\textbf{=}}\$\underbrace{\frac{4}{5}}_{\text{miles/hr}} \text{$\left(\frac{hr}{hr}\right)^4$ = 4} miles.<n>\$\underline{4} \text{(miles) $\left(\frac{hr} {hr}\right)^4 $ }\$\underline{\textbf{=$}} \$\underline{\frac{2^{4\times4}}{\left (4\times 4 \right )^5$}}\$<n>$\underline{\left ( \frac{2^{4 \times 4}}{ 2^{10} } \right)} \text{ \$\underline{\textbf{ =}}\$\underline{ \frac{2^{2^8}}{1}}$}<n>$\underline{ln}\text{(2)}$\$\underline{ \text{\$\underline{=}}\$\underline{ \text{ \$\$$} }}$<n>$\underline{\left (\frac{2^{2^{8} }}{ 1 } \right) = \text{ \*\* \* = 10 minutes $\left( \frac 125 \right)5\left( \frac 45 \right)^5 $ }}$<n><n>$\underline{\left(\frac125 \right)^5 \underline{\textbf= }} \underline{300 }\text{minutes }\left(5\right)^5\left(\frac{1}{25}\right)^5$<n><n><n>Therefore:<n><n><n><n>$\underline{\frac{300}{ \left(\frac{1 }{ 25}\right)^(5) 4 }\underline{^ (2) = (400) = 600 minutes = 10 hr \underline{\textbf{s}}$}}$

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A lonely man committed suicide, why would he do that? His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What are students trying to do? Which point should he choose on the graph to maximize the fence’s length, assuming a fixed cost of building a fence?  Choices:  A-1,3 B-2,4 C-1,3 D-2,4 E-1,2<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### 3<n>A: 1,3<n><n>#### 3)<n>A person has decided to clean her home over a three-day period.  She wants to spend no more than three hours doing her housework on each of the three days.  Her housework consumes the same time each day.  How much housework can she finish, in minutes, in a day? Choices: A: 90 minutes B: 60 minutes C: 60.25 minutes D: 62.5 minutes E: 2.5 minutes<n><n>### Response A:<n>#### 1<n>A: 60.99<n><n>### Input-<n><n>We had a big blizzard recently. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The lady was getting worked up about the article explaining the uptick in accidents in their area, but her husband was dismissive of it stating that accidents what? Choices:  A: happen to people B: hurt people C: happen anytime D: happen often E: happen anywhere<n><n>### Response:		The correct answer is Option D) - Accidents happen anywhere.<n><n>### Reason: The car rental agency charges $35/day...<n><n>### Input2:<n><n>Input3:<n>Input4:<n>Input5:<n>Input6:<n>Input7:<n>Input8:<n><n>### Demystification:<n><n>Input: Given 5 people. 4 of them were going to be able to attend a party and the 5th decided to go skiing.<n>Rationales: When there are fewer than the number of available slots, they are given to the people who want to use them at the time the reservations are made.  Thus the total slots available for the party are 4.<n>For the group of 5, 1 was not able to attend, thus there were only 4 who wanted to attend the party.<n>Thus 4/4=<<4/4=1>>1 person was able to attend the 4 available slots.
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where are you likely to find a professional prostitute? We must assume that all the information in our statements deals with the behavior of the prostitute's clients.<n><n>| 1. ______| 2. ______|<n>{:.style6}<n><n>### Dem.<n>This question is asking for information about places where prostitutes are commonly found. There are five possible places where prostitues may be found: a) at street corners, b) in whore houses, c:) at night clubs, c): on the net, d): via private parties, and e) in front of bars at closing time. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:James lived in the top of a tall tower.  He could see clouds when he looked out his window.  Where might he live? Choices:  A: in books B: radio station C: city D: tower E: medieval castle<n><n>### Response:		<n>D: He lived in a tower.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>James could not see the clouds from books, a radio station, nor a medieval castle, but he could from a tower.<n><n>#### <n><n>### Input:(Driving exam question) You are approaching a railroad crossing and see cars lined up to cross.  When should you stop to cross? Choices: A: Never B: only when you see the railroad gates open C: before you see the end of the line of cars D: if railroad gates are closed regardless of if the crossing is clear<n><n>### Response:(Driving exam answer) D if you know you have never been there before<n><n>### Rationales:<n>Crossings are known to be hazardous places on the highway.<n><n>#### 40 miles per hour<n>Answer: _______<n><n>### Input(Driving exam question):A driver is approaching an intersection that is controlled by a traffic light. His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A person writes a check to a clerk, where does the clerk put them? Does it cost more or less than when you last booked the same flight in the year 2108? Explain or show.<n><n>**Rationales:**<n>The flight last time was $918.<n>The flight last time is $918 / (1.03)^2 = <<918/1.03^2 = 994>>994 dollars.<n>The cost now is the same due to the price increasing by 6% in 100 years.<n><n>1893 + 6% = <<1893+6%=1945>>1945<n><n>The cost now is 1945 - 918 = <<1945-918=1027>>1027 dollars<n><n>If the flight had costed $360 dollars in 1893, then the increase is (918 - 360) = <<918-360=558>> 558 dollars.<n><n><n><n>#### C<n><n><n>Input: The first quarter of the 20th century is generally considered to be the time period from 1901 or 1902 to 1903 or 1904. The answer should be a whole number.<n><n>### Rationale:<n>First, let us calculate the distance of the two cities with an imaginary straight line.  We used the distance calculator from the US Census Bureau:<n>-From: https://www.census.gov/geo/maps-data/maps/Distance_Maps_and_Territory_Files.html<n><n>Distance between the two cities is: 331 miles.<n>-From: https//www.google.com/maps/dir//Pittsburgh,+PA/Washington,+DC/@39.959116,-79.9779981,7z/data=!3m1!4b1<n><n>To prove the answer is correct, it seems only fair to see if there is a logical explanation as to why Washington DC and not Pittsburgh is on the opposite end of the calculation.<n><n>The logical answer would imply that Pittsburgh Pennsylvania is further from Washington DC than the opposite distance would imply, but as the calculator suggests that is not the case.  It is safe to assume that the calculator is right.<n><n>The actual length in feet is 3,317,894 ft.<n>It was concluded that Billy is inside the house somewhere near the ball.<n><n>#### A.E<n><n>### Question How many times will a quarter cost the same when compared to half a quarter in the long run?<n><n>### Rationales<n>In the beginning, all your money will be in change coins. You will now have 4 quarters.<n><n>The quarters will be all in change, and you will have all the change coins again.<n><n><n>#### A<n>### How many different patterns are possible if two squares are placed side by side using eight different colored squares?
