Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Turkey is a nation in what part of the world? Choices:  A: middle east B: asia minor C: asia D: provide meat E: balkan peninsula<n><n>### Response:		D: Meat<n><n>### Demographics for Turkey.<n><n>#### The geographic region including most of Turkey in southwestern Asia, stretching from the Aegean Sea to the Euphrates River. <n><n>#### This general region is now called modern Turkey and is divided into:<n>A. Eastern Anatolia (the extreme southeastern part of the country)<n>B. Middle Anatolia (central Turkey including the provinces of Ankara and Adana)<n>C. Mediterranean Turkey (the coastal provinces on the Mediterranean from Izmir to Antalya)<n>D. Aegean Turkey (the extreme western parts of the country, from Izmir to Istanbul)<n><n>### Demographic info for Turkey.<n><n>```<n>Turkey is a country in southwestern Asia<n><n>Turkey has 79,7900 sq. km.<n><n>Turkey is bordered by Bulgaria, Greece, Georgia, Armenia, Syria, Iraq, Iran, and Azerbaijan<n>```
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Johnny and bill fought over money.  Johnny wanted it to be over.  What might he choose to do? Choices:  A: control people B: settle everything C: buy food D: increase power E: kill bill<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  A and B<n>#### <n><n>### Input <n>What was the first capital of the United States?<n>####<n>### Instruction<n>Write about this topic or these topics. Do not write outside of the provided lines.  Your response should have six or more complete sentences.<n>Your response should have one or more correctly placed and used parentheses.<n><n>### Response<n>Liberty.  No it was Philidelphia.<n><n>### Input<n>What might you use if you wanted to find out how much you would be paying to rent a car for 3 days if you had a week long rental? Choices:  rental charge A: rent for a week in advance B: rent for extra days C: pay in advance D: charge each day E: pay for the whole trip<n><n>### Response <n>D, E, C, A, B<n><n>### Instructions:Answer the following multiple-choice questions.<n>### Demonstation:<n>Input: If the cost for renting a car is $36 per day, how much, in dollars, will it cost for rent a car for two full days that lasts three days?<n>Rationales:(1 day times 36, then times 2) 36(2)(2)==36*2*2==72==<answer>72<n>#### 72<n>Answer: 72<n><n>Input: Suppose there was a 4-day rental rate of $280, and a 7-day rental rate also at $280. Suppose 5 days were rented in the same week.  How much, in dollars was paid for the week?<n>Rationales(5 * 4 or 5 *20 = 110) 110<n>#### 110<n>Answer:110<n><n>### Instuctions:<n><n>Input: Jennie rented a bicycle to use for biking to school for $12 for the first month. The next month's fee is $10.  Which choice best shows how much she must pay altogether (not per month) if she rents the bicycle for 2 months when the discount is applied?<n>### Demonstation Input: 3 * 4 = 12<n>### Demonstraion Input

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What European country is famous for its potato industry? If you look on a globe you will find a continent which is the _USA,_ which is the country. You will see Idaho there. Its in the northwest part of the country if you take a look on a map its right next to nevada.

The pigeon, initially traveling at 35m/s reaches the ground 20 seconds after it was released. If it took 270 seconds to return to the point of release, how long is the pigeon in flight during the complete looped path?<n><n>### Rationales<n>#### 110<n>Answer:110<n><n>####270<n>Answer:270/2=<<270/2 = 135>>135<n><n>####8<n>Response: A pigeon released from rest 120 meters above the ground will travel to the ground in parabola flight.<n>The parabola is a U-shaped curve that looks like this: [image]<n>The blue part of the curve is the "up-" portion of the parabola, and the red part is the downward "y" component.<n>To find the total distance (in meters) that it will take to go from the start location (120 m) to the finish, we multiply the total flight time by the speed at which it travels (at its peak velocity).<n>Distance = Time x Velocity<n>Distance = (2900/135) x (1.9 x 10^3)<n>Distance = (2.23) x

How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The new kitten hadn't gotten used to what it was allowed to climb on in most rooms, so the owned kept the bedroom door what? Choices:  A: opened B: closed C: found at shower D: falling down E: locked<n><n>### Response:		C,<n><n>### Input:"Rent was raised by 2.5% from last month.  How many dollars can the new rent be for your two-room apartment?"<n><n>### Response:"32.38"<n><n>The rent is $323.80 after it increased 2.5% (0.025)<n><n>### Input:::The owner's 2-room house was inspected and found to be safe by the landlord and was awarded a 33% discount on the insurance for the next year.  How much was deducted from the last year's bill when it was presented?"<n><n>### Input:[9-(3/2)]-[8-(1/2)]-[7-(5/2)]-[6-(3/2)]<n><n>### Response:[0, -1, -3/2, -5/2]<n><n>### Input:(7(2) + 9(4) + 9(9) + 2(1) = 1156 ) - (4(2) + 1(3) + 3(1) = 64 ) = 1092<n><n>### Input:#{3*3}= 3^2 and #{3^4-3^2}= [#12^4*3](7-4) + [#12^3*3](7-3) + [#1*(3)]= [72^4](3) + [71^3](4) + [41](3) = 478<n><n>### Input[12*(2+4+5+6+7+8+9+10+11+12)]*67= 777<n>### Instruction:[12*(2+1+2+3+4+5+5+6+6+7+7+8+8+9+9+10)+300]+2*2= 777
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do you keep a teakettle? Choices:  A: cupboard B: countertop C: water D: hardware department E: england<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>E<n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The disease was spreading fast, so what were researchers desperately seeking? Choices:  A: cause spots on leaf B: healthy C: wellness D: ball stopped E: cure<n><n>### Response:		In 1637, the first recorded outbreak of Dutch elm (disease) occured in the Netherlands<n><n>### Rationale: The disease was spreading fast what were researchers desparately searching for. A: the cause of the disease<n>B: wellness<n>C: the cure<n>D: the wellness<n>E: the cause<n><n>>Note: The cure of the disease A (Dutch elm disease) was discovered in 1995. Thus, 1637 was before the cure of the disease.<n><n>----<n><n>To write a response or create an instruction the task must have all 5 following key details<n><n>```<n>input<n><n>rationales<n>question and answer.<n>input <n>question and answer<n>rationales<n>```<n><n>### Reference<n><n>[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Airbnb](https://en.wikipediaorg/wiki/Airmndy.bnb)<n><n>[https://www.airmndy.co/](https://www.airmdy.co/)<n>

Open file called "instructions"<n>2. Open file call "response.txt"<n>3. Copy code below<n>4. Move cursor to end of line (Ctl-V does it fast!)<n>5. Paste input in to response.txt (above) as shown<n>6. Save response.txt as.bak<n>7. Save instructions.txt<n>8. Save response.txt<n><n>### How to read your solution:<n>1. Open both instructions and response (in the same window) and scroll until the end of file (Alt-F11 will do it. Right-click then scroll to end)<n>2. Compare the values of response, instructions, and line 2<n>3. In your response, change values of the line at the end and save. Repeat this for each line with  ">" overlaid on top. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The wheel was loose, and threatened to fall off when they were what? Choices:  A: footloose B: sailing C: fast D: tighten E: bind<n><n>### Response:		Choices:  <n>A: A  footloose<n>The wheel was loose,<n>                             but threatened to fall off<n>                             when traveling at highway ranging<n><n>B;A sailing<n>                                The wheel was loose,<n>but threatened to fall off when traveling at a high velocity.<n><n>C: A tighten<n>The wheel was loose and threatened to fall off.<n>                We tightened the wheel's bolt securely.<n><n>D: A bind<n>But a tighten wheel, is not an option.<n><n>E: A tighten<n>So as to prevent the wheel from falling off.<n><n>

Choices: A: 25% C:22.5% E: 15% B: 21.9% B: 19% D:22.5%.<n><n>### 1. What is the answer to the problem given below? Choices: 1:14 2:15 3:16 4:17 5:18<n><n>### Answer: 5<n><n>### Input<n><n><n>### Instructions<n>Write a response that appropriately continues the task.<n><n>### Input A:What is the answer to the following equation?<n><n>A:  (x-3)+ (x-1)=x+1<n><n>### Answer<n><n>Answer: 1<n><n>### Input B:<n><n><n>### Answer B:<n><n><n>What is the answer to following equation?<n><n>  A: (x-1)(x-2)=1*2<n><n>Answer: 0<n><n><n>### <n><n>### Instructon:<n><n><n>##<n><n>## Input<n>A: 3/(2a-5)+2a=8<n><n><n>## Answer A:<n>8/[4(a-3)]=8/a-6<n><n><n><n>## Input<n><n>## Instructions:<n><n>Below is an instruction that describes an instruction.<n><n>## Task:<n><n>## Input:<n>D: (2-3)/4=4<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a place where you usually store dishes but not books? Choices:  A: apartment B: pantry C: table D: living room E: shelf<n><n>### Response:		A: apartment<n><n>### Instructions: For each problem shown below that has incomplete instructions, provide a task description to appropriately begin the task.<n><n>Instructions: Below is a multiple choice question and a rationale for your response. Diagrams can be created using flow charting and mind mapping tools. These tools are available for download for free on the internet, in addition to being available as apps for smartphone and tablets. The diagram you create will be evaluated to determine the correct completing of the task. The diagrams will be evaluated for the appropriate task description and the correct problem solution.<n><n>### Example:<n>Input: You are in the bookstore where the computer section is located. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Parents often yell in times of chaos, what are they trying to do? By the time the sales tax went into effect, the price of the car had increased to $28,000.  The sales tax rate is 5.5 percent.  What amount of new tax dollars came out of your account as a result of this sales tax. Round the answer to the nearest dollar.<n>### Rationales: For every $1.00 spent, a buyer pays $1.05.  When a tax of 5.5% is added to the cost of a purchase, it is equal to 5.5% of a product's selling price, regardless of how much that product costs.<n>Therefore we multiply the selling price by the tax rate in order to get the amount of tax.<n>Because $28,080. 50=$28080.50=>$25,005  * 0.055 = 1426.25 dollars.<n>###<n>#### Answer<n><n>Answer: 1426<n><n>### Instraction:Answer the following multiple-choice question.<n><n>## Instuction:The price of a brand-new car was $29,000. After the sales tax went into  effect, the price of a car increased to $29,100. The sales tax rate is $0.63 per $100. For each $1.00, a buyer pays an additional $0.063. How much additional tax was paid after the new price was enacted?<n>## Solution:1) When an item costs $1.00 the tax is $0.60 so the cost is $1.60<n><n>```<n>2)$29000*(1-0.2)=$8600<n>3)$8600*1.063= $8938.18<n>4) Therefore, $8938 + $8938 = $166,976.16<n>```<n><n>#### Answer:<n>Answer:1

Where might it be? Choices:  A: new york B: big city C: town D: idaho E: shopping mall<n><n>### Response:		<n>If a, then not b.<n>If b, then not c.<n>If c, then not d.<n>If d, then not e.<n>If e, then b.<n>If not a, then not b,<n>If b, not a not b.<n>If not d, then not e..<n>e<n><n>### Input : How much longer for a 12 ft.by 12 ft. deck?  Choices:  A.6.B.4.C.9.D.8.E.11.F.14<n><n>### Response :<n>If E then B,A,C,D<n><n>If E then not A,B,C,D<n>If B then not C<n><n>If C then A<n>If C then D<n><n>If B then not D,E<n><n>If B then D<n><n>#### 6<n>Answer : 6<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Answer all of the question.<n><n>## What was going through your mind? What do you think was going through other people’s minds?.<n><n>- It is obvious that I used the if else function. I used the if else also to check the answer with the question but not used for if else if<n>- At first, what was going through my mind was if a then b and so I was testing first by giving the function a and after giving the same value to b.<n>- If A then B (in my case it would be the question to answer) I would start off with a if statement to determine which if else function to use.<n>- I also wanted to see what would happen if I did not use if else if so I tested and it had a return value of the first statement in its if function.<n>- I also noticed that if you use if else if for all statements then it just keeps going in a "do while" loop and this is because the if function does not go through the function after the answer is determined and that the question has multiple answers and none of it is "a"<n>- The last thing I noticed is that the if else if's will only get called if the answer is not b and that is the last variable that gets tested so if a,b then that function will fire and so forth.<n><n>## Explain your rationale and why the results were correct or incorrect.<n>**Correct**<n>**1.** - I knew that
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:John is studying animals.   What is one of the many things he has to watch them doing? Choices:  A: bathe B: bite C: die of cancer D: obesity E: copulate<n><n>### Response:		E<n><n>#### Reasoning: He need to pay close attention on his studies.<n><n>### Input 5 animals live in the zoo. How many animals live in the zoo (if you count the elephants as animals, then four, then three,...)? Choices:  A-> zero B-> one C-> three D->four E->five<n>

Choices:  A: snoring B: talking C: get cold D: nothing E: might dream<n><n>### Response:		<n>B<n><n>### Demostration:<n>In order to snore, you have to inhale oxygen into the lungs.<n>In order to talk in your sleep you need to breathe.<n>If you are not breathing, you cannot snore, talk or dream.<n><n>### Scope:<n>1. When you are sleeping you breathe.<n>1. When you breathe you can snore.<n>1. When snoring you may dream.<n>1. But to dream you have to be breathing.<n>1. To be breathing you have to be snoring.<n>1. To snore you have to be breathning.<n>1. To breathe you have to be snorting.<n>1. But you can snort without breathing.<n>####<n><n>### SCOPED<n>When you are snoring you may dream<n>#### When you are snoring you cannot breathe.<n>### SOLVED?<n>In order to snoring you need to be breathing if you are sleeping and when you are breathing if you are snoring then you can dream.<n><n>## Input:<n>What percentage of all the earth's land area is covered by water?<n><n>### Demos:<n>Let's say there's 8 billion people in the world.<n>The world's land area is about 117,623,237,013 square miles.<n>8 billion people is about 1,176,232,370,000 people.<n>Therefore, about 7.42097155806451% of the world's land area has people on it.<n><n>### 7.42<n><n>### SOLUTION:<n>We know that 8 billion people live on the earth. This is true since in 2011 the population hit a peak.<n><n>We also know there is 7,554,098 sq km of land area in the continental US and there are about 320,000,000 of us in the US. Or 44.30583732 square meters per person.<n><n>However, the US only has about 2% of the world' population.<n>

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:If I take my heifer out East, where's a place we might end up? Choices:  A: new hampshire B: dairy farm C: farm field D: texas E: county fair<n><n>### Response:		<n>A(new hampshire) is the word, but not the rest are the options<n><n>### Rationales:<n>- A: new hampsire<n>- B: dairy farm<n>- C: farm field<n>- D: texas<n>- E: county fair<n>- "Out east" is not a location.<n>- The farmer is not asking about a location to house his cow, but instead about a potential destination for a market-ready cow.<n>- The farmers asks "Where is a place we might end if/when I take my heifer to be butchered."<n>- He is not currently considering whether to butcher the cow, just whether there are places they can go where they can get a good price for the cow.<n>- He is aware of dairy farms (B), which milk cows, farm fields (C), where they grow crops for feed and fodder, county fairs (E), where they can sell the cow, and ranching areas (D).<n>- Butcher (A) is not an option. It is uncommon for farmers to butcher their cattle. That is typically handled at a central slaughterhouse operation.<n>#### A<n>Answer: new hampshire<n><n>### Input:"How many cows on average do you think you'll sell over the course of the year?"<n><n>### Rationale:<n>The question is ambiguous. Choices: A: 0.1 B: 5/16 C: 0.25 D: 5/1  <n>E: 1/5<n><n>Rationales:  The probability of getting no 6'<n>`= 3/6*(1-5/6)*(1-5/6)=0.125`<n><n><n>Answer: Input::6 sided die with 6 numbers. There are 5 faces of numbers 2,3,4,5,6 respectively.<n>And 3/6 of the six are 2.<n>1-(1/6)X1/6=3/6-1/6=3*1/6=33 33/66. <n><n>###  Input: What country's name is the highest above the ground? Choices:  C: Argentina D: Chile E: Peru F: Maldives G: Bahamas<n><n>### Input2:: C <n>Answer: D<n><n>### Input3:: D E F G<n>Answer: B<n><n><n>### I have a question for my teacher<n>Input: You have 5 green cards, 5 yellow cards, 3 blue cars, and 2 red cars. What is the probability of getting all green cards or all yellow cards, given that the player will draw 5 cards?  Rationales:  All Green cards:  Green cards=3*(52)<n>3 of 12 are green, thus 12-3=<<12-3
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A government seeks what over it's people? Choices:  A: country B: trouble C: city D: sun E: control<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The people wanted to take the scenic route, they chose the highway that cut through the what? Choices:  A: countryside B: united states C: beach D: atlas E: developed land<n><n>### Response:		The people wanted to take the *highway* that cut through the atlas.<n><n>### Rationale:  The scenic route is the *highway* (in B) that cuts through the atlas.  You can *take* the *highway* using an automobile, which is the *highway.*  It is not a direct response, but the other alternatives are not in line with the question.<n><n>## Output:<n><n>### Instructions:<n>Your response should be at least four sentences long.<n>Remember that a complete sentence consists of a subject and a predicate.  A predicate is a group of words that contains a verb.<n>A complete sentence does NOT have to use the words subject and predicate.<n>If you include a phrase in your response, it will be a compound sentence.  A compound sentence is a complete sentence that has a coordinate conjunction (for, and, nor, but, or, yet, so) and two simple sentences.<n><n>### Concord:<n><n>* Conjunction:<n>  * For (subordinating)<n>* Correlative:<n>  * For, and, but, or, nor<n>* Preposition<n>  * -ing : verbal nouns<n>

Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would there be a connection to go to another place? Choices:  A: wires B: electrical circuit C: computer network D: wall E: freeway<n><n>### Response:		<n>If a person wants to go to another place, they need to enter into a connection. In order to get into that connection, they need a wire.<n><n>### Explanation:<n><n>#### Correct:<n>To go to another place, a wire is needed. The choice that is correct is A, since it says where wires are found.<n><n>#### No:<n>To go from one house to another house would be through a computer network. There may be a connection into the next house, but it would be through the computer network<n><n>#### No: <n>To get onto an expressway or a freeway, there may be a connection, but in order to get onto the expressway, you need to go through an electrical circuit that is in a wire.<n>

C: georgia. <n><n>## Exercise<n><n>What are the similarities and differences between the following three programs in response to the same input?<n><n>```python<n>2.input = "hello"<n>3.input = "hello there"<n>4.if (input == "hello") input = "hellooo"<n>5.if (input == 'hello') input = 'helloo'<n>```<n><n>### Instructions<n><n>*In addition to the two responses provided below, you must write three more complete responses. (You do not need to identify any more differences, just explain the additional differences and similarities. <n><n>## Acknowledgements<n><n>*Thanks to Professor B., who wrote the lesson on the course forum.*<n><n>## Notes<n>*I am unable to write a response to the second line of the text that follows. The text below is:<n><n>
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where can someone purchase a contraceptive device without a prescription? Choices:  A: pharmacy B: person C: drugstore D: bedroom E: mcdonalds<n><n>### Response:		<n>There wasn't anything to answer.<n><n>### Input<n>A person purchases a small toy for 80 pesos and, for only one cent, can return the toy if unhappy or choose instead to donate the toy to a child who needed it more. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where would people be looking at some things which can move, but are not moving? Choices:  A: football stadium B: surface of earth C: car show D: opera E: movie<n><n>### Response:		<n>If something is already moving, it can't be moving.<n>If something is already at rest, it can't start moving.<n>### Answer: A<n><n>### Input<n>In a certain country it is customary for women to walk on their left side, facing all the traffic; in another, men go the other way.  During one year the traffic is in some country is always going in the same direction.  Countries switch over between the two ways of traveling throughout the course of the year.  Which way would people walking in that country be most likely to be walking during the summer months?  Give your answer as a single digit, where that digit has no meaning beyond indicating a choice between two options.<n><n>### Response<n><n>If the traffic always goes in the same direction, at some time the people traveling there will all have switched over.<n>Then, the people traveling there all have to be going in the same way.  That either way will have to be the same way.<n>### Answer<n><n>In the summertime, people are on vacation, and probably walking more than when they have to be at work (this may not be true for everyone, but it is true in general).<n>In the summer months, everyone is going to be traveling on the same side.  If they are going somewhere they do not want to be, they will be walking on their wrong side.<n>This is going to be on the "right" side, the direction of traffic - the left side of the road.<n>#### 1<n>Answer: 1<n><n>## Task 3<n><n>### Instructions:Fill in the blanks in the following incomplete sentence.<n>To keep _____________, the owner of the grocery store placed a piece of a newspaper on the floor to discourage people from shopping on Sunday.<n><n>### Answers:<n><n>To keep his store closed on Sunday.<n><n>The owner of the grocety store place a piece of a newspaper in the shop. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do  you park in the parking lot with shopping bags? They sat in the<n>middle of one row, and all of them sat next to each other without<n>any empty spots around them.<n><n>#### Answer:Five boys and four girls<n><n>### Rationale:The total number of people is 9. Since each row only<n>has one person on it, we know it must be an odd number. The boys<n>can only have an odd number if four of them had the seats, but that<n>would indicate that one member of each group is missing. Since this<n>doesn't make sense, that leaves the girls with four seats.<n><n>## Task 3<n><n>### Input <n>The number of _____ the store received was 47% more than the number of _____.<n><n>### Raison: more than <n>

They cost $8.95. each, and are priced as follows:<n><n>Small: $8.95 Large: $15.95 Extra large: $18.95 Extra extra large: $19.95<n><n>#### For what prices do the three pizza sizes combine?<n><n>#### For how many hours does each of the pizza sizes stay hot before it must be replaced?<n><n>#### How much revenue, in dollars, does the pizza shop earn on each size pizza?<n><n>#### How many small pizzas must be sold to make as much money as an extra extra large pizza?<n><n>### Solution<n><n>Pizza cost $8.99 Extra large $18.99 Exta extra large $19.99 Extra extra Large $19.98 Small $2.40 Large $9.99 Exta large $15.99 Extra Extra large, $9.99<n><n>#### Revenue $8.99 +$8.99 + $15.98 +$19.98 +$2.40 = $12.96<n><n>#### 81:1<n><n>1. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:I need a person to milk a cow would a volunteer do this? Choices:  A: cross street B: milk cow C: lose weight D: step forward E: need food<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>B: milk cow<n><n>### Rationale:<n><n>I need someone to milk the cow.<n><n>### Choices: A: cross street, B: milk cow, C: lose weight, D: step forward, E: need food.<n><n>### Answer:<n><n>-B: milk cow<n>

She is also charged an additional $8 for each day when she stays beyond the one-week limit. How much, in Dollars, does a renter pay at the end of a one-week stay?<n><n>Rationales:<n>The renter pays $90/week to rent one room.<n>After the first week, the additional $8/day is added to $0.<n>At the end of the first week, total charges are $90+$8=$<<90+$8=$108>>108.<n>An additional $0 is charged for the second week.<n>After the second week, there is a total of $108+$0=$<<108+$0=$(108)>>108 charged for the second week to a renter, for a total of $216.<n><n>#### 216<n>Answer: 216<n><n>### Input : The time elapses until a train departs is 15 minutes after the hour (so, 12:15 will depart at 12:30). Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What would a person do if he or she just woke up? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where does a marmoset not usually go? Choices:  A: dictionary B: wilderness C: fly D: underground E: colorado<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>### Input<n>### Response<n>### Instruction<n><n>### Demostration<n>### Rationale<n>### Answer<n>

When x=<<x=100>>100, what is the amount, in thousands of thousands, that is required to construct the house?<n>Rationales:(The original) If x=<<x=60>>60, then $3x2+60-5=<<3 x2+ 60 - 5 =>> 360-10=<<360 - 10 = 350>>$350 is required to construct the housing unit, so if 350 were to change to an even larger number, then $400 or more is required in order to construct the housing unit.<n>Since 100 = <<100 =>> 10, the only possible result is $360 since the price cannot increase, since it follows the initial conditions, which states that a price-increase only occurs if the price is even.<n><n>#### $360<n>Answer:  $360<n><n>### Instructor:<n><n>### Student:<n><n><n>### Inputs:<n>- 3138995714853<n>- 75908920254<n>- 24873504541862<n>- 5798448303032<n>- 314758995781237<n><n><n>### Instrument:<n><n>### Input<n>- 99096<n>- 46030<n>- 21982<n>- 52312<n>- 21070<n><n>### Response<n><n>### Demostraction:<n><n>### Output:<n>#### 3070

Choices:  A, B, C, D, E.<n><n>### Input<n>A caravan of 3 tour buses is traveling at 240m/h east 1200 miles south from its origin. The tour buses will reach their destination at the same time, one hour from their origin.<n>Write the formula, and state the operation, necessary to solve the following  problem in terms of the input data.<n><n>The operation represented by the formula is the inverse of expt, that is, logarithm.<n>The expression of output is log(the number of minutes it will take to reach the destination)/log(the number of miles the trip is).<n>The tour buses should arrive within 10 hours after leaving the origin.<n><n>### Answer<n>Log(3,24,1200)=<<log(3,240,12000)=80,000>>80,00 <n><n>### Incorrect:<n>The operation represented by a formula is not the inverse of expt.<n><n>### Explanation:<n>There are two important notions that are needed to solve this.<n><n>* A logarithm is the exponent that when raised to a 1, the answer is its base.<n>* Two numbers are in fact logarithms if they satisfy log_b = log_a.<n><n>### Formula:<n>In the case of log2, any number raised to its base 2 will give the following result: log2<n><n>* log_2_3=3<n>* log_2 5=1<n><n>So 2^3=8 So 2^5=32<n><n>Now to solve for the other logarithmic, if log_a^b=r, then log^b_a is equal to r.<n><n>* log_a^b = r<n>* log^b_a=r<n><n>### Examples:<n>*  log_2_2 =1<n>* log_2  32 =7<n>* log_6_2 = 3<n><n>### Answer:<n>log(log_2_3)*log_2_5=log_2*log_2_3*log=log_2*5(2^3).<n>#### 42

It was a hot spot.<n><n>### Input The following numbers are written in scientific form: 10^-5, 20^-5, 50^-1, 10^-4. Write their exact form or equivalent.<n><n>### Response 10^(-5) and 20^(-5) are the same and their corresponding decimal form is the same. 10^(4) and 10^(-4) are the same and corresponding decimal form is the square root of 100:.5 or 50%.<n><n>### In this problem, there are $2^{20}$ computers in the network. If there are $2^{19}$ computers available, which event has the greatest impact on the network's operations?<n>	(A) The switches are in good shape and function properly<n>	(B) The server room is clean and fully stocked<n>	(C) There is a low percentage of viruses on machines<n>	(D) Firewall software is properly up-to-date<n>	The correct answer is (D).<n><n>	(E) The back-up server has crashed<n>	The correct answer (E). <n><n>### What is the approximate number of decimal places in this numerical expression:7.77⋅10^94.33225?<n><n>### Answer: 10^8, the decimal form being 8.77⋅12^54.3325<n><n>### Given the sequence of letters, I-L-L-L-S-S-S, which of the following sequences describes what comes next in the sequence?<n>	(A): L-I-S-S-L-I-S<n>	(B): S-I-L-L-I-O-S<n>	(C): S-I-I-I-S-L-S<n>	(D): S-L-L-B-L-L<n>	The correct answer can be seen in the answer choice. Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What place would a person go to look at zebras? Choices:  A: zoo B: museum C: hospital D: desk E: opera<n><n>### Response:		Answer the question that was asked, selecting a single answer from the choices provided.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>#### E<n>A zoo would be like the desk because you are sitting at your desk looking at zebras.<n>A zoo would be a museum because a person would be going to look at zebra’s.<n><n>#### C<n>A hospital would be like a museum because a hospital is a place you go to look at patients.<n>A hospital would be a museum because you would go to see zebra’s in a museum.<n><n>#### B<n>A museum would be like a hospital, because you would get a doctor’s note to prove that you would actually have gone to see the zebras.<n><n>#### A<n>A zoo would be the one like the desk, because you are looking at it on your desk.<n><n>#### D<n>A hospital would be where you would go to look at patients with zebra print on their sheets like a zebra.<n><n>### Criteria:<n>* Answer choices should all be plausible.<n>* Your answer should exhibit an understanding of the information in the instruction.<n>* Your answer is not simply a random response.<n>* Your answer was your own work.

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:I was shopping at a car dealership, what did a salesman do? What is the monthly cost of the security deposit? <n><n>Rationales:<n>Let $1=$1.0,$500=$500.0	<n><n>Then<n>1,400-500=<<1,400 - 500 = 900>>900<n>900/1=<<900/1 = 900 >> 900<n>Then 900/1/x=900/100x<n>Then 9/100x=<<9/100 x = 9/483>><n>9/483/1=<<19/483 = 19/251>>19/25<n>Then<n><n>9/25*12*9/483=<<9/25* 12*9/ 483=39/706>>39/70<n><n>Then 14/25(9/70)<n><n>### Answer:39/700<n><n>## Input:Cars that move at a constant speed of 60 miles per 5 hours travel a total of 300 miles to the west, and then 1,260 miles to the south.  If the combined total of traveling directly due west of 300 and due south of 1,266 miles<n>Rationales:First We need to know the unit that it is<n><n>Unit=300=<<300=1.5>><n><n>1.5*360=<<1.5 * 360=600>><n><n><n><n>Then We need to know 1.5*300*7 and then divide it by 1.5*600=<<1. 5*300

His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What corner areas have lots of windows? Choices:  A: wall B: office C: space shuttle D: front door E: tent<n><n>### Response:		A<n>Answer: A<n><n>### Input2:The car rental agency charges $350/wk for a car, or 125/day for a rental that is less than a week. A rental lasts eight days. How much, to the nearest dollar, did Jill pay for the car rental?<n><n>### Demnstration2:The first 7 days were: 125*7=<<125*7!=937>>937.<n>There were 8-7=<<8-7=1>>1 remaining days.<n>So the additional 8 days were 8*125=<<8*125!=1000>>1000.<n>And $937+1000=<<937+1,000=1,937>>1937.<n>#### 1937<n>Answer: 1937
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:A person would carry a large netted drawstring bag to what sort of place? Choices:  A: airport B: car C: jewelry store D: garbage can E: laundry room<n><n>### Response:		<n><n>#### 1. Answer the following multiple choice question:<n><n>#### Answer:<n><n>### Input A: When two people are debating an issue, they often begin by stating their beliefs out-loud, so that they will be better able to decide if they can support or defend those opinions.<n><n>### Response<n><n>#### Answer:The people are debating an issued, so they are not supporting their opinions, but they are trying to learn the others' opinions better and be able to support their own opinions, thus they use this strategy.<n><n>```<n>Answer: The strategy is called ________________<n>```<n><n>#### 2. A person who lives in the Alps can carry a large net-stringed drawstring bag to the airport, a car, a jewelry store, a garbage can, and a laundry room.<n><n>#### Answer:Because of the large bag they can take it to the garbage can and the laundry room. They can put the bag in the car, because it is hard to transport. They can go to the jewelry store and airport with it.<n><n>#### 3. The person in question is at the jewelry mall and would put a necklace in the bag and use it again in the garbage can.<n><n>#### Answer (Use only words from the previous question to answer this question.): When the person leaves the mall they will carry the necklace and their bag in the car to there homes. It is difficult because they must not drop anything because other people will steal the necklace.<n><n>#### 4. They will carry the bag on the stairway because it is heavy and difficult to store. They can store the bag on the stairs because the stairs are not as slippery as floors.<n><n>#### Answer(Use the most specific words you can): Because the floors are not as slipperd, they must carry it to the floor. They can not drop it because they do not want to spill food or any other things on the carpet.

Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Why would I want to be exercising? How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is the purpose of the cabin in an airplane? Choices:  A: crash B: living C: slow down D: carry people E: speed up<n><n>### Response:		C: slow down<n><n>### Explain:<n>A cabin refers to a place or area on a ship or plane that passengers can stay temporarily while on those types of vehicles.<n>Typically, a cabin on a plane is a small room with a door to protect passengers from loud, turbulent air and to keep others in the cabin. Sometimes the cabin does not have its own door, and the entrance to the cabins of most planes open just in front of the passenger seats.<n>Cabins on commercial planes are small and are only made for passengers, so they are also the only quiet places in the planes when the passengers are seated. It is not the purpose of a cabin to slow down a vehicle, though the purpose is to protect passengers from harmful noise and weather during flight.<n><n><n>### In a survey of 11 college students, 6% listed math as their favorite subject, 21% listed reading as their favorite subject, and 55% listed nothing. If at least one student chose each subject, how many more students chose nothing than chose reading as their favorite?<n><n>### Explaination:<n>The students who listed nothing were 11-2(6%/94%)=<<11-2(5*11)=35>>35 and they also listed reading. But there must be at least one person who did not state any favorite subject, so there are 11-35=<<11-35=-24>>-24 students who did not list any favorite subject.<n><n>The students who listed reading were 21%, or 2,5/11=<<2.5/11=02>>0.25 of the total students, so 21% of the 24 students who did'nt list any favorite subject are those who listed reading.<n>So 02+24+0.25=<<02+24=25.25>>25.25.<n>This means that 02+25.25=<<25.25-2=<0>0>0 students who listed maths as their favorite subject chose reading and 55 students who listed nothing as their favorite subject.<n><n><n><n><n><n>### Input : Choose the best answer for the following question: How many different five-letter words can
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where can you buy a binder? Choices:  A: college dorm B: back pack C: class room D: backpack E: office supply store<n><n>### Response:		A<n><n>Input:The length of a garden hose is 50 feet. If a garden hose is long enough to adequately reach the end of the vegetable garden that is 25 feet away from the house, how far, in feet, is the house from the hose?<n><n>### Rationales:To reach the vegetable garden, the length of the hose must be at least 25 feet, which means that the sum of the length of the hoses must at least equal or exceed 25 feet.<n><n>### Given: We know that the length of the hosing is 50 feet, so we know that the sum of the lengths of the hoses must be 50 feet or more since 25<50<n><n>### Solution: Therefore, the house is at least 25+25 feet away from end of the hose because 25+2+5=<<25+2+3=5>>5 feet.<n><n>#### 5<n><n>Answer: 5<n><n>Input: The car rental agency charges $50/day for a rental car, or $50/day less than the cost of renting a car for an extended period of time. A person rented one car for 4 days and another for 7 days. How much, with dollars and cents, did the person pay to rent two cars over the entire period of time?<n><n>### Solution<n>The cost over the entire period  of time  =<<4 days and 7 days>>4+7 days<n>The rental periods  =<<4 day and 7 day>>4+7=11<n><n>### Hence,<n><n>$$50/day * (11 days)$$<n><n>The person paid$$50/day* 5*11$$ = 5*550 = 2750<n><n>Answer: 2750 dollars<n>

Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What is a place that someone can go buy a teddy bear? Choices:  A: thrift store B: bed C: shelf D: home E: toy store<n><n>### Response:		Answer A for the teddy bear<n><n>### Instructions:For each question, choose an answer from the choices given.<n><n>### Input for questions:For a typical family of four, a gallon of milk costs $1.50, a head of lettuce costs $2, and a pound of hamburger costs $2.70. For each item purchased, the number of items increases by 1. A shopper must purchase these items for a total cost of $28.<n><n>#### The question says that for every item they buy, they buy one more. How many of each item do they buy to come up with the total? How much did they spend on hamburger altogether?<n><n>#### The answers they'll choose from for how much it cost will be 28 for hamburger, 28 for milk, 28 for lettuce, 8 for hamburger. How much was the total? What happens when they buy the last item of hamburger?<n><n>#### If a family of eight was buying these items, how much would they spend on each item? What is the total cost? You must explain your reasoning for each choice.<n><n>### Response for questions<n><n>#### They will have to buy 4 hamburgers and 8 heads of lettuce and 4 gallons of milk.<n>The cost for the hamburger will be 8*2.70=<<8*2.7=22.60>>22.60.<n>The cost for one head of lettuce will be 4*2=<<4*2=8>>8.<n>The cost for a gallon of milk will be 4*1.50=<<4*1.5=6>>6.<n>The total cost will be 22.60+8+6=<<22.608+6=28.60>>28.60.<n><n>#### When they buy the last item, it costs 4*1.40=<<4*2/1.40>>2/1.4=2.50<n><n>#### They will need to buy 8 hamburgers, 8 bags of lettuce, and 8 gallons of milk. Therefore their total cost will be 8*8*6=<<886=52
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:What do you do to hold loose papers together? Choices:  B: inch C: meter D: second E: hour<n>### Response:The correct choice is meter.<n>

How many solutions are possible? Rationales The options from column 1 are either 1, 2, or 3; or from column 2 from either 1, 3, or 4. So the options from the second column can only be 1, 2 or 3.  And the options from the third column can only be 2, 3, or...<n><n>### Answer: 3*3=<<3*3=9>>9.<n>The 3rd solution is possible if the last three options from the 3rd column are 5.<n><n>### Answer Key.<n>#### <n>#### <n>####  <n>#### <n>####     310  <n>#### <n>
