Choices:  A: sail boats B: question authority C: high fives D: share things E: learn from each other<n><n>### Response:		In the case that the answer is A, B, C, D, or E, enter the response choice (the only one allowed was 'D') and the rational as 'correct' or 'incorrect' as appropriate.<n>#### A<n>Rationales: Answer 'C'<n><n>#### B<n>Rationales:  Answer 'D' - high fives are not traveling along liquid - they are a nonliquid activity.<n><n>#### C<n>Rationales: Choice E is correct - the rationales are that people are sharing things when they're traveling along liquid.  <n><n>#### D<n>Rationales: A was incorrect.<n>B was incorrect.<n>C was incorrect.<n>E was incorrect.<n><n>### Input :A baseball player wants to get the most out of his $500 weekly allowance, so he plans to spend as little as possible eating out, buying clothes off the rack rather than having them tailored, and shopping for bargains. If his weekly budget for meals is $96, what is his budget for clothes? Choices:  (round off to the nearest cent).<n><n>### Response : In this situation, if the answer is A, enter the amount (10) and the rational as 'true'. If the answer is B, enter the amount (-96) and the rational as false. If the answer is C (50.50) enter the answer and the rational as true.<n><n>### Rationales:<n>A<n>The weekly budget of $96 for meals is $10 less than the weekly budget of $106 for clothes<n><n>B<n>$500-$96=<<$500-$106=96>>96 is the extra dollars left over after spending 106 on clothes<n><n>C<n>50.50  is correct (the nearest cent)<n><n>### Input :-Which of the following two statements has an error or omission? 1st Sentence: <<1st sentence>>In mathematics, the definition of prime numbers says that there's no other positive integer that matches the criteria for a prime number if the prime number is less than 2. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:The jar was plastic, just like most of the stuff in the kitchen.  John preferred glass, and wished he was somewhere else.  Where does he want to be? Choices:  A: cupboard B: anywhere else C: everything D: own home E: garbage dump<n><n>### Response:		I really want to be somewhere else, because I'm not used to my new house and I'm in a different part of town I've always lived in. So, I'm just going to live in the dumpsite so I can feel at home.<n><n>### Input The train's engine travels at a constant speed of 20 mph and the other cars that follow it travel at a constant speed of v ft/min. (v feet per minute.) Assume that all the cars of the train have the same speed.<n><n>    Which of the following is true for the number of minutes it takes to travel a distance d feet?<n>      A The speed of the train is d ft per minute.<n>      B The speed of the train plus all of the cars exceeds d ft per minute. <n>      C The speed of the train exceeds the sum of all the cars times d feet per minute.<n>      D The speed of the train times the number of cars is d ft per minute<n><n>### Rationale: The train's engine is travelling at a constant speed of _20ft/minute_ and the other cars that's following it is travelling at a _constant speed of_ (v feet per minute), so the answer to choice C is not true, because the sum of the speed of all the cars times the number of cars does not exceed the speed of the engine + the speed of the car, therefore option b is false. The speed of the train + all the cars does not exceed the distance of d feet per minute, so b is false again. Option a is false because the speed of the train is not the sum of the cars and distance. The speed of the other cars times the number of feet per minute does not exceed the speed the train, so d is false too; option d is not true.<n><n>### Answer: All of the other responses are false, so the correct response is C.<n><n>### Rationales: Speed of train = 20mph + _v feet per minute_ = _20mph + v feet per minute_ Speed of all cars = _∑ (v feet per minute)_ = _∑ _v feet per minute]_<n>Speed of all cars exceeding = _∑ _(v feet per minute) x d feet per minute_ <n>= _∑ _(v x d feet per minute)_ Exceeds = _
Below is an instruction that describes a task. Write a response that appropriately completes the request.<n><n>### Instruction:Answer the following multiple choice question.<n><n>### Demonstration:<n>Input: The car-rental agency charges $30/day for a car, or $190 for the first week for a rental that lasts an entire week or longer. Jennie rented a car for 11 days. How much, in dollars, did she pay for the rental?<n>Rationales: The first 7 days were $190.<n>There were 11-7=<<11-7=4>>4 days left.<n>The additional 4 days were 4*30=<<4*30=120>>120.<n>And 190+120=<<190+120=310>>310.<n>#### 310<n>Answer: 310<n><n>Input: A hurricane is approaching the southern coast of Texas, and a rancher is planning to move 400 head of cattle 60 miles to higher ground to protect them from possible inland flooding that might occur.  His animal transport truck holds 20 head of cattle.  Traveling at 60 miles per hour, what is the total driving time, in hours, it will take to transport all of his cattle to higher ground?<n>Rationales: Given the limited capacity of his transport vehicle (20 head of cattle), the 400 head of cattle will require 400/20=<<400/20=20>>20 trips using his transport vehicle.<n>Traveling to the site at 60 mph for 60 miles it will take 60/60=<<60/60=1>>1 hour to travel one-way.<n>Since each trip requires driving to and returning from the relocation site, each complete round trip will take 2*1=<<2*1=2>>2 hours.<n>Thus, 20 complete trips will take 20*2=<<20*2=40>>40 hours of driving time.<n>#### 40<n>Answer: 40<n><n>### Input:Where do you buy a glass of wine? Choices:  A: art show B: basement C: bar D: church E: basement<n><n>### Response:		I would like to go to art show. I heard that there is a very interesting glass wines that were made by local wineries. It looks very colorful, which I have never seen before. I am excited to taste them all with friends. What about you?<n>
